  4973                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4974                                  ;
  4975                                  ; Procedure Name : ABSDRD
  4976                                  ;
  4977                                  ; Interrupt 25 handler. Performs absolute disk read.
  4978                                  ; Inputs:	AL - 0-based drive number
  4979                                  ;		DS:BX point to destination buffer
  4980                                  ;		CX number of logical sectors to read
  4981                                  ;		DX starting logical sector number (0-based)
  4982                                  ; Outputs:	Original flags still on stack
  4983                                  ;		Carry set
  4984                                  ;		    AH error from BIOS
  4985                                  ;		    AL same as low byte of DI from INT 24
  4986                                  ;
  4987                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4988                                          ;procedure   ABSDRD,FAR
  4989                                  ABSDRD:
  4990                                  	; 15/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  4991                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:42E5h)
  4992                                  	; 04/11/2022
  4993                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 (DOSCODE:42D8h)
  4994                                  
  4995                                  	; 02/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  4996                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:43C4h
  4997                                  	
  4998                                  	;;;
  4999 00000541 30E4                    	xor     ah,ah	; ah=0		; Interrupt 25h handler (ah=0)
  5000 00000543 31F6                    	xor     si,si	; si=0		; clear read/write mode flags
  5001                                  					; (used with INT 21h ax=7305h)
  5002                                  FAT32_ABSDRD:	; ah=1 si=0 cf=0 (jump from '_$FAT32EXT')
  5003                                  	; 25/06/2024
  5004                                  	;cli ; *
  5005                                  	;clc ; not necessary
  5006                                  				; INT 21h
  5007                                  				;	AX = 7305h
  5008                                  				; FAT32 - EXTENDED ABSOLUTE DISK READ/WRITE
  5009                                  				;	CX = FFFFh
  5010                                  				;	DL = drive number (01h=A:, etc.)
  5011                                  				;	SI = read/write mode flags
  5012                                  				;	DS:BX -> disk I/O packet
  5013                                  				;
  5014                                  				; Extended Absolute Disk Read/Write mode flags:
  5015                                  				;
  5016                                  				;	Bit(s)  Description
  5017                                  				;	0	direction (0=read, 1=write)
  5018                                  				;	12-1	reserved (0)
  5019                                  				;	14-13	write type (should be 00 on reads).
  5020                                  				;		00 unknown data.
  5021                                  				;		01 FAT data.
  5022                                  				;		10 directory data.
  5023                                  				;		11 file data
  5024                                  				;	15     reserved (0)
  5025                                  				;
  5026                                  				; Format of disk read/write packet:
  5027                                  				;
  5028                                  				;	Offset Size    Description
  5029                                  				;	00h    DWORD   sector number
  5030                                  				;	04h    WORD    number of sectors to r/w
  5031                                  				;	06h    DWORD   transfer address
  5032                                  				;
  5033                                  				; ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List
  5034                                  	;;;
  5035                                  absdrd_1:
  5036                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
  5037                                  	; 25/06/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  5038 00000545 FA                      	CLI ; *
  5039                                  	
  5040                                  ;	set up ds to point to DOSDATA
  5041                                  
  5042 00000546 50                      	push	ax			; preserve AX value
  5043 00000547 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds			; store DS value in AX
  5044                                  	;getdseg <ds>
  5045 00000549 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  5046 0000054E A3[630D]                	mov	[TEMPSEG],ax		; store DS value in TEMPSEG
  5047 00000551 58                      	pop	ax			; restore AX value
  5048                                  
  5049                                  	; M072:
  5050                                  	; We shall save es on the user stack here. We need to use ES in
  5051                                  	; order to access the DOSDATA variables AbsRdWr_SS/SP at exit
  5052                                  	; time in order to restore the user stack.
  5053                                  
  5054 00000552 06                      	push	es  ; ****		; M072
  5055                                  
  5056                                  	; 25/06/2024
  5057                                  	; 02/01/2024 - Retrodos v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  5058                                  	;;;
  5059 00000553 7305                    	jnc	short absdrd_2		; (not jumped from ABSDWRT) absolute disk read
  5060                                  	
  5061                                  	;(jumped from ABSDRWT)
  5062 00000555 08E4                    	or	ah,ah
  5063 00000557 F9                      	stc				; absolute disk write
  5064 00000558 EB02                    	jmp	short absdrd_3
  5065                                  absdrd_2:
  5066 0000055A 08E4                    	or	ah,ah
  5067                                  absdrd_3:
  5068 0000055C 7510                    	jnz	short absdrd_4		; EXTENDED ABSOLUTE DISK READ/WRITE
  5069                                  	;;;
  5070                                  
  5071 0000055E 8C16[1B06]              	MOV	[AbsRdWr_SS],SS		; M013
  5072 00000562 8926[1D06]              	MOV	[AbsRdWr_SP],SP		; M013
  5073                                  
  5074                                  ; 	set up ss to point to DOSDATA
  5075                                  ;
  5076                                  ; NOTE! Due to an obscure bug in the 80286, you cannot use the ROMDOS
  5077                                  ; version of the getdseg macro with the SS register! An interrupt will
  5078                                  ; sneak through.
  5079                                  
  5080                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
  5081                                  	;getdseg <ss>			; cli in entry of routine
  5082                                  
  5083 00000566 2E8E16[0700]            	mov     ss,[cs:DosDSeg]
  5084                                  
  5085                                  ;else
  5086                                  ;	mov	ds, cs:[BioDataSeg]
  5087                                  ;	assume	ds:bdata
  5088                                  ;
  5089                                  ;	mov	ss, ds:[DosDataSg]
  5090                                  ;	assume	ss:DOSDATA
  5091                                  ;
  5092                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
  5093                                  					; 02/01/2024
  5094 0000056B BC[2009]                	MOV	SP,DSKSTACK	 	;"@#IBM:12.01.2003.build_1.32#@ IBMDOS.COM(USA)"
  5095                                  					; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  5096                                  absdrd_4:
  5097 0000056E 8E1E[630D]              	mov	ds,[TEMPSEG]		; restore DS value
  5098                                  
  5099 00000572 06                      	push	es ; *** (MSDOS 6.21)
  5100 00000573 E8F6FE                  	call	save_world		; save all regs
  5101                                  
  5102 00000576 06                      	PUSH	ES ; **
  5103                                  
  5104                                  	; 02/01/2024 - Retrodos v5.0
  5105                                  	;;;
  5106 00000577 7303                    	jnc	short absdrd_5		; absolute disk read
  5107 00000579 E9A400                  	jmp	absdrwt_3		; (jumping back to) absolute disk write
  5108                                  absdrd_5:
  5109                                  	;;;
  5110                                  
  5111 0000057C E86FFF                  	CALL	AbsSetup
  5112 0000057F 723D                    	JC	short ILEAVE
  5113                                  
  5114                                  	; Here is a gross temporary fix to get around a serious design flaw in
  5115                                  	;  the secondary cache. The secondary cache does not check for media
  5116                                  	;  changed (it should). Hence, you can change disks, do an absolute
  5117                                  	;  read, and get data from the previous disk. To get around this,
  5118                                  	;  we just won't use the secondary cache for absolute disk reads.
  5119                                  	;                                                      -mw 8/5/88
  5120                                  
  5121                                  	;EnterCrit critDisk
  5122 00000581 E81413                  	call	ECritDisk
  5123 00000584 36C606[0E11]FF          	MOV	byte [ss:CurSC_DRIVE],-1 ; invalidate SC  ;AN000;
  5124                                  	;LeaveCrit critDisk
  5125 0000058A E83813                  	call	LCritDisk
  5126                                  
  5127                                          ;invoke	DSKREAD
  5128 0000058D E83A39                  	CALL	DSKREAD
  5129 00000590 7513                            jnz	short ERR_LEAVE		;Jump if read unsuccessful.
  5130                                  
  5131 00000592 89F9                            mov	cx,di
  5132 00000594 368C1E[0E06]                    mov	[ss:TEMP_VAR2],ds
  5133 00000599 36891E[0C06]                    mov	[ss:TEMP_VAR],bx
  5134                                  
  5135                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors read. (These constitute a block of
  5136                                  ;            sectors, also termed an "Extent".)
  5137                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR]:DX = physical sector # of first sector in extent.
  5138                                  ;       [TEMP_VAR2]:[TEMP_VAR] = Transfer address (destination data address).
  5139                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).
  5140                                  ;
  5141                                  ;	The Buffer Queue must now be scanned: the contents of any dirty
  5142                                  ;	buffers must be "read" into the transfer memory block, so that the
  5143                                  ;       transfer memory reflects the most recent data.
  5144

  5220                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5221                                  ;
  5222                                  ; Procedure Name : ABSDWRT
  5223                                  ;
  5224                                  ; Interrupt 26 handler. Performs absolute disk write.
  5225                                  ; Inputs:	AL - 0-based drive number
  5226                                  ;		DS:BX point to source buffer
  5227                                  ;		CX number of logical sectors to write
  5228                                  ;		DX starting logical sector number (0-based)
  5229                                  ; Outputs:	Original flags still on stack
  5230                                  ;		Carry set
  5231                                  ;		    AH error from BIOS
  5232                                  ;		    AL same as low byte of DI from INT 24
  5233                                  ;
  5234                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5235                                          ;procedure   ABSDWRT,FAR
  5236                                  ABSDWRT:
  5237                                  	; 15/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5238                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:436Ch)
  5239                                  	; 04/11/2022
  5240                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 (DOSCODE:435Fh)
  5241                                  
  5242                                  	; 03/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  5243                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:4477h
  5244                                  
  5245                                  	;;;
  5246 000005F3 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah	; ah=0		; Interrupt 26h handler (ah=0)
  5247 000005F5 BE0100                  	mov	si,1			; set direction flag/bit to write
  5248                                  					; (used with INT 21h ax=7305h)
  5249                                  FAT32_ABSDWRT:	; ah=1 si=1 cf=0 (jump from '_$FAT32EXT')
  5250                                  
  5251                                  				; INT 21h
  5252                                  				;	AX = 7305h
  5253                                  				; FAT32 - EXTENDED ABSOLUTE DISK READ/WRITE
  5254                                  				;	CX = FFFFh
  5255                                  				;	DL = drive number (01h=A:, etc.)
  5256                                  				;	SI = read/write mode flags
  5257                                  				;	DS:BX -> disk I/O packet
  5258                                  				;
  5259                                  				; Extended Absolute Disk Read/Write mode flags:
  5260                                  				;
  5261                                  				;	Bit(s)  Description
  5262                                  				;	0	direction (0=read, 1=write)
  5263                                  				;	12-1	reserved (0)
  5264                                  				;	14-13	write type (should be 00 on reads).
  5265                                  				;		00 unknown data.
  5266                                  				;		01 FAT data.
  5267                                  				;		10 directory data.
  5268                                  				;		11 file data
  5269                                  				;	15     reserved (0)
  5270                                  				;
  5271                                  				; Format of disk read/write packet:
  5272                                  				;
  5273                                  				;	Offset Size    Description
  5274                                  				;	00h    DWORD   sector number
  5275                                  				;	04h    WORD    number of sectors to r/w
  5276                                  				;	06h    DWORD   transfer address
  5277                                  				;
  5278                                  				; ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List
  5279 000005F8 3C02                    	cmp	al,2
  5280 000005FA 7220                    	jb	short absdrwt_2	; floppy disk
  5281                                  	; hard disk
  5282 000005FC 53                      	push	bx
  5283 000005FD 1E                      	push	ds
  5284 000005FE 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  5285 00000603 30FF                    	xor	bh,bh
  5286 00000605 88C3                    	mov	bl,al			;
  5287                                  					; NOTE: PCDOS 7.1 kernel does not set
  5288                                  					; DOS_FLAG bit 6 or drive_flags bit 7
  5289                                  					; (It appears that these bits are set
  5290                                  					; by Windows or a system utility or
  5291                                  					; driver that knows the addresses of
  5292                                  					; these FLAGs in the DOSDATA segment.)
  5293                                  					; Erdogan Tan - 03/01/2024
  5294                                  					;
  5295 00000607 F687[1012]80            	test	byte [drive_flags+bx],80h 
  5296                                  					; test bit 7 (locked bit) ; 29/01/2024
  5297 0000060C 7505                    	jnz	short absdwrt_1		; locked (logical drive) -allowed to abs write-
  5298                                  					; NOTE: lock/unlock are MSDOS/PCDOS 7 extd functions
  5299 0000060E F606[8600]40            	test	byte [DOS_FLAG],40h	; test bit 6 (large disk support -windows- bit?)
  5300                                  					; (Windows OS running bit ?) ; 23/02/2024

  5325

  5327                                  	; We shall save es on the user stack here. We need to use ES in
  5328                                  	; order to access the DOSDATA variables AbsRdWr_SS/SP at exit
  5329                                  	; time in order to restore the user stack.
  5330

  5332                                  
  5333                                  	MOV	[AbsRdWr_SS],SS		; M013
  5334                                  	MOV	[AbsRdWr_SP],SP		; M013
  5335

  5337                                  	;
  5338                                  	; NOTE! Due to an obscure bug in the 80286, you cannot use the
  5339                                  	; ROMDOS version of the getdseg macro with the SS register!
  5340                                  	; An interrupt will sneak through.
  5341                                  
  5342                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
  5343                                  	;getdseg <ss>			; cli in entry of routine
  5344                                  	mov     ss,[cs:DosDSeg]
  5345                                  ;else
  5346                                  ;	mov	ds, cs:[BioDataSeg]
  5347                                  ;	assume	ds:bdata
  5348                                  ;

  5350                                  ;	assume	ss:DOSDATA
  5351                                  ;
  5352                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS

  5498                                  ;
  5499                                  ; These are the general system call exit mechanisms. All internal system

  5501                                  ; is to set the user's flags and set his AX register for return.

  5578                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5579                                  ;
  5580                                  ; Procedure Name : CAL_LK
  5581                                  ;
  5582                                  ; Inputs:
  5583                                  ;	SI is OFFSET in DOSDATA of CLASS,ACTION,LOCUS Table to use
  5584                                  ;		(DS NEED not be DOSDATA)
  5585                                  ;	[EXTERR] is set with error
  5586                                  ; Function:
  5587                                  ;	Look up and set CLASS ACTION and LOCUS values for GetExtendedError
  5588                                  ; Outputs:
  5589                                  ;	[EXTERR_CLASS] set
  5590                                  ;	[EXTERR_ACTION] set
  5591                                  ;	[EXTERR_LOCUS] set  (EXCEPT on certain errors as determined by table)
  5592                                  ; Destroys SI, FLAGS
  5593                                  ;
  5594                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5595                                  
  5596                                  	;procedure CAL_LK,NEAR
  5597                                  CAL_LK:

  5651                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5652                                  ;
  5653                                  ; Procedure Name : ETAB_LK
  5654                                  ;
  5655                                  ; Inputs:
  5656                                  ;	AX is error code
  5657                                  ;	[USER_IN_AX] has AH value of system call involved
  5658                                  ; Function:
  5659                                  ;	Make sure error code is appropriate to this call.

  5903                                  ; We have received a message from Win386. There are three possible
  5904                                  ; messages we could get from Win386:
  5905                                  ;
  5906                                  ; Init 		- for this, we set the IsWin386 flag and return a pointer
  5907                                  ;		  to the Win386 startup info structure.
  5908                                  ; Exit		- for this, we clear the IsWin386 flag.
  5909                                  ; DOSMGR query 	- for this, we need to indicate that instance data
  5910                                  ;		  has already been handled. this is indicated by setting
  5911                                  ;		  CX to a non-zero value.

  6486                                  
  6487                                  ;M044; Start of changes
  6488                                  ; Winoldap has a bug in that its calculations for the Windows memory image
  6489                                  ; to save is off by 1 para. This para can happen to be a Windows arena if the
  6490                                  ; DOS top of memory happens to be at an odd boundary (as is the case when
  6491                                  ; UMBs are present). This is because Windows builds its arenas only at even
  6492                                  ; para boundaries. This arena now gets trashed when Windows is swapped back
  6493                                  ; in leading to a crash. Winoldap issues callouts when it swaps Windows out
  6494                                  ; and back in. We sit on these callouts. On the Windows swapout, we save the
  6495                                  ; last para of the Windows memory block and then restore this para on the
  6496                                  ; Windows swapin callout. 
  6497                                  
  6498                                  getwinlast:
  6499                                  	; 07/12/2022
  6500 00000970 8B36[3003]              	mov	si,[CurrentPDB]
  6501 00000974 4E                      	dec	si
  6502 00000975 8EC6                    	mov	es,si
  6503 00000977 2603360300              	add	si,[es:3]
  6504 0000097C C3                      	retn
  6505                                  
  6506                                  ; 15/12/2022
  6507                                  %if 0
  6508                                  winold_swap:
  6509                                  	push	ds
  6510                                  	push	es
  6511                                  	push	si
  6512                                  	push	di
  6513                                  	push	cx
  6514                                  
  6515                                  	;getdseg <ds>			;ds = DOSDATA
  6516                                  	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  6517                                  
  6518                                  	cmp	al,1			;swap Windows out call
  6519                                  	jne	short swapin		;no, check if Swap in call
  6520                                  	call	getwinlast
  6521                                  	push	ds
  6522                                  	pop	es
  6523                                  	mov	ds,si			;ds = memory arena of Windows
  6524                                  	xor	si,si
  6525                                  	mov	di,WinoldPatch1
  6526                                  	mov	cx,8
  6527                                  	cld
  6528                                  	push	cx
  6529                                  	rep	movsb			;save first 8 bytes
  6530                                  	pop	cx
  6531                                  	mov	di,WinoldPatch2
  6532                                  	rep	movsb			;save next 8 bytes
  6533                                  	jmp	short winold_done
  6534                                  swapin:
  6535                                  	cmp	al,2			;swap Windows in call?
  6536                                  	jne	short winold_done	;no, something else, pass it on
  6537                                  	call	getwinlast
  6538                                  	mov	es,si
  6539                                  	xor	di,di
  6540                                  	mov	si,WinoldPatch1
  6541                                  	mov	cx,8
  6542                                  	cld
  6543                                  	push	cx
  6544                                  	rep	movsb			;restore first 8 bytes
  6545                                  	pop	cx
  6546                                  	mov	si,WinoldPatch2
  6547                                  	rep	movsb			;restore next 8 bytes
  6548                                  winold_done:
  6549                                  	pop	cx
  6550                                  	pop	di
  6551                                  	pop	si
  6552                                  	pop	es
  6553                                  	pop	ds
  6554                                  	jmp	next_i2f		;chain on
  6555                                  
  6556                                  %endif
  6557                                  
  6558                                  ;M044; End of changes
  6559

  6567                                  int_2Fh_1231h:

  6569 0000097E 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]

  6571 00000985 08D2                    	or	dl,dl
  6572 00000987 7507                    	jnz	short not_1231_dl_0
  6573 00000989 C606[460F]01            	mov	byte [IsWin386+1],1	; set byte after "IsWIN386" to 01h
  6574 0000098E EB1A                    	jmp	short int_2f_1231h_retn
  6575                                  
  6576                                  	;nop
  6577                                  
  6578                                  not_1231_dl_0:

  6580 00000993 7507                    	jne	short not_1231_dl_1	; clear "IsWIN386" bit 1
  6581 00000995 800E[450F]02            	or	byte [IsWin386],2	; set "IsWIN386" bit 1
  6582 0000099A EB0E                    	jmp	short int_2f_1231h_retn
  6583                                  
  6584                                  	;nop
  6585                                  
  6586                                  not_1231_dl_1:

  6588 0000099F 7507                    	jne	short not_1231_dl_2
  6589 000009A1 8026[450F]FD            	and	byte [IsWin386],0FDh	; clear bit 1
  6590 000009A6 EB02                    	jmp	short int_2f_1231h_retn
  6591                                  not_1231_dl_2:
  6592 000009A8 40                      	inc	ax              	; return error, ax = 1
  6593 000009A9 F9                      	stc
  6594                                  int_2f_1231h_retn:
  6595 000009AA 1F                      	pop	ds
  6596 000009AB C3                      	retn

  6796                                  ; DOSCODE:47E7h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) - 05/11/2022 -
  6797                                  
  6798                                  ;SUBTTL EDIT FUNCTION ASSIGNMENTS AND HEADERS
  6799                                  
  6800                                  ; The following two tables implement the current buffered input editing
  6801                                  ; routines. The tables are pairwise associated in reverse order for ease
  6802                                  ; in indexing. That is; The first entry in ESCTAB corresponds to the last
  6803                                  ; entry in ESCFUNC, and the last entry in ESCTAB to the first entry in ESCFUNC.
  6804                                  
  6805                                  	;PUBLIC	CANCHAR
  6806                                  CANCHAR:
  6807 00000A84 1B                      	DB	CANCEL	; 1Bh	;Cancel line character
  6808                                  	
  6809                                  	;PUBLIC	ESCCHAR
  6810                                  ESCCHAR:
  6811 00000A85 00                      	DB	ESCCH	; 0	;Lead-in character for escape sequences
  6812                                  	
  6813                                  	;IF	NOT Rainbow
  6814                                  
  6815                                  ESCTAB:	; LABEL BYTE
  6816                                  
  6817                                  	;IF	IBM
  6818 00000A86 40                      	DB	64		; Ctrl-Z - F6
  6819 00000A87 4D                      	DB	77		; Copy one char - -->
  6820 00000A88 3B                      	DB	59		; Copy one char - F1
  6821 00000A89 53                      	DB	83		; Skip one char - DEL
  6822 00000A8A 3C                      	DB	60		; Copy to char - F2
  6823 00000A8B 3E                      	DB	62		; Skip to char - F4
  6824 00000A8C 3D                      	DB	61		; Copy line - F3
  6825 00000A8D 3D                      	DB	61		; Kill line (no change to template ) - Not used
  6826 00000A8E 3F                      	DB	63		; Reedit line (new template) - F5
  6827 00000A8F 4B                      	DB	75		; Backspace - <--
  6828 00000A90 52                      	DB	82		; Enter insert mode - INS (toggle)
  6829 00000A91 52                      	DB	82		; Exit insert mode - INS (toggle)
  6830 00000A92 41                      	DB	65		; Escape character - F7
  6831 00000A93 41                      	DB	65		; End of table
  6832                                  	;ENDIF
  6833                                  
  6834                                  ESCEND: ; LABEL BYTE
  6835                                  
  6836                                  ESCTABLEN EQU ESCEND-ESCTAB
  6837                                  
  6838                                  ESCFUNC: ; LABEL WORD
  6839

  6858                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6859                                  ; DOSMES.ASM (MSDOS 2.11, 1983)
  6860                                  
  6861                                  ; OEMFunction key is expected to process a single function
  6862                                  ;   key input from a device and dispatch to the proper
  6863                                  ;   routines leaving all registers UNTOUCHED.
  6864                                  ;
  6865                                  ; Inputs:   CS, SS are DOSGROUP
  6866                                  ; Outputs:  None. This function is expected to JMP to onw of
  6867                                  ;           the following labels:
  6868                                  ;
  6869                                  ;           GetCh       - ignore the sequence
  6870                                  ;           TwoEsc      - insert an ESCChar in the buffer
  6871                                  ;           ExitIns     - toggle insert mode
  6872                                  ;           EnterIns    - toggle insert mode
  6873                                  ;           BackSp      - move backwards one space
  6874                                  ;           ReEdit      - reedit the line with a new template
  6875                                  ;           KilNew      - discard the current line and start from scratch
  6876                                  ;           CopyLin     - copy the rest of the template into the line
  6877                                  ;           SkipStr     - read the next character and skip to it in the template
  6878                                  ;           CopyStr     - read next char and copy from template to line until char
  6879                                  ;           SkipOne     - advance position in template one character
  6880                                  ;           CopyOne     - copy next character in template into line
  6881                                  ;           CtrlZ       - place a ^Z into the template
  6882                                  ; Registers that are allowed to be modified by this function are:
  6883                                  ;           AX, CX, BP
  6884                                  
  6885                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  6886                                  ; -------------------------------------
  6887                                  ; DOSCODE:4820h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  6888                                  
  6889                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  6890                                  ; -------------------------------------
  6891                                  ; DOSCODE:4813h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  6892                                  
  6893                                  ; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  6894                                  ; -------------------------------------
  6895                                  ; DOSCODE:4967h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
  6896                                  
  6897                                  OEMFunctionKey:
  6898 00000AB0 E8450E                  	CALL	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO	; Get the second byte of the sequence
  6899 00000AB3 B10E                    	MOV     CL,ESCTABLEN ; 14	; length of table for scan
  6900 00000AB5 57                      	PUSH    DI                      ; save DI (cannot change it!)
  6901 00000AB6 BF[860A]                	MOV     DI,ESCTAB		; offset of second byte table
  6902 00000AB9 06                      	push	es
  6903 00000ABA 0E                      	push	cs
  6904 00000ABB 07                      	pop	es
  6905 00000ABC F2AE                    	REPNE   SCASB                   ; Look it up in the table
  6906 00000ABE 07                      	pop	es
  6907 00000ABF 5F                      	POP     DI                      ; restore DI
  6908 00000AC0 D1E1                    	SHL     CX,1                    ; convert byte offset to word
  6909 00000AC2 89CD                    	MOV     BP,CX                   ; move to indexable register
  6910                                  	;JMP	word [BP+ESCFUNC]	; Go to the right routine
  6911 00000AC4 2EFFA6[940A]            	JMP	word [CS:BP+ESCFUNC]
  6912                                  
  6913                                  ;DOSCODE ENDS
  6914

  6922                                  ; Retro DOS v2.0 - 13/03/2018
  6923                                  
  6924                                  ;**	TIME.ASM - System Calls and low level routines for DATE and TIME
  6925                                  
  6926                                  	;BREAK <DATE AND TIME - SYSTEM CALLS 42,43,44,45>
  6927                                  
  6928                                  ;**	$GET_DATE - Get Current Date
  6929                                  ;----------------------------------------
  6930                                  ;	ENTRY	none
  6931                                  ;	EXIT	(cx:dx) = current date
  6932                                  ;	USES	all
  6933                                  
  6934                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  6935                                  ; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified MSDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)	
  6936                                  
  6937                                  _$GET_DATE:	;System call 42
  6938                                  
  6939 00000AC9 16                      	PUSH	SS
  6940 00000ACA 1F                      	POP	DS
  6941 00000ACB E8AD00                  	CALL	READTIME	;Check for rollover to next day
  6942 00000ACE A1[5203]                	MOV	AX,[YEAR]
  6943                                  
  6944                                  ;	WARNING!!!! DAY and MONTH must be adjacently allocated!
  6945                                  
  6946 00000AD1 8B1E[5003]              	MOV	BX,[DAY]	; fetch both day and month

  7347                                  ;**	DSUM - Compute the sum of a string of bytes
  7348                                  ;
  7349                                  ;	ENTRY	(cx) = byte count
  7350                                  ;		(ds:si) = byte address
  7351                                  ;		(dx) = sum register, initialized by caller
  7352                                  ;	EXIT	(dx) updated
  7353                                  ;	USES	ax, cx, dx, si, flags
  7354                                  
  7355                                  DSUM:
  7356 00000C83 B400                    	MOV	AH,0
  7357 00000C85 E305                    	JCXZ	DSUM9 ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7358                                  	;JCXZ	RET25 ; 18/07/2018
  7359                                  DSUM1:
  7360 00000C87 AC                      	LODSB
  7361 00000C88 01C2                    	ADD	DX,AX
  7362 00000C8A E2FB                    	LOOP	DSUM1
  7363                                  DSUM9:

  7374                                  ;TITLE	GETSET - GETting and SETting MS-DOS system calls
  7375                                  ;NAME	GETSET
  7376                                  
  7377                                  ;CODE	SEGMENT BYTE PUBLIC  'CODE'
  7378                                  ;       ASSUME  SS:DOSGROUP,CS:DOSGROUP
  7379                                  
  7380                                  ;USERNUM:
  7381                                  ;	DW	0			; 24 bit user number
  7382                                  ;       DB      0
  7383                                  ;;	IF      IBM
  7384                                  ;;OEMNUM: DB    0			; 8 bit OEM number
  7385                                  ;;	ELSE
  7386                                  ;OEMNUM: DB     0FFH			; 8 bit OEM number
  7387                                  ;;	ENDIF
  7388                                  
  7389                                  ;MSVERS:		; MS-DOS version in hex for $GET_VERSION
  7390                                  ;; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  7391                                  ;MSMAJOR: DB	MAJOR_VERSION	; DOS_MAJOR_VERSION
  7392                                  ;MSMINOR: DB	MINOR_VERSION	; DOS_MINOR_VERSION  
  7393                                  
  7394                                  ;BREAK <$Get_Version -- Return MSDOS version number>
  7395                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  7403                                  _$GET_VERSION:
  7404                                  
  7405                                  ; Inputs:
  7406                                  ;       None
  7407                                  ; Function:
  7408                                  ;       Return MS-DOS version number
  7409                                  ; Outputs:
  7410                                  ;       OEM number in BH
  7411                                  ;       User number in BL:CX (24 bits)
  7412                                  ;       Version number as AL.AH in binary
  7413                                  ;       NOTE: On pre 1.28 DOSs AL will be zero
  7414                                  
  7415                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
  7416                                  ;
  7417                                  ;	Fake_Count is used to lie about the version numbers to support
  7418                                  ;	old binarys. See ms_table.asm for more info.
  7419                                  ;
  7420                                  ;		if input al = 00
  7421                                  ;		  (bh) = OEM number			
  7422                                  ;		else if input al = 01
  7423                                  ;		  (bh) = version flags
  7424                                  ;		 
  7425                                  ;		       	 bits 0-2 = DOS internal revision
  7426                                  ;		       	 bits 3-7 = DOS type flags
  7427                                  ;		              bit 3    = DOS is in ROM
  7428                                  ;		              bit 4    = DOS in in HMA
  7429                                  ;		              bits 5-7 = reserved
  7430                                  ;               M007 change - only bit 3 is now valid. Other bits
  7431                                  ;               are 0 when AL = 1
  7432                                  
  7433                                  	; 06/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7434 00000C8D 36C50E[B203]            	lds	cx, [ss:USERNUM]
  7435 00000C92 8CDB                    	mov	bx, ds
  7436

  7438                                  	;--------------------------------------
  7439                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, DOSCODE:4A1Ch)

  7442 00000C95 1F                              POP     DS
  7443

  7446                                          ;MOV	CX,[USERNUM]
  7447                                  
  7448                                  	; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7449                                  
  7450                                  	;If AL == 1, ROMDOS will return BH = dos internal version # &
  7451                                  	;DOS flags
  7452

  7454 00000C98 7502                    	jne	short Norm_Vers
  7455                                  
  7456                                  ;ifdef ROMDOS
  7457                                  ;	mov	BH,DOSINROM 	; Just set the bit for ROM version
  7458                                  ;				(DOSINROM = 8)
  7459                                  ;else
  7460 00000C9A 30FF                            xor     bh,bh		; Otherwise return 0
  7461                                  ;endif				;M007 end
  7462

  7472                                  	;mov	ax,[40h]

  7479                                  				; stack addressed by DS:SI

  7526                                  ;BREAK <$International - return country-dependent information>
  7527                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7528                                  ;
  7529                                  ; Procedure Name : $INTERNATIONAL
  7530                                  ;
  7531                                  ; Inputs:
  7532                                  ;	MOV	AH,International
  7533                                  ;	MOV	AL,country	(al = 0 => current country)
  7534                                  ;      [MOV	BX,country]
  7535                                  ;	LDS	DX,block
  7536                                  ;	INT	21
  7537                                  ; Function:
  7538                                  ;	give users an idea of what country the application is running
  7539                                  ; Outputs:
  7540                                  ;	IF DX != -1 on input (get country)
  7541                                  ;	  AL = 0 means return current country table.
  7542                                  ;	  0<AL<0FFH means return country table for country AL
  7543                                  ;	  AL = 0FF means return country table for country BX
  7544                                  ;	  No Carry:
  7545                                  ;	     Register BX will contain the 16-bit country code.
  7546                                  ;	     Register AL will contain the low 8 bits of the country code.
  7547                                  ;	     The block pointed to by DS:DX is filled in with the information
  7548                                  ;	     for the particular country.
  7549                                  ;		BYTE  Size of this table excluding this byte and the next
  7550                                  ;		BYTE  Country code represented by this table
  7551                                  ;			A sequence of n bytes, where n is the number specified
  7552                                  ;			by the first byte above and is not > internat_block_max,
  7553                                  ;			in the correct order for being returned by the
  7554                                  ;			INTERNATIONAL call as follows:
  7555                                  ;		WORD	Date format 0=mdy, 1=dmy, 2=ymd
  7556                                  ;		5 BYTE	Currency symbol null terminated
  7557                                  ;		2 BYTE	thousands separator null terminated
  7558                                  ;		2 BYTE	Decimal point null terminated
  7559                                  ;		2 BYTE	Date separator null terminated
  7560                                  ;		2 BYTE	Time separator null terminated
  7561                                  ;		1 BYTE	Bit field.  Currency format.
  7562                                  ;			Bit 0.	=0 $ before #  =1 $ after #
  7563                                  ;			Bit 1.	no. of spaces between # and $ (0 or 1)
  7564                                  ;		1 BYTE	No. of significant decimal digits in currency
  7565                                  ;		1 BYTE	Bit field.  Time format.
  7566                                  ;			Bit 0.	=0 12 hour clock  =1 24 hour
  7567                                  ;		DWORD	Call address of case conversion routine
  7568                                  ;		2 BYTE	Data list separator null terminated.
  7569                                  ;	  Carry:
  7570                                  ;	     Register AX has the error code.
  7571                                  ;	IF DX = -1 on input (set current country)
  7572                                  ;	  AL = 0 is an error
  7573                                  ;	  0<AL<0FFH means set current country to country AL
  7574                                  ;	  AL = 0FF means set current country to country BX
  7575                                  ;	  No Carry:
  7576                                  ;	    Current country SET
  7577                                  ;	    Register AL will contain the low 8 bits of the country code.
  7578                                  ;	  Carry:
  7579                                  ;	     Register AX has the error code.
  7580                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7581                                  
  7582                                  ;procedure   $INTERNATIONAL,NEAR   ; DOS 3.3
  7583                                  
  7584                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7585                                  ; DOSCODE:4A4Dh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  7586                                  
  7587                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  7588                                  ; DOSCODE:4A40h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  7589                                  
  7590                                  ; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 PCDOS.COM)
  7591                                  ; DOSCODE:4B8Dh (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)

  7787                                  _$ExtCountryInfo:
  7788                                  			; INT 21h, AH = 70h
  7789                                  			; GET/SET INTERNATIONALIZATION INFORMATION
  7790                                  			; ****
  7791                                  			; AL = subfunction
  7792                                  			; 00h SET general internationalization info
  7793                                  			;    CX = buffer size (up to 38 bytes)
  7794                                  			;    DS:SI -> buffer containing internationalization info
  7795                                  			;  first three bytes are skipped, the rest is copied to
  7796                                  			;  somewhere in the DOS data segment
  7797                                  			; 01h SET extended internationalization info
  7798                                  			;    CX = number of bytes to set (up to 58 bytes)
  7799                                  			;    DS:SI -> buffer containing internationalization info
  7800                                  			; 02h GET extended internationalization info
  7801                                  			;    CX = buffer size in bytes (up to 58 bytes used)
  7802                                  			;    ES:DI -> buffer
  7803                                  			; ****
  7804                                  			; (Ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List) - had some mistakes -
  7805 00000D3E 3C02                    	cmp	al,2 
  7806 00000D40 77F8                    	ja	short errtn2
  7807 00000D42 06                      	push    es
  7808 00000D43 16                      	push    ss
  7809 00000D44 750F                    	jnz	short ext_cntry_inf_1
  7810 00000D46 07                      	pop	es		; AX = GET 35 bytes info (from offset 3 to 37)
  7811                                  				; (38 bytes buffer is used)
  7812 00000D47 BF[9A11]                	mov	di,_COUNTRY_ID
  7813 00000D4A 268B45FE                	mov	ax,[es:di-2]	; NEW_COUNTRY_SIZE = 38
  7814 00000D4E BB0300                  	mov	bx,3		; skip the 1st 3 bytes of the buffer
  7815 00000D51 01DE                    	add	si,bx
  7816 00000D53 EB13                    	jmp	short ext_cntry_inf_4
  7817                                  
  7818                                  ext_cntry_inf_1:
  7819 00000D55 FEC8                    	dec	al
  7820 00000D57 7506                    	jnz	short ext_cntry_inf_2 ; AX = 2
  7821                                  				; AX = 1 (set)
  7822 00000D59 07                      	pop	es
  7823 00000D5A BF[C211]                	mov	di,_ENU		; "ENU"
  7824 00000D5D EB04                    	jmp	short ext_cntry_inf_3
  7825                                  
  7826                                  ext_cntry_inf_2:
  7827 00000D5F 1F                      	pop	ds		; AX = 2 (get)
  7828 00000D60 BE[C211]                	mov	si,_ENU		; "ENU"
  7829                                  
  7830                                  ext_cntry_inf_3:		; CODE XREF: DOSCODE:4C2F^j
  7831 00000D63 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; 0
  7832 00000D65 B83A00                  	mov	ax,58		; 3Ah
  7833                                  
  7834                                  ext_cntry_inf_4:
  7835 00000D68 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax		; > 38 ? (58)
  7836                                  	;jb	short ext_cntry_inf_5 ; no
  7837 00000D6A 7602                    	jna	short ext_cntry_inf_5 ; 06/01/2024
  7838 00000D6C 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax		; yes, decrease size to 38 (58)
  7839                                  
  7840                                  ext_cntry_inf_5:
  7841 00000D6E 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx		; buffer (filled) size
  7842 00000D70 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx		; copy byte count
  7843 00000D72 F3A4                    	rep movsb
  7844 00000D74 07                      	pop	es
  7845 00000D75 E91D03                  	jmp	ret_ax_to_user_cx ; ax -> user's cx

  7851                                  ;BREAK <$GetExtCntry - return extended country-dependent information>
  7852                                  
  7853                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7854                                  ;
  7855                                  ; Procedure Name : $GetExtCntry
  7856                                  ;
  7857                                  ; Inputs:
  7858                                  ;	if AL >= 20H
  7859                                  ;	  AL= 20H    capitalize single char, DL= char
  7860                                  ;	      21H    capitalize string, CX= string length
  7861                                  ;	      22H    capitalize ASCIIZ string
  7862                                  ;	      23H    YES/NO check, DL=1st char DH= 2nd char (DBCS)

  7866                                  ;
  7867                                  ;	else

  8320                                  ;BREAK <$Get_Drive_Freespace -- Return bytes of free disk space on a drive>
  8321                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8322                                  ;**	$Get_Drive_Freespace - Return amount of drive free space
  8323                                  ;
  8324                                  ;	$Get_Drive_Freespace returns the # of free allocation units on a
  8325                                  ;		drive.
  8326                                  ;
  8327                                  ;	This call returns the same info in the same registers (except for the

  8562                                  ;**	$Char_Oper - Manipulate Switch Character
  8563                                  ;
  8564                                  ;	This function was put in to facilitate XENIX path/switch compatibility
  8565                                  ;
  8566                                  ;	ENTRY	AL = function:
  8567                                  ;		    0 - read switch char
  8568                                  ;		    1 - set switch char (char in DL)
  8569                                  ;		    2 - read device availability
  8570                                  ;			Always returns available
  8571                                  ;		    3 - set device availability
  8572                                  ;			No longer supported (NOP)
  8573                                  ;	EXIT	(al) = 0xff iff error
  8574                                  ;		(al) != 0xff if ok
  8575                                  ;		  (dl) = character/flag, if "read switch char" subfunction
  8576                                  ;	USES	AL, DL
  8577                                  ;
  8578                                  ;	NOTE	This already obsolete function has been deactivated in DOS 5.0
  8579                                  ;		The character / is always returned for subfunction 0,
  8580                                  ;		subfunction 2 always returns -1, all other subfunctions are ignored.
  8581                                  
  8582                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8583                                  ; DOSCODE:4CC9h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  8584                                  
  8585                                  ; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  8586                                  ; DOSCODE:4CBCh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  8587                                  
  8588                                  _$CHAR_OPER:

  8592 00000F9A 7407                    	jz	short chop_1			; jump if yes
  8593 00000F9C 3C02                    	cmp	al,2				; check device availability?
  8594 00000F9E B2FF                    	mov	dl,-1				; assume yes
  8595 00000FA0 7401                    	jz	short chop_1			; jump if yes
  8596 00000FA2 C3                      	retn					; otherwise just quit

  8604 00000FA9 C3                      	retn

  8632                                  ;**	$GetExtendedError - Return Extended error code
  8633                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8634                                  ;	This function reads up the extended error info from the static
  8635                                  ;	variables where it was stored.
  8636                                  ;
  8637                                  ;	ENTRY	none
  8638                                  ;	EXIT	AX = Extended error code (0 means no extended error)
  8639                                  ;		BL = recommended action
  8640                                  ;		BH = class of error
  8641                                  ;		CH = locus of error
  8642                                  ;		ES:DI = may be pointer
  8643                                  ;	USES	ALL
  8644

  8646

  8649 00000FAB 1F                      	pop	ds

  8651 00000FAF C43E[2803]              	LES	DI,[EXTERRPT]
  8652 00000FB3 8B1E[2603]              	MOV	BX,[EXTERR_ACTION]	; BL = Action, BH = Class
  8653 00000FB7 8A2E[2303]              	MOV	CH,[EXTERR_LOCUS]
  8654 00000FBB E8CDF4                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  8655                                  	;mov	[si+0Ah],di
  8656 00000FBE 897C0A                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_DI],DI

  8658                                  	; 09/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

  8666 00000FC4 894C04                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_CX],CX

  8693                                  
  8694                                  ;BREAK	<ECS_call - Extended Code System support function>
  8695                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8696                                  ; Inputs:
  8697                                  ;	AL = 0	get lead byte table
  8698                                  ;		on return DS:SI has the table location
  8699                                  ;
  8700                                  ;	AL = 1	set / reset interim console flag
  8701                                  ;		DL = flag (00H or 01H)
  8702                                  ;		no return
  8703                                  ;
  8704                                  ;	AL = 2	get interim console flag
  8705                                  ;		on return DL = current flag value
  8706                                  ;
  8707                                  ;	AL = OTHER then error, and returns with:
  8708                                  ;		AX = error_invalid_function
  8709                                  ;
  8710                                  ;  NOTE: THIS CALL DOES GUARANTEE THAT REGISTER OTHER THAN
  8711                                  ;	 SS:SP WILL BE PRESERVED!
  8712                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8713                                  
  8714                                  _$ECS_Call:
  8715 00000FCA 08C0                    	or	al,al			; AL = 0 (get table)?
  8716                                  	;jnz	short _okok
  8717                                  	; 15/12/2022
  8718 00000FCC 7403                    	jz	short get_lbt
  8719                                  ;_okok:
  8720 00000FCE E9AEF6                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
  8721                                  get_lbt:
  8722 00000FD1 E8B7F4                  	call	Get_User_Stack		; *
  8723

  9247                                  ; System calls for parsing command lines
  9248                                  ;
  9249                                  ;   $PARSE_FILE_DESCRIPTOR
  9250                                  ;
  9251                                  ;   Modification history:
  9252                                  ;
  9253                                  ;       Created: ARR 30 March 1983
  9254                                  ;               EE PathParse 10 Sept 1983
  9255                                  ;
  9256                                  
  9257                                  ;BREAK <$Parse_File_Descriptor -- Parse an arbitrary string into an FCB>
  9258                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9259                                  ; Inputs:
  9260                                  ;       DS:SI Points to a command line
  9261                                  ;       ES:DI Points to an empty FCB
  9262                                  ;       Bit 0 of AL = 1 At most one leading separator scanned off
  9263                                  ;                   = 0 Parse stops if separator encountered
  9264                                  ;       Bit 1 of AL = 1 If drive field blank in command line - leave FCB
  9265                                  ;                   = 0  "    "    "     "         "      "  - put 0 in FCB
  9266                                  ;       Bit 2 of AL = 1 If filename field blank - leave FCB
  9267                                  ;                   = 0  "       "      "       - put blanks in FCB
  9268                                  ;       Bit 3 of AL = 1 If extension field blank - leave FCB
  9269                                  ;                   = 0  "       "      "        - put blanks in FCB
  9270                                  ; Function:
  9271                                  ;       Parse command line into FCB
  9272                                  ; Returns:
  9273                                  ;       AL = 1 if '*' or '?' in filename or extension, 0 otherwise
  9274                                  ;       DS:SI points to first character after filename
  9275                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9276                                  
  9277                                  	; 13/01/2024
  9278                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:51BFh
  9279                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:4D22h
  9280                                  
  9281                                  _$PARSE_FILE_DESCRIPTOR:
  9282 000012C3 E8F445                  	call	MAKEFCB
  9283 000012C6 56                      	PUSH    SI
  9284 000012C7 E8C1F1                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  9285                                  	;pop	word [si+8]
  9286 000012CA 8F4408                  	POP     word [SI+user_env.user_SI]
  9287 000012CD C3                      	retn
  9288                                  
  9289                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9290                                  ; 13/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:51CAh)
  9291                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9292

  9333                                  ;**	$SLEAZEFUNC - Get a Pointer to the Media Byte
  9334                                  ;
  9335                                  ;	Return Stuff sort of like old get fat call
  9336                                  ;
  9337                                  ;	ENTRY	none
  9338                                  ;	EXIT	DS:BX = Points to FAT ID byte (IBM only)
  9339                                  ;			GOD help anyone who tries to do ANYTHING except
  9340                                  ;			READ this ONE byte.
  9341                                  ;		DX = Total Number of allocation units on disk
  9342                                  ;		CX = Sector size
  9343                                  ;		AL = Sectors per allocation unit
  9344                                  ;		   = -1 if bad drive specified
  9345                                  ;	USES	all
  9346                                  ;
  9347                                  ;**	$SLEAZEFUNCDL - Get a Pointer to the Media Byte
  9348                                  ;
  9349                                  ;	Identical to $SLEAZEFUNC except (dl) = drive
  9350                                  ;
  9351                                  ;	ENTRY	(dl) = drive (0=default, 1=A, 2=B, etc.)
  9352                                  ;	EXIT	DS:BX = Points to FAT ID byte (IBM only)
  9353                                  ;			GOD help anyone who tries to do ANYTHING except
  9354                                  ;			READ this ONE byte.
  9355                                  ;		DX = Total Number of allocation units on disk
  9356                                  ;		CX = Sector size
  9357                                  ;		AL = Sectors per allocation unit
  9358                                  ;		   = -1 if bad drive specified
  9359                                  ;	USES	all
  9360                                  ;
  9361                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9362                                  ;
  9363                                  	; 10/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0

  9379

  9386 000012F6 8826[9805]              	MOV	[FATBYTE],AH	; FAT (MEDIA) ID byte

  9390 000012FA 30E4                    	xor     ah, ah		; AH = 0
  9391                                  				; AL = sectors per cluster
  9392 000012FC 57                      	push    di		; di:bx = number of clusters
  9393 000012FD E81A05                  	call    TestNet
  9394 00001300 5F                      	pop     di
  9395 00001301 7205                    	jc      short sleazefunc1
  9396 00001303 51                      	push    cx		; bytes per sector
  9397 00001304 E89320                  	call    modify_cluster_count
  9398 00001307 59                      	pop     cx		; ax = sectors per cluster (modified)
  9399                                  				; dx = number of clusters (modified)
  9400                                  				; if bytes per cluster > 16384
  9401                                  				;    and hw of cluster count > 0
  9402                                  				;    bx = 0FFFEh (invalidated parm sign)
  9403                                  sleazefunc1:
  9404                                  	;;;
  9405                                  
  9406                                  ; NOTE THAT A FIXED MEMORY CELL IS USED --> THIS CALL IS NOT
  9407                                  ; RE-ENTRANT. USERS BETTER GET THE ID BYTE BEFORE THEY MAKE THE
  9408                                  ; CALL AGAIN
  9409                                  
  9410                                  	;MOV	DI,FATBYTE

  9414                                  	;mov	[si+4],cx
  9415                                  	;mov	[si+6],bx
  9416                                  	;mov	[si+2],di
  9417 0000130B 894C04                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_CX],CX
  9418 0000130E 895C06                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_DX],BX

 10047                                  setend:
 10048                                  ;	M008 - CAS
 10049                                  ;
 10050                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10051                                  	inc	bx
 10052                                  	;INC	AX			; +2 (reserved), -1 (count -> max)
 10053                                  ;
 10054                                  ;	There has been a bug in our fatsize calculation for so long
 10055                                  ;	  that we can't correct it now without causing some user to
 10056                                  ;	  experience data loss. There are even cases where allowing
 10057                                  ;	  the number of clusters to exceed the fats is the optimal
 10058                                  ;	  case -- where adding 2 more fat sectors would make the
 10059                                  ;	  data field smaller so that there's nothing to use the extra
 10060                                  ;	  fat sectors for.
 10061                                  ;
 10062                                  ;	Note that this bug had very minor known symptoms. CHKDSK would
 10063                                  ;	  still report that there was a cluster left when the disk was
 10064                                  ;	  actually full. Very graceful failure for a corrupt system
 10065                                  ;	  configuration. There may be worse cases that were never
 10066                                  ;	  properly traced back to this bug. The problem cases only
 10067                                  ;	  occurred when partition sizes were very near FAT sector
 10068                                  ;	  rounding boundaries, which were rare cases.
 10069                                  ;
 10070                                  ;	Also, it's possible that some third-party partition program might
 10071                                  ;	  create a partition that had a less-than-perfect FAT calculation
 10072                                  ;	  scheme. In this hypothetical case, the number of allocation
 10073                                  ;	  clusters which don't actually have FAT entries to represent
 10074                                  ;	  them might be larger and might create a more catastrophic
 10075                                  ;	  failure. So we'll provide the safeguard of limiting the
 10076                                  ;	  max_cluster to the amount that will fit in the FATs.
 10077                                  ;
 10078                                  ;	ax = maximum legal cluster, ES:BP -> dpb
 10079                                  
 10080                                  ;	make sure the number of fat sectors is actually enough to
 10081                                  ;	  hold that many clusters. otherwise, back the number of
 10082                                  ;	  clusters down
 10083                                  
 10084                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10085                                  	; bx = number of clusters
 10086                                  
 10087                                  	; 19/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 10088                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 10089                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10090                                  	;mov	bx,ax			; remember calculated # clusters
 10091                                  
 10092                                  	; 01/08/2018 (MSDOS 3.3)
 10093                                  	;mov	al,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]
 10094                                  	;xor	ah,ah 
 10095                                  
 10096                                  	; 10/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10097                                  	;mov	ax,[ES:BP+0Fh]
 10098                                  	mov	ax,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]
 10099                                  
 10100                                  	;mul	word [es:bp+2]	
 10101                                  	mul	word [ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE] ; how big is the FAT?
 10102                                  	cmp	bx,4096-10  ; 0FF6h	; test for 12 vs. 16 bit fat
 10103                                  	jb	short setend_fat12
 10104                                  	shr	dx,1
 10105                                  
 10106                                  ; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 10107                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10108                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10109                                  	jnz	short setend_faterr	; some bonehead gave us more fatspace
 10110                                  					; than enough for the maximum FAT,
 10111                                  					; so go ahead and use the calculated
 10112                                  					; number of clusters.
 10113                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10114                                  
 10115                                  	rcr	ax,1			; find number of entries
 10116                                  	cmp	ax,4096-10+1		; would this truncation move us
 10117                                  ;					;  into 12-bit fatland?
 10118                                  	jb	short setend_faterr	; then go ahead and let the
 10119                                  ;					;  inconsistency pass through
 10120                                  ;					;  rather than lose data by
 10121                                  ;					;  correcting the fat type
 10122                                  	jmp	short setend_fat16
 10123                                  
 10124                                  setend_fat12:
 10125                                  	add	ax,ax			; (fatsiz*2)/3 = # of fat entries
 10126                                  	adc	dx,dx
 10127                                  
 10128                                  ; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 10129                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10130                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10131                                  	cmp	dx,3			; if our fatspace is WAY more than
 10132                                  	jnb	short setend_faterr	; we need, we may get an overflow
 10133                                  					; here. Check for it and use
 10134                                  					; the calculated size in this case.
 10135                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10136                                  
 10137                                  	div	word [cs:word3]
 10138                                  
 10139                                  setend_fat16:
 10140                                  	dec	ax			; limit at 1
 10141                                  	cmp	ax,bx			; is fat big enough?
 10142                                  	jbe	short setend_fat	; use max value that'll fit
 10143                                  
 10144                                  setend_faterr:
 10145                                  	mov	ax,bx			; use calculated value
 10146                                  
 10147                                  setend_fat:
 10148                                  
 10149                                  ;	now ax = maximum legal cluster
 10150                                  
 10151                                  ;	end M008

 10643                                  
 10644                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10645                                  ; Inputs:
 10646                                  ;	AX = Size of memory in paragraphs
 10647                                  ;	DX = Segment
 10648                                  ; Function:
 10649                                  ;	Completely prepares a program base at the
 10650                                  ;	specified segment.
 10651                                  ; Called at DOS init
 10652                                  ; Outputs:
 10653                                  ;	DS = DX
 10654                                  ;	ES = DX
 10655                                  ;	[0] has INT int_abort
 10656                                  ;	[2] = First unavailable segment
 10657                                  ;	[5] to [9] form a long call to the entry point
 10658                                  ;	[10] to [13] have exit address (from int_terminate)
 10659                                  ;	[14] to [17] have ctrl-C exit address (from int_ctrl_c)
 10660                                  ;	[18] to [21] have fatal error address (from int_fatal_abort)
 10661                                  ; DX,BP unchanged. All other registers destroyed.
 10662                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 10670                                  	;mov	si,88h
