 10682 000016CF B8FF0F                  	MOV	AX,MAXDIF
 10683                                  HAVDIF:
 10684 000016D2 83E810                  	SUB	AX,10h			; Allow for 100h byte "stack"
 10685 000016D5 BB0C00                  	MOV	BX,ENTRYPOINTSEG ; 0Ch	;	in .COM files
 10686 000016D8 29C3                    	SUB	BX,AX
 10687 000016DA B104                    	MOV	CL,4
 10688 000016DC D3E0                    	SHL	AX,CL
 10689 000016DE 8EDA                    	MOV	DS,DX
 10690                                  
 10691                                  	; (MSDOS 6.0 note)
 10692                                  	;
 10693                                  	; The address in BX:AX will be F01D:FEF0 if there is 64K or more 
 10694                                  	; memory in the system. This is equivalent to 0:c0 if A20 is OFF.
 10695                                  	; If DOS is in HMA this equivalence is no longer valid as A20 is ON.
 10696                                  	; But the BIOS which now resides in FFFF:30 has 5 bytes in FFFF:D0
 10697                                  	; (F01D:FEF0) which is the same as the ones in 0:C0, thereby 
 10698                                  	; making this equvalence valid for this particular case. If however
 10699                                  	; there is less than 64K remaining the address in BX:AX will not 
 10700                                  	; be the same as above. We will then stuff 0:c0, the call 5 address
 10701                                  	; into the PSP.
 10702                                  	;
 10703                                  	; Therefore for the case where there is less than 64K remaining in 
 10704                                  	; the system old CPM Apps that look at PSP:6 to determine memory
 10705                                  	; requirements will not work. Call 5, however will continue to work
 10706                                  	; for all cases.
 10707                                  	;
 10708                                  
 10709                                  	;mov	[6],ax
 10710                                  	;mov	[8],bx
 10711                                  
 10712 000016E0 A30600                  	MOV	[PDB.CPM_CALL+1],AX
 10713 000016E3 891E0800                	MOV	[PDB.CPM_CALL+3],BX
 10714                                  
 10715                                  	; 06/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10716 000016E7 3DF0FE                  	cmp	ax,WRAPOFFSET ; 0FEF0h	; Q: does the system have >= 64k of
 10717                                  					;    memory left
 10718 000016EA 740C                    	je	short addr_ok		; Y: the above calculated address is
 10719                                  					;    OK
 10720                                  					; N: 
 10721                                  
 10722 000016EC C7060600C000            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CPM_CALL+1],0C0h
 10723 000016F2 C70608000000            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CPM_CALL+3],0
 10724                                  addr_ok:
 10725                                  	;mov	word [0],20CDh
 10726 000016F8 C7060000CD20            	MOV	word [PDB.EXIT_CALL],(int_abort*256) + mi_INT
 10727                                  	;mov	byte [5],9Ah
 10728 000016FE C60605009A              	MOV	BYTE [PDB.CPM_CALL],mi_Long_CALL
 10729                                  	;mov	word [50h],21CDh
 10730 00001703 C7065000CD21            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CALL_SYSTEM],(int_command*256) + mi_INT
 10731                                  	;mov	byte [52h],0CBh
 10732 00001709 C6065200CB              	MOV	BYTE [PDB.CALL_SYSTEM+2],mi_Long_RET
 10733                                  	;mov	word [34h],18h
 10734 0000170E C70634001800            	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Pointer],PDB.JFN_TABLE
 10735                                  	;mov	word [36h],ds
 10736 00001714 8C1E3600                	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Pointer+2],DS
 10737                                  	;mov	word [32h],20
 10738 00001718 C70632001400            	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Length],FILPERPROC
 10739                                  ;
 10740                                  ; The server runs several PDB's without creating them VIA EXEC.  We need to
 10741                                  ; enumerate all PDB's at CPS time in order to find all references to a
 10742                                  ; particular SFT.  We perform this by requiring that the server link together
 10743                                  ; for us all sub-PDB's that he creates. The requirement for us, now, is to
 10744                                  ; initialize this pointer.
 10745                                  ;
 10746                                   	;mov	word [38h],-1
 10747 0000171E C7063800FFFF            	MOV	word [PDB.Next_PDB],-1
 10748                                  	;mov	word [3Ah],-1
 10749 00001724 C7063A00FFFF            	MOV	word [PDB.Next_PDB+2],-1
 10750                                  
 10751                                  	; 06/05/2019
 10752                                  	; Set the real version number in the PSP - 5.00
 10753                                  
 10754                                  	;mov	word [es:PDB.Version],1406h ; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:4FB6h)
 10755                                  	; 07/12/2022
 10756 0000172A 26C7064000070A          	mov	word [ES:PDB.Version],(MINOR_VERSION*256)+MAJOR_VERSION
 10757                                  
 10758 00001731 C3                      	retn

 10843                                  			; 11h  8 BYTEs   (AL=00h only) filesystem type
 10844                                  			;		"FAT12   "
 10845                                  			;		"FAT16   "
 10846                                  			;		"FAT32   " ; PCDOS 7.1

 10848                                  			;		"CD001   "

 10884                                  ; Break <STRCMP - compare two ASCIZ strings DS:SI to ES:DI>
 10885                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10886                                  ;
 10887                                  ;   Strcmp - compare ASCIZ DS:SI to ES:DI. Case INSENSITIVE. '/' = '\'
 10888                                  ;	     Strings of different lengths don't match.
 10889                                  ;   Inputs:  DS:SI - pointer to source string  ES:DI - pointer to dest string
 10890                                  ;   Outputs: Z if strings same, NZ if different
 10891                                  ;   Registers modified: NONE
 10892                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10893                                  
 10894                                  	; 07/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 10895                                  
 10896                                  	; 14/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 10897                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM DOSCODE:56B6h)
 10898                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS DOSCODE:4FD7h)
 10899                                  StrCmp:
 10900 00001780 56                      	push	si
 10901 00001781 57                      	push	di
 10902 00001782 50                      	push	ax
 10903                                  Cmplp:
 10904 00001783 AC                      	LODSB
 10905 00001784 E86642                  	call	UCase			; convert to upper case
 10906 00001787 E8B642                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; convert '/' to '\' ; 07/12/2022 ('\')
 10907 0000178A 88C4                    	MOV	AH,AL
 10908 0000178C 268A05                  	MOV	AL,[ES:DI]
 10909 0000178F 47                      	INC	DI
 10910 00001790 E85A42                  	call	UCase			; convert to upper case
 10911 00001793 E8AA42                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; convert '/' to '\' ; 07/12/2022 ('\')
 10912 00001796 38C4                    	CMP	AH,AL
 10913 00001798 7504                    	JNZ	short PopRet		; Strings dif
 10914                                  
 10915 0000179A 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 10916 0000179C 75E5                    	JNZ	short Cmplp		; More string
 10917                                  PopRet:
 10918 0000179E 58                      	pop	ax
 10919 0000179F 5F                      	pop	di
 10920 000017A0 5E                      	pop	si
 10921 000017A1 C3                      	retn
 10922                                  
 10923                                  ;Break <STRCPY - copy ASCIZ string from DS:SI to ES:DI>
 10924                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10925                                  ;
 10926                                  ;   Strcpy - copy an ASCIZ string from DS:SI to ES:DI and make uppercase
 10927                                  ;   FStrcpy - copy an ASCIZ string from DS:SI to ES:DI. no modification of
 10928                                  ;	characters.
 10929                                  ;
 10930                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI - pointer to source string
 10931                                  ;		ES:DI - pointer to destination string
 10932                                  ;   Outputs:	ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string
 10933                                  ;		DS:SI point byte after nul byte at end of source string
 10934                                  ;   Registers modified: SI,DI
 10935                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10936                                  
 10937                                  StrCpy:
 10938 000017A2 50                      	push	ax
 10939                                  CPYLoop:
 10940 000017A3 AC                      	LODSB
 10941 000017A4 E84642                  	call	UCase			; convert to upper case
 10942 000017A7 E89642                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; convert / to \ ;
 10943 000017AA AA                      	STOSB
 10944                                  
 10945 000017AB 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 10946 000017AD 75F4                    	JNZ	short CPYLoop
 10947 000017AF 58                      	pop	ax
 10948 000017B0 C3                      	retn

 11031                                  ;Break	<Idle - wait for a specified amount of time>
 11032                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11033                                  ;
 11034                                  ;   Idle - when retrying an operation due to a lock/sharing violation,
 11035                                  ;   	   we spin until RetryLoop is exhausted.
 11036                                  ;
 11037                                  ;   Inputs:	RetryLoop is the number of times we spin
 11038                                  ;   Outputs:	Wait
 11039                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 11040                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11041                                  
 11042                                  Idle:
 11043                                  	;test	byte [SS:FSHARING],0FFh

 11045                                  	;retnz
 11046 000017DB 75F7                    	jnz	short xchgp_retn
 11047                                  	;SAVE	<CX>
 11048 000017DD 51                      	push	cx
 11049 000017DE 368B0E[1C00]            	MOV	CX,[ss:RetryLoop]	;hkn; SS override
 11050 000017E3 E308                    	JCXZ	Idle3
 11051                                  Idle1:	
 11052 000017E5 51                      	PUSH	CX
 11053 000017E6 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX
 11054                                  Idle2:	
 11055 000017E8 E2FE                    	LOOP	Idle2
 11056 000017EA 59                      	POP	CX
 11057 000017EB E2F8                    	LOOP	Idle1
 11058                                  Idle3:	
 11059                                  	;RESTORE <CX>
 11060 000017ED 59                      	pop	cx
 11061 000017EE C3                      	retn

 11063                                  ;Break	<TableDispatch - dispatch to a table>
 11064                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11065                                  ;
 11066                                  ;   TableDispatch - given a table and an index, jmp to the approptiate
 11067                                  ;   routine. Preserve all input registers to the routine.
 11068                                  ;
 11069                                  ;   Inputs:	Push	return address
 11070                                  ;		Push	Table address
 11071                                  ;		Push	index (byte)
 11072                                  ;   Outputs:	appropriate routine gets jumped to.
 11073                                  ;		return indicates invalid index
 11074                                  ;   Registers modified: none.
 11075                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11076                                  
 11077                                  struc TFrame	 ; TableFrame
 11078 00000000 ????                    .OldBP:	 resw 1  ; 0
 11079 00000002 ????                    .OldRet: resw 1  ; 2
 11080 00000004 ??                      .Index:	 resb 1  ; 4
 11081 00000005 ??                      .Pad:	 resb 1  ; 5  
 11082 00000006 ????                    .Tab:	 resw 1  ; 6
 11083 00000008 ????                    .NewRet: resw 1  ; 8
 11084                                  endstruc
 11085                                  
 11086                                  TableDispatch:
 11087 000017EF 55                      	PUSH	BP
 11088 000017F0 89E5                    	MOV	BP,SP
 11089 000017F2 53                      	PUSH	BX			; save BX
 11090                                  	;mov	bx,[bp+6]
 11091 000017F3 8B5E06                  	MOV	BX,[BP+TFrame.Tab]	; get pointer to table
 11092 000017F6 2E8A1F                  	MOV	BL,[CS:BX]		; maximum index
 11093                                  	;cmp	[bp+4],bl
 11094 000017F9 385E04                  	CMP	[BP+TFrame.Index],BL	; table error?
 11095 000017FC 7317                    	JAE	short TableError	; yes
 11096                                  	;mov	bl,[bp+4]
 11097 000017FE 8A5E04                  	MOV	BL,[BP+TFrame.Index]	; get desired table index
 11098 00001801 30FF                    	XOR	BH,BH			; convert to word
 11099 00001803 D1E3                    	SHL	BX,1			; convert to word pointer
 11100 00001805 43                      	INC	BX			; point past first length byte
 11101                                  	; 17/08/2018
 11102                                  	;add	bx,[bp+6]
 11103 00001806 035E06                  	ADD	BX,[BP+TFrame.Tab]	; get real offset
 11104 00001809 2E8B1F                  	MOV	BX,[CS:BX]		; get contents of table entry
 11105                                  	;mov	[bp+6],bx
 11106 0000180C 895E06                  	MOV	[BP+TFrame.Tab],BX	; put table entry into return address
 11107 0000180F 5B                      	POP	BX			; restore BX
 11108 00001810 5D                      	POP	BP			; restore BP
 11109 00001811 83C404                  	ADD	SP,4			; clean off Index and our return addr
 11110 00001814 C3                      	retn				; do operation
 11111                                  TableError:

 11304                                  ;Break	<MSG_RETRIEVAL- get beginning addr of system and parser messages>
 11305                                  
 11306                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11307                                  ;   DOS 4.00
 11308                                  ;
 11309                                  ;   Inputs:	DL=0 get extended error message addr
 11310                                  ;		  =1 set extended error message addr
 11311                                  ;		  =2 get parser error message addr
 11312                                  ;		  =3 set parser error message addr
 11313                                  ;		  =4 get critical error message addr
 11314                                  ;		  =5 set critical error message addr
 11315                                  ;		  =6 get file system error message addr
 11316                                  ;		  =7 set file system error message addr
 11317                                  ;		  =8 get address for code reduction
 11318                                  ;		  =9 set address for code reduction
 11319                                  ;   Function:	get/set message address
 11320                                  ;   Outputs:	ES:DI points to addr when get
 11321                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11322                                  
 11323                                  ;Procedure MSG_RETRIEVAL,NEAR
 11324                                  ;	ASSUME	CS:DOSCODE,SS:NOTHING
 11325                                  
 11326                                  ; 23/09/2023
 11327                                  ;MSG_RETRIEVAL:
 11328                                  
 11329                                  ;;	NOTE:  This function lives in command.com resident code now.
 11330                                  ;;	If the int 2F ever gets this far, we'll return registers
 11331                                  ;;	unchanged, which produces the same result as before, if
 11332                                  ;;	command.com wasn't present (and therefore no messages available).
 11333                                  ;;
 11334                                  ;;	I didn't point the entry in the 2F table to No_Op because
 11335                                  ;;	No_Op zeroes AL.
 11336                                  ;;
 11337                                  ;;;hkn; set up ds to point to DOSDATA
 11338                                  ;;	push	ds
 11339                                  ;;	getdseg	<ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 11340                                  ;;
 11341                                  ;;	PUSH	AX		    ;AN000;;MS. save regs
 11342                                  ;;	PUSH	SI		    ;AN000;;MS. save regs
 11343                                  ;;	MOV	AX,DX		    ;AN000;;MS.
 11344                                  ;;	MOV	SI,OFFSET DOSDATA:MSG_EXTERROR ;AN000;;MS.
 11345                                  ;;	test	AL,1		    ;AN000;;MS. get ?
 11346                                  ;;	JZ	toget		    ;AN000;;MS. yes
 11347                                  ;;	DEC	AL		    ;AN000;;MS.
 11348                                  ;;toget:				    ;AN000;

 11350                                  ;;	XOR	AH,AH		    ;AN000;;MS.

 11352                                  ;;	test	DL,1		    ;AN000;;MS. get ?
 11353                                  ;;	JZ	getget			     ;AN000;;MS. yes
 11354                                  ;;	MOV	WORD PTR DS:[SI],DI    ;AN000;;MS. set MSG
 11355                                  ;;	MOV	WORD PTR DS:[SI+2],ES  ;AN000;;MS. address to ES:DI
 11356                                  ;;	JMP	SHORT MSGret		     ;AN000;;MS. exit
 11357                                  ;;getget: 				     ;AN000;

 11359                                  ;;MSGret: 				     ;AN000;

 11361                                  ;;	POP	AX			     ;AN000;;MS.
 11362                                  ;;

 11364                                  
 11365                                  ;	return				     ;AN000;;MS. exit

 11426                                  ;============================================================================
 11427                                  ; CRIT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 11428                                  ;============================================================================
 11429                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11430                                  
 11431                                  ; Critical Section Routines
 11432                                  
 11433                                  ; MSDOS 6.21 - MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:513Ah
 11434                                  
 11435                                  ; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 11436                                  ; DOSCODE:5126h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 11437                                  
 11438                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11439                                  ; Each handler must leave everything untouched; including flags!
 11440                                  ;
 11441                                  ; Sleaze for time savings: first instruction is a return. This is patched
 11442                                  ; by the sharer to be a PUSH AX to complete the correct routines.
 11443                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11444                                  
 11445                                  ; (DOSMAC.INC, MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 11446                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11447                                  ; Some old versions of the 80286 have a bug in the chip. The popf instruction
 11448                                  ; will enable interrupts. Therefore in a section of code with interrupts
 11449                                  ; disabled and you need a popf instruction use the 'popff' macro instead.
 11450                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11451                                  
 11452                                  ;%macro POPFF 0
 11453                                  ;	jmp	$+3
 11454                                  ;	iret
 11455                                  ;	push	cs
 11456                                  ;	call	$-2
 11457                                  ;%endmacro
 11458                                  
 11459                                  ; ---------------------------
 11460                                  
 11461                                  ; 14/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 11462                                  %if 0
 11463                                  
 11464                                  ;Procedure  ECritDisk,NEAR
 11465                                  	;public  ECritMEM
 11466                                  	;public  ECritSFT
 11467                                  ECritMEM:
 11468                                  ECritSFT:
 11469                                  ;
 11470                                  ECritDisk:
 11471                                  
 11472                                  ;SR; Check if critical section is to be entered
 11473                                  
 11474                                  	pushf
 11475                                  	cmp	byte [ss:redir_patch],0
 11476                                  	jz	short ECritDisk_2
 11477                                  
 11478                                  ; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 11479                                  ;	;popff  ; * (macro)
 11480                                  ;	jmp	short ECritDisk_1 ; *
 11481                                  ;
 11482                                  ;ECritDisk_iret: ; *
 11483                                  ;	iret ; *
 11484                                  
 11485                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11486                                  	; 13/11/2022
 11487                                  	;jmp	short ECritDisk_1
 11488                                  	; 06/11/2022
 11489                                  ;ECritDisk_iret:
 11490                                  ;	iret	
 11491                                  
 11492                                  	; 06/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 11493                                  ECritDisk_1:
 11494                                  	push	cs ; *
 11495                                  	call	ECritDisk_iret ; *		
 11496                                  	
 11497                                  ECritDisk_0:
 11498                                  	PUSH    AX
 11499                                  	;MOV	AX,8000h+critDisk
 11500                                  	;INT	int_IBM
 11501                                  	mov	ax,8001h
 11502                                  	int	2Ah	; Microsoft Networks - BEGIN DOS CRITICAL SECTION
 11503                                  			; AL = critical section number (00h-0Fh)
 11504                                  	POP     AX
 11505                                  	retn
 11506                                  
 11507                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11508                                  	; 13/11/2022
 11509                                  ECritDisk_iret:  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11510                                  LCritDisk_iret: 
 11511                                  	iret
 11512

 11515                                  	;;retn

 11518                                  ;	iret
 11519

 11905                                  ;============================================================================
 11906                                  ; IO.ASM (MSDOS 2.0) (IBMDOS.COM 2.0) - STRIN.ASM (MSDOS 2.0, 19/08/1983)
 11907                                  ;============================================================================
 11908                                  ; Retro DOS v2.0 by Erdogan Tan, 13/03/2018 - 14/03/2018
 11909                                  
 11910                                  ; (Disassembled code of IBMDOS.COM, 08/03/1983) - Dissassembler: IDA Pro Free
 11911                                  ; (Comments are from CPMIO.ASM - 1991, MSDOS 6.0) 
 11912                                  
 11913                                  ;============================================================================
 11914                                  ; CPMIO.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 11915                                  ;============================================================================
 11916                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 by Erdogan Tan, 04/05/2019
 11917                                  
 11918                                  	; 08/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 11919                                  
 11920                                  ;**	Standard device IO for MSDOS (first 12 function calls)
 11921                                  ;
 11922                                  ;	TITLE	IBMCPMIO - device IO for MSDOS
 11923                                  ;	NAME	IBMCPMIO
 11924                                  
 11925                                  ;	Old style CP/M 1-12 system calls to talk to reserved devices
 11926                                  ;
 11927                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input_No_Echo
 11928                                  ;	$Std_Con_String_Output
 11929                                  ;	$Std_Con_String_Input
 11930                                  ;	$RawConIO
 11931                                  ;	$RawConInput
 11932                                  ;	RAWOUT
 11933                                  ;	RAWOUT2
 11934                                  ;
 11935                                  
 11936                                  ; The following routines form the console I/O group (funcs 1,2,6,7,8,9,10,11).
 11937                                  ; They assume ES and DS NOTHING, while not strictly correct, this forces data
 11938                                  ; references to be SS or CS relative which is desired.
 11939                                  
 11940                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11941

 11951                                  ;**	Old style CP/M 1-12 system calls to talk to reserved devices
 11952                                  ;
 11953                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input
 11954                                  ;	$Std_Con_Output
 11955                                  ;	OUTT
 11956                                  ;	TAB
 11957                                  ;	BUFOUT
 11958                                  ;	$Std_Aux_Input
 11959                                  ;	$Std_Aux_Output
 11960                                  ;	$Std_Printer_Output
 11961                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input_Status
 11962                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input_Flush
 11963                                  ;
 11964                                  ;	Revision History:
 11965                                  ;
 11966                                  ;	  AN000	 version 4.00 - Jan. 1988
 11967                                  
 11968                                  ; The following routines form the console I/O group (funcs 1,2,6,7,8,9,10,11).
 11969                                  ; They assume ES and DS NOTHING, while not strictly correct, this forces data
 11970                                  ; references to be SS or CS relative which is desired.
 11971                                  
 11972                                  ;DOSCODE SEGMENT
 11973                                  ;	ASSUME	SS:DOSDATA,CS:DOSCODE
 11974                                  
 11975                                  
 11976                                  ;hkn; 	All the variables use SS override or DS. Therefore there is
 11977                                  ;hkn;	no need to specifically set up any seg regs unless SS assumption is
 11978                                  ;hkn;	not valid. 
 11979                                  
 11980                                  ; DOSCODE:51BAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 11981                                  ; 08/11/2022
 11982                                  ; DOSCODE:51A6h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 11983                                  
 11984                                  ;
 11985                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11986                                  ;
 11987                                  ; Procedure : $Std_Con_Input_No_Echo
 11988                                  ;
 11989                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11990                                  ;
 11991                                  
 11992                                  _$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO:   ;System call 8
 11993                                  
 11994                                  ; Inputs:
 11995                                  ;	None
 11996                                  ; Function:
 11997                                  ;	Input character from console, no echo
 11998                                  ; Returns:
 11999                                  ;	AL = character
 12000                                  
 12001 000018F8 1E                      	push	ds
 12002 000018F9 56                      	push	si
 12003                                  INTEST:
 12004 000018FA E80B42                  	call	STATCHK
 12005 000018FD 753A                    	jnz	short GET ; 08/09/2018
 12006                                  ;*************************************************************************
 12007                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12008 000018FF 36803E[A00A]00          	cmp	byte [SS:PRINTER_FLAG],0  ; is printer idle?
 12009 00001905 7505                    	jnz	short no_sys_wait
 12010 00001907 B405                    	mov	ah,5			; get input status with system wait
 12011 00001909 E84F34                  	call	IOFUNC
 12012                                  no_sys_wait:
 12013                                  ;**************************************************************************
 12014 0000190C B484                    	MOV	AH,84h		; (Microsoft Networks - KEYBOARD BUSY LOOP)
 12015 0000190E CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM	 ; int 2Ah
 12016                                  
 12017                                  ;;; 7/15/86  update the date in the idle loop
 12018                                  ;;; Dec 19, 1986 D.C.L. changed following CMP to Byte Ptr from Word Ptr
 12019                                  ;;;;		 to shorten loop in consideration of the PC Convertible
 12020                                  
 12021                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12022 00001910 36803E[BD0D]FF          	CMP	byte [SS:DATE_FLAG],-1	; date is updated may be every
 12023 00001916 751A                    	JNZ	short NoUpdate		; 65535 x ? ms if no one calls
 12024                                  
 12025 00001918 50                      	PUSH	AX
 12026 00001919 53                      	PUSH	BX			; following is tricky,
 12027 0000191A 51                      	PUSH	CX			; it may be called by critical handler
 12028 0000191B 52                      	PUSH	DX			; at that time, DEVCALL is used by
 12029                                  					; other's READ or WRITE
 12030 0000191C 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save DS = SFT's segment
 12031                                  
 12032                                  ;hkn; READTIME must use ds = DOSDATA
 12033                                  ;hkn;	PUSH	CS			; READTIME must use DS=CS
 12034                                  
 12035 0000191D 16                      	PUSH	SS ; 04/05/2019
 12036 0000191E 1F                      	POP	DS
 12037                                  
 12038                                  	;MOV	AX,0			; therefore, we save DEVCALL
 12039                                  	; 26/06/2024
 12040 0000191F 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 12041 00001921 E89A02                  	CALL	Save_Restore_Packet	; save DEVCALL packet
 12042                                  	;invoke	READTIME		; readtime
 12043 00001924 E854F2                  	call	READTIME
 12044 00001927 B80100                  	MOV	AX,1
 12045 0000192A E89102                  	CALL	Save_Restore_Packet	; restore DEVCALL packet
 12046                                  
 12047                                  ;	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM, Offset 1F8Ch)
 12048                                  ;	; (MSDOS 6.0 code does not contain IBM DOS FETCHI_TAG check)
 12049                                  ;	push	bx
 12050                                  ;	mov	bx,DATE_FLAG
 12051                                  ;	add	bx,2  ; mov bx,FETCHI_FLAG
 12052                                  ;	cmp	word [cs:bx],5872h
 12053                                  ;	jz	short FETCHI_TAG_chk_ok
 12054                                  ;	call	DOSINIT
 12055                                  ;FETCHI_TAG_chk_ok:
 12056                                  ;	pop	bx
 12057                                  
 12058 0000192D 1F                      	POP	DS			; restore DS
 12059 0000192E 5A                      	POP	DX
 12060 0000192F 59                      	POP	CX
 12061 00001930 5B                      	POP	BX
 12062 00001931 58                      	POP	AX
 12063                                  NoUpdate:
 12064                                  
 12065                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12066 00001932 36FF06[BD0D]            	INC	word [SS:DATE_FLAG]
 12067                                  
 12068                                  ;;; 7/15/86 ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 12069 00001937 EBC1                    	JMP	short INTEST
 12070                                  GET:
 12071 00001939 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 12072 0000193B E81D34                  	call	IOFUNC
 12073 0000193E 5E                      	POP	SI
 12074 0000193F 1F                      	POP	DS
 12075                                  ;;; 7/15/86
 12076                                  
 12077                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12078                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 12079 00001940 36C606[BC0D]00          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SCAN_FLAG],0
 12080                                  	;
 12081 00001946 3C00                    	CMP	AL,0	    ; extended code ( AL )
 12082 00001948 7505                    	JNZ	short noscan
 12083                                  
 12084                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12085                                  	;MOV	BYTE [SS:SCAN_FLAG],1 ; set this flag for ALT_Q key
 12086                                  	; 20/06/2023
 12087 0000194A 36FE06[BC0D]            	inc	byte [SS:SCAN_FLAG]
 12088                                  noscan:
 12089 0000194F C3                      	retn

 12092                                  ;
 12093                                  ;**	$STD_CON_STRING_OUTPUT - Console String Output
 12094                                  ;
 12095                                  ;
 12096                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) Point to output string '$' terminated
 12097                                  ;	EXIT	none
 12098                                  ;	USES	ALL
 12099                                  ;
 12100                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12101                                  ;
 12102                                  
 12103                                  _$STD_CON_STRING_OUTPUT:	;System call 9
 12104 00001950 89D6                    	mov	si,dx
 12105                                  STRING_OUT1:	
 12106 00001952 AC                      	lodsb
 12107 00001953 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'
 12108 00001955 74F8                    	je	short noscan
 12109                                  NEXT_STR1:
 12110 00001957 E88D02                  	call	OUTT
 12111 0000195A EBF6                    	jmp	short STRING_OUT1
 12112                                  
 12113                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12114                                  ;
 12115                                  ;**	$STD_CON_STRING_INPUT - Input Line from Console
 12116                                  ;
 12117                                  ;	$STD_CON_STRING_INPUT Fills a buffer from console input until CR
 12118                                  ;
 12119                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds:dx) = input buffer
 12120                                  ;	EXIT	none
 12121                                  ;	USES	ALL
 12122                                  ;
 12123                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12124                                  
 12125                                  	; 15/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 12126                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:58D4h
 12127                                  
 12128                                  _$STD_CON_STRING_INPUT:		;System call 10
 12129                                  
 12130                                  	; 15/01/2024
 12131                                  	;mov	ax,ss
 12132                                  	;mov	es,ax
 12133 0000195C 16                      	push	ss
 12134 0000195D 07                      	pop	es
 12135                                  
 12136 0000195E 89D6                    	mov	si,dx
 12137 00001960 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 12138 00001962 AD                      	lodsw
 12139                                  
 12140                                  ;	(AL) = the buffer length
 12141                                  ;	(AH) = the template length
 12142                                  
 12143 00001963 08C0                            or	al,al
 12144 00001965 74E8                            jz	short noscan	;Buffer is 0 length!!?
 12145 00001967 88E3                    	mov	bl,ah		;Init template counter
 12146 00001969 88EF                            mov	bh,ch		;Init template counter
 12147                                  
 12148                                  ;	(BL) = the number of bytes in the template
 12149                                  
 12150 0000196B 38D8                            cmp	al,bl
 12151 0000196D 7605                            jbe	short NOEDIT	;If length of buffer inconsistent with contents
 12152 0000196F 80380D                          cmp	byte [bx+si],c_CR ; 0Dh
 12153 00001972 7402                            jz	short EDITON	;If CR correctly placed EDIT is OK
 12154                                  
 12155                                  ; The number of chars in the template is >= the number of chars in buffer or
 12156                                  ; there is no CR at the end of the template. This is an inconsistant state
 12157                                  ; of affairs. Pretend that the template was empty:
 12158                                  ;
 12159                                  
 12160                                  NOEDIT:	
 12161 00001974 88EB                    	mov	bl,ch		;Reset buffer
 12162                                  EDITON: 
 12163 00001976 88C2                    	mov	dl,al
 12164 00001978 4A                      	dec	dx		;DL is # of bytes we can put in the buffer
 12165                                  
 12166                                  ;	Top level. We begin to read a line in.
 12167                                  
 12168                                  NEWLIN: 
 12169 00001979 36A0[F901]              	mov	al,[SS:CARPOS]
 12170 0000197D 36A2[FA01]              	mov	[SS:STARTPOS],al ;Remember position in raw buffer
 12171                                  
 12172 00001981 56                      	push	si
 12173 00001982 BF[FB01]                	mov	di,INBUF ;Build the new line here
 12174 00001985 36882E[7905]            	mov	byte [SS:INSMODE],ch ;Insert mode off
 12175 0000198A 88EF                    	mov	bh,ch		;No chars from template yet
 12176 0000198C 88EE                    	mov	dh,ch		;No chars to new line yet
 12177 0000198E E867FF                  	call	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO ;Get first char
 12178 00001991 3C0A                    	cmp	al,c_LF		; 0Ah	;Linefeed 
 12179 00001993 7503                    	jnz	short GOTCH
 12180                                  
 12181                                  ;	This is the main loop of reading in a character and processing it.
 12182                                  ;
 12183                                  ;	(BH) = the index of the next byte in the template
 12184                                  ;	(BL) = the length of the template
 12185                                  ;	(DH) = the number of bytes in the buffer
 12186                                  ;	(DL) = the length of the buffer
 12187                                  
 12188                                  GETCH:
 12189 00001995 E860FF                  	call	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO
 12190                                  GOTCH:
 12191                                  ;
 12192                                  ; Brain-damaged Tim Patterson ignored ^F in case his BIOS did not flush the
 12193                                  ; input queue.
 12194                                  ;
 12195 00001998 3C06                            cmp	al,"F"-"@"  ; CMP AL, 6  ; Ignore ^F
 12196 0000199A 74F9                    	jz	short GETCH
 12197                                  
 12198                                  ;	If the leading char is the function-key lead byte
 12199                                  
 12200                                  	;cmp	al,[SS:ESCCHAR]
 12201                                  
 12202                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 12203                                  
 12204                                  ;hkn; 	ESCCHAR is in TABLE seg (DOSCODE)
 12205                                  
 12206 0000199C 2E3A06[850A]            	CMP	AL,[cs:ESCCHAR]
 12207 000019A1 7439                            jz	short ESCAPE	;change reserved keyword DBM 5-7-87
 12208                                  
 12209                                  ;	Rubout and ^H are both destructive backspaces.
 12210                                  
 12211 000019A3 3C7F                            cmp	al,c_DEL ; 7FH
 12212                                          ;jz	short BACKSPJ
 12213                                          ; 15/01/2024
 12214 000019A5 7466                    	je	short BACKSP
 12215 000019A7 3C08                    	cmp	al,c_BS  ; 8
 12216                                          ;jz	short BACKSPJ
 12217                                          ; 15/01/2024
 12218 000019A9 7462                    	je	short BACKSP
 12219                                  
 12220                                  	; 04/05/2019 -	MSDOS 6.0, also MSDOS 6.21 has bug (bullshit) here.
 12221                                  	;		Two NOPs -instead of a JMP short, as two bytes-
 12222                                  	;	   	after CMP and a CMP again!
 12223                                  	;		
 12224                                  	;		-It would be better if they use a 'JMP short' to 
 12225                                  	;	      	DOSCODE:5279h from DOSCODE:5271h and leave NOPs
 12226                                  	;		between them. Then, they would be able use a patch
 12227                                  	;		between 5271h and 5279h when if it will be required.
 12228                                  	;		I think Tim Patterson would not do this CMP mistake!-
 12229                                  	;	
 12230                                  	; (MSDOS.SYS, from DOSCODE:5271h to DOSCODE:5279h)
 12231                                  
 12232                                  	; 08/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 12233                                  	;
 12234                                  	; (Note: nops below might be used for patching code for Windows 3.1)
 12235                                  
 12236                                  ;DOSCODE:526D	cmp     al, 8
 12237                                  ;DOSCODE:526F	jz      short BACKSPJ
 12238                                  ;DOSCODE:5271	cmp     al, 17h
 12239                                  ;DOSCODE:5273	nop
 12240                                  ;DOSCODE:5274	nop
 12241                                  ;DOSCODE:5275	cmp     al, 15h
 12242                                  ;DOSCODE:5277	nop
 12243                                  ;DOSCODE:5278	nop
 12244                                  ;DOSCODE:5279	cmp     al, 0Dh
 12245                                  ;DOSCODE:527B	jz      short ENDLIN
 12246                                  ;DOSCODE:527D	cmp     al, 0Ah
 12247                                  ;DOSCODE:527F	jz      short PHYCRLF
 12248                                  	
 12249                                  	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 12250                                  	; DOSCODE:525Dh
 12251                                  
 12252                                  ; 16/12/2022
 12253                                  %if 0
 12254                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 12255                                  ;	^W deletes backward once and then backs up until a letter is before the
 12256                                  ;	cursor
 12257                                  
 12258                                  	CMP     AL,"W"-"@" ; 17h
 12259                                  
 12260                                  ;	The removal of the comment characters before the jump statement will
 12261                                  ;	cause ^W to backup a word.
 12262                                  
 12263                                  ;***	JZ	short WordDel
 12264                                  	NOP
 12265                                  	NOP
 12266                                  
 12267                                  	CMP     AL,"U"-"@" ; 15h
 12268                                  
 12269                                  ;	The removal of the comment characters before the jump statement will
 12270                                  ;	cause ^U to clear a line.
 12271                                  
 12272                                  ;***	JZ	short LineDel
 12273                                  	NOP
 12274                                  	NOP
 12275                                  
 12276                                  %endif
 12277                                  
 12278                                  ;	CR terminates the line.
 12279                                  
 12280 000019AB 3C0D                            cmp	al,c_CR ; 0Dh
 12281 000019AD 7430                            jz	short ENDLIN
 12282                                  
 12283                                  ;	LF goes to a new line and keeps on reading.
 12284                                  
 12285 000019AF 3C0A                            cmp	al,c_LF ; 0Ah
 12286 000019B1 7442                    	jz	short PHYCRLF
 12287                                  
 12288                                  ;	^X (or ESC) deletes the line and starts over
 12289                                  
 12290                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 12291                                  	;cmp	al,[ss:CANCHAR] ; 1Bh
 12292                                  	;jz	short KILNEW
 12293                                  
 12294                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 6.21)
 12295                                  
 12296                                  ;hkn; 	CANCHAR is in TABLE seg (DOSCODE), so CS override
 12297                                  
 12298 000019B3 2E3A06[840A]            	cmp	al,[cs:CANCHAR] ; 1Bh
 12299 000019B8 7440                    	jz	short KILNEW
 12300                                  	
 12301                                  	;cmp	al,CANCEL ; 1Bh	; Retro DOS v3.0
 12302                                  	;jz	short KILNEW
 12303                                  
 12304                                  ; Otherwise, we save the input character.
 12305                                  
 12306                                  SAVCH:	
 12307 000019BA 38D6                    	cmp	dh,dl
 12308 000019BC 7317                    	jnb	short BUFFUL		; buffer is full.
 12309 000019BE AA                              stosb
 12310 000019BF FEC6                    	inc	dh                      ; increment count in buffer.
 12311 000019C1 E8B702                  	call	BUFOUT			; Print control chars nicely
 12312                                  
 12313 000019C4 36803E[7905]00                  cmp	byte [SS:INSMODE], 0
 12314 000019CA 75C9                    	jnz	short GETCH		; insertmode => don't advance template
 12315 000019CC 38DF                            cmp	bh,bl
 12316 000019CE 73C5                            jnb	short GETCH		; no more characters in template
 12317 000019D0 46                              inc	si                      ; Skip to next char in template
 12318 000019D1 FEC7                            inc	bh                      ; remember position in template
 12319 000019D3 EBC0                            jmp	short GETCH
 12320                                  
 12321                                  	; 15/01/2024
 12322                                  ;BACKSPJ: 
 12323                                  	;jmp	short BACKSP
 12324                                  
 12325                                  BUFFUL: 
 12326 000019D5 B007                    	mov	al, 7			; Bell to signal full buffer
 12327 000019D7 E80D02                  	call	OUTT
 12328 000019DA EBB9                    	jmp	short GETCH
 12329                                  
 12330                                  ESCAPE: 
 12331                                  	;transfer OEMFunctionKey
 12332 000019DC E9D1F0                  	JMP	OEMFunctionKey		; let the OEM's handle the key dispatch
 12333                                  
 12334                                  ENDLIN:
 12335 000019DF AA                              stosb				; Put the CR in the buffer
 12336 000019E0 E80402                  	call	OUTT                    ; Echo it
 12337 000019E3 5F                              pop	di                      ; Get start of user buffer
 12338 000019E4 8875FF                          mov	[di-1], dh		; Tell user how many bytes
 12339 000019E7 FEC6                            inc	dh			; DH is length including CR
 12340                                  
 12341                                  COPYNEW:
 12342                                  	; (IBMDOS.COM, MSDOS 2.0, STRIN.ASM)
 12343                                  	;mov	bp, es
 12344                                  	;mov	bx, ds
 12345                                  	;mov	es, bx
 12346                                  	;mov	ds, bp
 12347                                  	;mov	si, INBUF
 12348                                  	;mov	cl, dh
 12349                                  	;rep	movsb
 12350                                  	;retn
 12351                                  
 12352                                  	; CPMIO.ASM (MSDOS 6.0)
 12353                                  	; (IBMDOS.COM, MSDOS 3.3, Offset 2061h) 
 12354                                  	;SAVE	<DS,ES>
 12355 000019E9 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 12356 000019EA 06                      	PUSH	ES
 12357                                  	;RESTORE <DS,ES>		; XCHG ES,DS
 12358 000019EB 1F                      	POP	DS
 12359 000019EC 07                      	POP	ES
 12360                                  
 12361                                  ;;hkn; INBUF is in DOSDATA
 12362 000019ED BE[FB01]                        MOV     SI,INBUF
 12363 000019F0 88F1                            MOV     CL,DH                   ; set up count
 12364 000019F2 F3A4                            REP     MOVSB                   ; Copy final line to user buffer
 12365                                  OLDBAK_RETN:
 12366 000019F4 C3                              RETN
 12367                                  
 12368                                  ;	Output a CRLF to the user screen and do NOT store it into the buffer
 12369                                  
 12370                                  PHYCRLF:
 12371 000019F5 E81B01                  	CALL	CRLF
 12372 000019F8 EB9B                            JMP	short GETCH
 12373                                  
 12374                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3, IBMDOS.COM, 1987)
 12375                                  
 12376                                  ; DOSCODE:52CAh (MSDOS 621, MSDOS.SYS)
 12377                                  
 12378                                  	; Note: Following routines were not used in IBMDOS.COM
 12379                                  	;	-CRTL+W, CRTL+U is not activated-
 12380                                  	;	but they were in the kernel code!?)
 12381                                  
 12382                                  	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 12383                                  	; DOSCODE:52B6h
 12384                                  
 12385                                  ;;;;;;;;
 12386                                  
 12387                                  ; 16/12/2022
 12388                                  %if 0
 12389                                  ;
 12390                                  ; Delete the previous line
 12391                                  ;
 12392                                  LineDel:
 12393                                  	OR      DH,DH
 12394                                  	JZ	short GETCH	 ; 06/12/2022
 12395                                  	Call    BackSpace
 12396                                  	JMP	short LineDel
 12397                                  
 12398                                  %endif
 12399                                  
 12400                                  ;
 12401                                  ; delete the previous word.
 12402                                  ;
 12403                                  WordDel:
 12404                                  WordLoop:
 12405                                  ;	Call    BackSpace               ; backspace the one spot
 12406                                  ;	OR      DH,DH
 12407                                  ;	JZ	short GetChj

 12409                                  ;	cmp     al,'0'

 12417                                  ;	JBE	short WordLoop
 12418                                  ;GetChj:

 12420

 12422                                  %if 0

 12425                                  WordDel:
 12426                                  WordLoop:

 12428                                  	OR      DH,DH

 12446                                  
 12447                                  ; DOSCODE:52F3h (MSDOS 621, MSDOS.SYS)
 12448                                  
 12449                                  ; The user wants to throw away what he's typed in and wants to start over.
 12450                                  ; We print the backslash and then go to the next line and tab to the correct
 12451                                  ; spot to begin the buffered input.
 12452                                  
 12453                                  KILNEW:
 12454 000019FA B05C                            mov	al,'\'
 12455 000019FC E8E801                          call	OUTT            ;Print the CANCEL indicator
 12456 000019FF 5E                              pop	si		;Remember start of edit buffer
 12457                                  PUTNEW:
 12458 00001A00 E81001                  	call	CRLF            ;Go to next line on screen
 12459 00001A03 36A0[FA01]              	mov	al,[SS:STARTPOS]
 12460 00001A07 E85102                  	call	TAB             ;Tab over
 12461 00001A0A E96CFF                          JMP     NEWLIN		;Start over again
 12462                                  
 12463                                  ;	Destructively back up one character position
 12464                                  
 12465                                  BACKSP:
 12466                                  	; 09/09/2018
 12467 00001A0D E80800                  	Call    BackSpace
 12468 00001A10 EB83                    	JMP     short GETCH	; 15/01/2024
 12469                                  
 12470                                  	; 15/01/2024
 12471                                  ;User really wants an ESC character in his line
 12472                                  TWOESC:	
 12473 00001A12 2EA0[850A]              	mov	al,[cs:ESCCHAR] ; 10/06/2019
 12474 00001A16 EBA2                    	jmp	short SAVCH
 12475                                  
 12476                                  BackSpace:
 12477 00001A18 08F6                    	or	dh,dh
 12478 00001A1A 7419                    	jz	short OLDBAK	;No chars in line, do nothing to line
 12479 00001A1C E85800                  	call	BACKUP          ;Do the backup
 12480 00001A1F 268A05                  	mov	al,[es:di]	;Get the deleted char
 12481 00001A22 3C20                            cmp	al,20h	; ' '

 13430                                  ; FCBIO.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 13431                                  ;============================================================================
 13432                                  ; 20/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 13433                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13434                                  
 13435                                  ;**	FCBIO.ASM - Ancient 1.0 1.1 FCB system calls
 13436                                  ;
 13437                                  ;	$GET_FCB_POSITION
 13438                                  ;	$FCB_DELETE
 13439                                  ;	$GET_FCB_FILE_LENGTH
 13440                                  ;	$FCB_CLOSE
 13441                                  ;	$FCB_RENAME
 13442                                  ;	SaveFCBInfo
 13443                                  ;	ResetLRU
 13444                                  ;	SetOpenAge
 13445                                  ;	LRUFCB
 13446                                  ;	FCBRegen
 13447                                  ;	BlastSFT
 13448                                  ;	CheckFCB
 13449                                  ;	SFTFromFCB
 13450                                  ;	FCBHardErr
 13451                                  ;
 13452                                  ;	Revision history:
 13453                                  ;
 13454                                  ;		Created: ARR 4 April 1983"
 13455                                  ;			 MZ  6 June  1983 completion of functions
 13456                                  ;			 MZ 15 Dec   1983 Brain damaged programs close FCBs multiple
 13457                                  ;					  times.  Change so successive closes work by
 13458                                  ;					  always returning OK.	Also, detect I/O to
 13459                                  ;					  already closed FCB and return EOF.
 13460                                  ;			 MZ 16 Jan   1984 More braindamage.  Need to separate info
 13461                                  ;					  out of sft into FCB for reconnection
 13462                                  ;
 13463                                  ;		A000	 version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 13464                                  
 13465                                  ;Break <$Get_FCB_Position - set random record fields to current pos>
 13466                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13467                                  ;
 13468                                  ;   $Get_FCB_Position - look at an FCB, retrieve the current position from the
 13469                                  ;	extent and next record field and set the random record field to point
 13470                                  ;	to that record
 13471                                  ;
 13472                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a possible extended FCB
 13473                                  ;   Outputs:	The random record field of the FCB is set to the current record
 13474                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 13475                                  ;
 13476                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13477                                  ;
 13478                                  
 13479                                  _$GET_FCB_POSITION:
 13480 00001D02 E8FB04                  	call	GetExtended		; point to FCB
 13481 00001D05 E8CC04                  	call	GetExtent		; DX:AX is current record
 13482                                  	;mov	[si+21h],ax
 13483 00001D08 894421                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RR],AX 	; drop in low order piece
 13484                                  	;mov	[si+23h],dl
 13485 00001D0B 885423                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RR+2],DL	; drop in high order piece
 13486                                  	;cmp	word [si+0Eh],64
 13487 00001D0E 837C0E40                	CMP	word [SI+SYS_FCB.RECSIZ],64
 13488 00001D12 7303                    	JAE	short GetFCBBye
 13489                                  	;mov	[si+24h],dh

 13740                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13741                                  ;
 13742                                  ;**	$FCB_Rename - Rename a File
 13743                                  ;
 13744                                  ;	$FCB_Rename - rename a file in place within a directory. Renames

 13749                                  ;		    in the FCB is the destination name.

 13755                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13756                                  ;
 13757                                  	; 08/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 13804                                  	
 13805                                  ;	Error -
 13806                                  ;
 13807                                  ;	(al) = error code
 13808                                  
 13809                                  	; 16/12/2022
 13810                                  ;fren90:	
 13811                                  ;	;jmp	FCB_RET_ERR
 13812                                  ;	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 13813                                  ;	jmp	short fcb_close_err
 13814                                  
 13815                                  ;Break <Misbehavior fixers>
 13816                                  ;
 13817                                  ;   FCBs suffer from several problems. First, they are maintained in the
 13818                                  ;   user's space so he may move them at will. Second, they have a small
 13819                                  ;   reserved area that may be used for system information. Third, there was
 13820                                  ;   never any "rules for behavior" for FCBs; there was no protocol for their
 13821                                  ;   usage.
 13822                                  ;
 13823                                  ;   This results in the following misbehavior:
 13824                                  ;
 13825                                  ;	infinite opens of the same file:
 13826                                  ;
 13827                                  ;	While (TRUE) {			While (TRUE) {
 13828                                  ;	    FCBOpen (FCB);		    FCBOpen (FCB);
 13829                                  ;	    Read (FCB); 		    Write (FCB);
 13830                                  ;	    }				    }
 13831                                  ;
 13832                                  ;	infinite opens of different files:
 13833                                  ;
 13834                                  ;	While (TRUE) {			While (TRUE) {
 13835                                  ;	    FCBOpen (FCB[i++]); 	    FCBOpen (FCB[i++]);
 13836                                  ;	    Read (FCB); 		    Write (FCB);
 13837                                  ;	    }				    }
 13838                                  ;
 13839                                  ;	multiple closes of the same file:
 13840                                  ;
 13841                                  ;	FCBOpen (FCB);
 13842                                  ;	while (TRUE)
 13843                                  ;	    FCBClose (FCB);
 13844                                  ;
 13845                                  ;	I/O after closing file:
 13846                                  ;
 13847                                  ;	FCBOpen (FCB);
 13848                                  ;	while (TRUE) {
 13849                                  ;	    FCBWrite (FCB);
 13850                                  ;	    FCBClose (FCB);
 13851                                  ;	    }
 13852                                  ;
 13853                                  ;   The following is am implementation of a methodology for emulating the
 13854                                  ;   above with the exception of I/O after close. We are NOT attempting to
 13855                                  ;   resolve that particular misbehavior. We will enforce correct behaviour in
 13856                                  ;   FCBs when they refer to a network file or when there is file sharing on
 13857                                  ;   the local machine.
 13858                                  ;
 13859                                  ;   The reserved fields of the FCB (10 bytes worth) is divided up into various
 13860                                  ;   structures depending on the file itself and the state of operations of the
 13861                                  ;   OS. The information contained in this reserved field is enough to
 13862                                  ;   regenerate the SFT for the local non-shared file. It is assumed that this
 13863                                  ;   regeneration procedure may be expensive. The SFT for the FCB is
 13864                                  ;   maintained in a LRU cache as the ONLY performance inprovement.
 13865                                  ;
 13866                                  ;   No regeneration of SFTs is attempted for network FCBs.
 13867                                  ;
 13868                                  ;   To regenerate the SFT for a local FCB, it is necessary to determine if the
 13869                                  ;   file sharer is working. If the file sharer is present then the SFT is not
 13870                                  ;   regenerated.
 13871                                  ;
 13872                                  ;   Finally, if there is no local sharing, the full name of the file is no
 13873                                  ;   longer available. We can make up for this by using the following
 13874                                  ;   information:
 13875                                  ;
 13876                                  ;	The Drive number (from the DPB).
 13877                                  ;	The physical sector of the directory that contains the entry.
 13878                                  ;	The relative position of the entry in the sector.
 13879                                  ;	The first cluster field.
 13880                                  ;	The last used SFT.
 13881                                  ;      OR In the case of a device FCB
 13882                                  ;	The low 6 bits of sf_flags (indicating device type)
 13883                                  ;	The pointer to the device header
 13884                                  ;
 13885                                  ;   We read in the particular directory sector and examine the indicated
 13886                                  ;   directory entry. If it matches, then we are kosher; otherwise, we fail.
 13887                                  ;
 13888                                  ;   Some key items need to be remembered:
 13889                                  ;
 13890                                  ;	Even though we are caching SFTs, they may contain useful sharing
 13891                                  ;	information. We enforce good behavior on the FCBs.
 13892                                  ;
 13893                                  ;	Network support must not treat FCBs as impacting the ref counts on
 13894                                  ;	open VCs. The VCs may be closed only at process termination.
 13895                                  ;
 13896                                  ;	If this is not an installed version of the DOS, file sharing will
 13897                                  ;	always be present.
 13898                                  ;
 13899                                  ;	We MUST always initialize lstclus to = firclus when regenerating a
 13900                                  ;	file. Otherwise we start allocating clusters up the wazoo.
 13901                                  ;
 13902                                  ;	Always initialize, during regeneration, the mode field to both isFCB
 13903                                  ;	and open_for_both. This is so the FCB code in the sharer can find the
 13904                                  ;	proper OI record.
 13905                                  ;
 13906                                  ;   The test bits are:
 13907                                  ;
 13908                                  ;	00 -> local file
 13909                                  ;	40 -> sharing local
 13910                                  ;	80 -> network
 13911                                  ;	C0 -> local device
 13912                                  
 13913                                  ;Break	<SaveFCBInfo - store pertinent information from an SFT into the FCB>
 13914                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13915                                  ;
 13916                                  ;   SaveFCBInfo - given an FCB and its associated SFT, copy the relevant
 13917                                  ;	pieces of information into the FCB to allow for subsequent
 13918                                  ;	regeneration. Poke LRU also.
 13919                                  ;
 13920                                  ;   Inputs:	ThisSFT points to a complete SFT.
 13921                                  ;		DS:SI point to the FCB (not an extended one)
 13922                                  ;   Outputs:	The relevant reserved fields in the FCB are filled in.
 13923                                  ;		DS:SI preserved
 13924                                  ;		ES:DI point to sft
 13925                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 13926                                  ;
 13927                                  ;
 13928                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13929                                  ;
 13930                                  
 13931                                  	; 08/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 13932                                  	; 20/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 13933                                  	
 13934                                  SaveFCBInfo:
 13935                                  
 13936 00001E1E 36C43E[9E05]            	LES	DI,[SS:THISSFT]		; SS override
 13937 00001E23 E80DFA                  	call	IsSFTNet
 13938 00001E26 740B                    	JZ	short SaveLocal		; if not network then save local info
 13939                                  ;
 13940                                  ;----- In net support -----
 13941                                  ;
 13942                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13943                                  
 13944                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 13945                                  	;;mov	ax,[es:di+1Dh]
 13946                                  	;mov	ax,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_dirsec]
 13947                                  	;;mov	[si+1Ah],ax
 13948                                  	;mov	[si+fcb_net_handle],ax
 13949                                  	;push	es
 13950                                  	;push	di
 13951                                  	;;les	di,[es:di+19h]
 13952                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+sf_netid]
 13953                                  	;;mov	[si+1Ch],di
 13954                                  	;MOV	[SI+fcb_netID],DI	; save net ID
 13955                                  	;;mov 	[si+1Eh],es

 14142                                  ;Break	<ResetLRU - reset overflowed lru counts>
 14143                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14144                                  ;
 14145                                  ;   ResetLRU - during lru updates, we may wrap at 64K. We must walk the
 14146                                  ;   entire set of SFTs and subtract 8000h from their lru counts and truncate
 14147                                  ;   at 0.
 14148                                  ;
 14149                                  ;   Inputs:	BX is offset into SFT field where lru firld is kept
 14150                                  ;		ES:DI point to SFT currently being updated
 14151                                  ;   Outputs:	All FCB SFTs have their lru fields truncated
 14152                                  ;		AX has 8000h
 14153                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 14154                                  ;
 14155                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14156                                  ;
 14157                                  
 14158                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14159                                  ResetLRU:
 14160                                  	; ResetLRU is only called from fcbio.asm. So SS can be assumed to be 
 14161                                  	; DOSDATA
 14162

 14165 00001ECC 57                      	push	di

 14168                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]

 14170                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 14171 00001ED6 8D7D06                  	LEA	DI,[DI+SFT.SFTable] 	; point at table
 14172                                  ovScan:
 14173 00001ED9 262901                  	SUB	[ES:DI+BX],AX		; decrement lru count
 14174 00001EDC 7703                    	JA	short ovLoop

 14225                                  ; LRUFCB for MSDOS 6.0 !
 14226                                  
 14227                                  ;Break	<LRUFCB - perform LRU on FCB sfts>
 14228                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14229                                  ;
 14230                                  ;   LRUFCB - find LRU fcb in cache. Set ThisSFT and return it. We preserve
 14231                                  ;	the first keepcount sfts if they are network sfts or if sharing is
 14232                                  ;	loaded.  If carry is set then NO BLASTING is NECESSARY.
 14233                                  ;
 14234                                  ;   Inputs:	none
 14235                                  ;   Outputs:	ES:DI point to SFT
 14236                                  ;		ThisSFT points to SFT
 14237                                  ;		SFT is zeroed
 14238                                  ;		Carry set of closes failed
 14239                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 14240                                  ;
