 31752                                  ;	  sf_devptr = dword at dir_first (pointer to device header)
 31753                                  ;	  sf_size = 0
 31754                                  ;	  If file
 31755                                  ;	  sf_firclus sf_size set from entry
 31756                                  ;	  sf_devptr = [THISDPB]
 31757                                  ;	  sf_cluspos = 0
 31758                                  ;	  sf_lstclus = sf_firclus
 31759                                  ;	  sf_dirsec sf_dirpos set
 31760                                  ; DS,SI,BX preserved, others destroyed
 31761                                  ;

 31764                                  	; 23/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 31765                                  	; DOSCODE:96C3h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)

 32030                                  ; Procedure Name : FREEENT
 32031                                  ;
 32032                                  ; Inputs:
 32033                                  ;	  ES:BP -> DPB
 32034                                  ;	  [CURBUF] Set
 32035                                  ;	  [CURBUF+2]:BX points to directory entry
 32036                                  ;	  [CURBUF+2]:SI points to above dir_first
 32037                                  ; Function:
 32038                                  ;	  Free the cluster chain for the entry if present
 32039                                  ; Outputs:
 32040                                  ;	  Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)

 32043                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 32045                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 32139                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32140                                  ;
 32141                                  ; Procedure Name : CHECK_VIRT_OPEN
 32142                                  ;
 32143                                  ; CHECK_VIRT_OPEN checks to see if we had performed a "virtual open" (by
 32144                                  ; examining the flag [VIRTUAL_OPEN] to see if it is 1). If we did, then
 32145                                  ; it calls Dev_Close_SFT to decrement the ref. count. It also resets the
 32146                                  ; flag [VIRTUAL_OPEN].
 32147                                  ; No registers affected (including flags).
 32148                                  ; On input, [THISSFT] points to current SFT.
 32149                                  ;
 32150                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32151                                  
 32152                                  CHECK_VIRT_OPEN:
 32153                                  	PUSH	AX
 32154                                  	lahf			; preserve flags
 32155                                  	CMP	byte [VIRTUAL_OPEN],0
 32156                                  	JZ	short ALL_CLOSED
 32157                                  	mov	byte [VIRTUAL_OPEN],0 ; reset flag
 32158                                  	push	es
 32159                                  	push	di
 32160                                  	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 32161                                  	call	DEV_CLOSE_SFT
 32162                                  	pop	di
 32163                                  	pop	es
 32164                                  
 32165                                  ALL_CLOSED:
 32166                                  	sahf			; restore flags
 32167                                  	POP	AX
 32168                                  	retn
 32169                                  
 32170                                  %endif

 32204                                  ;Break   <FNDCLUS -- Skip over allocation units>
 32205                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32206                                  ;
 32207                                  ; Procedure Name : FNDCLUS
 32208                                  ;
 32209                                  ; Inputs:
 32210                                  ;       CX = No. of clusters to skip
 32211                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 32212                                  ;       [THISSFT] point to SFT
 32213                                  ; Outputs:
 32214                                  ;       BX = Last cluster skipped to
 32215                                  ;       CX = No. of clusters remaining (0 unless EOF)
 32216                                  ;       DX = Position of last cluster
 32217                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 32218                                  ; DI destroyed. No other registers affected.
 32219                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32220

 32343                                  	;push	word [LASTPOS_HW]
 32344                                  	;push	dx
 32345                                  	;push	word [CLSKIP_HW]

 32352                                  	;pop	dx
 32353                                  	;pop	word [LASTPOS_HW]

 32355 00005406 7242                    	jc	short fndclus_retn
 32356

 32363 0000541A 7206                    	jc	short SKPCLP2

 32424                                  ;Break  <BUFSEC -- BUFFER A SECTOR AND SET UP A TRANSFER>
 32425                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32426                                  ;
 32427                                  ; Procedure Name : BUFSEC
 32428                                  ;
 32429                                  ; Inputs:
 32430                                  ;       AH = priority of buffer
 32431                                  ;       AL = 0 if buffer must be read, 1 if no pre-read needed
 32432                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 32433                                  ;       [CLUSNUM] = Physical cluster number
 32434                                  ;       [SECCLUSPOS] = Sector position of transfer within cluster
 32435                                  ;       [BYTCNT1] = Size of transfer
 32436                                  ; Function:
 32437                                  ;       Insure specified sector is in buffer, flushing buffer before
 32438                                  ;       read if necessary.
 32439                                  ; Outputs:
 32440                                  ;       ES:DI = Pointer to buffer
 32441                                  ;       SI = Pointer to transfer address
 32442                                  ;       CX = Number of bytes
 32443                                  ;       [NEXTADD] updated
 32444                                  ;       [TRANS] set to indicate a transfer will occur
 32445                                  ;       Carry set if error (user FAILed to I 24)
 32446                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32447                                  
 32448                                  	; 25/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 32449                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:98C2h
 32450                                  
 32451                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8BF1h) - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1)
 32452                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8C2Ch) - Retro DOS v4.2
 32453                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0BE33h)
 32454                                  
 32455                                  BUFSEC:
 32456                                  	; 25/02/2024
 32457                                  	;;;
 32458                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 32459 0000544B 8B16[DE0A]              	mov	dx,[CLUSNUM_HW]
 32460                                  	;mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],dx
 32461 0000544F 8716[E80A]              	xchg	dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 32462 00005453 52                      	push	dx	; [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 32463                                  	;;;
 32464 00005454 8B16[BC05]                      MOV     DX,[CLUSNUM]
 32465 00005458 8A1E[7305]                      MOV     BL,[SECCLUSPOS]
 32466                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],38h
 32467 0000545C C606[4B03]38                    MOV     byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY+Allowed_IGNORE
 32468 00005461 E89A01                          CALL    FIGREC
 32469 00005464 E81F11                  	call	GETBUFFR
 32470                                  	; 25/02/2024
 32471                                  	;;;
 32472 00005467 8F06[E80A]              	pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 32473                                  	;;;
 32474 0000546B 72DD                            jc	short fndclus_retn
 32475                                  
 32476 0000546D C606[7405]01                    MOV     BYTE [TRANS],1	; A transfer is taking place
 32477 00005472 8B36[B805]                      MOV     SI,[NEXTADD]
 32478 00005476 89F7                            MOV     DI,SI
 32479 00005478 8B0E[D205]                      MOV     CX,[BYTCNT1]
 32480 0000547C 01CF                            ADD     DI,CX
 32481 0000547E 893E[B805]                      MOV     [NEXTADD],DI
 32482 00005482 C43E[E205]                      LES     DI,[CURBUF]
 32483                                  	;or	byte [es:di+5],8
 32484 00005486 26804D0508                      OR      byte [ES:DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_isDATA
 32485                                  	;;;lea	di,[di+16] ; MSDOS 3.3 
 32486                                  	;;lea	di,[di+20] ; MSDOS 6.0
 32487                                          ;lea	di,[di+24] ; PCDOS 7.1  ; 25/02/2024
 32488 0000548B 8D7D18                  	LEA     DI,[DI+BUFINSIZ]        ; Point to buffer
 32489 0000548E 033E[CC05]                      ADD     DI,[BYTSECPOS]
 32490 00005492 F8                              CLC	; (not necessary!?) ; 25/02/2024
 32491 00005493 C3                              retn
 32492                                  
 32493                                  ;Break   <BUFRD, BUFWRT -- PERFORM BUFFERED READ AND WRITE>
 32494                                  
 32495                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32496                                  ;
 32497                                  ; Procedure Name : BUFRD
 32498                                  ;
 32499                                  ; Do a partial sector read via one of the system buffers
 32500                                  ; ES:BP Points to DPB
 32501                                  ; Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 32502                                  ;
 32503                                  ; DS - set to DOSDATA
 32504                                  ;
 32505                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32506                                  
 32507                                  	; 25/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 32508                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32509                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32510                                  BUFRD:
 32511 00005494 06                              PUSH	ES
 32512 00005495 31C0                            xor	ax,ax			; pre-read sector
 32513 00005497 E8B1FF                          CALL    BUFSEC
 32514 0000549A 7303                            JNC	short BUF_OK ; ds=ss
 32515                                  
 32516                                  BUF_IO_FAIL:				; this label used by BUFWRT also
 32517 0000549C 07                              POP	ES
 32518 0000549D EB2D                            JMP     SHORT RBUFPLACED ; ds=ss
 32519                                  
 32520                                  BUF_OK:
 32521 0000549F 8CC3                            MOV     BX,ES
 32522 000054A1 8E06[2E03]                      MOV     ES,[DMAADD+2]
 32523 000054A5 8EDB                            MOV     DS,BX
 32524 000054A7 87F7                    	XCHG    DI,SI
 32525 000054A9 D1E9                            SHR     CX,1
 32526                                  ;M039
 32527                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 32528                                  	;JNC	short EVENRD
 32529                                  	;MOVSB
 32530                                  ;EVENRD:
 32531                                  	;REP     MOVSW
 32532                                  
 32533                                  ;	CX = # of whole WORDs ; CF=1 if odd # of bytes.
 32534                                  ;       DS:SI-> Source within Buffer.
 32535                                  ;       ES:DI-> Destination within Transfer memory block.
 32536                                  
 32537                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32538 000054AB F3A5                    	rep	movsw			;Copy Buffer to Transfer memory.
 32539                                  	;adc	cx,0                    ;CX=1 if odd # of bytes, else CX=0.
 32540                                  	;rep	movsb                   ;Copy last byte.
 32541                                  	; 16/12/2022
 32542 000054AD 7301                    	jnc	short EVENRD ; **** 20/05/2019
 32543 000054AF A4                      	movsb ; ****
 32544                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 32545                                  	;adc	cx,0
 32546                                  	;rep	movsb
 32547                                  ;M039
 32548                                  EVENRD: ; ****
 32549 000054B0 07                              POP	ES
 32550                                  ;hkn; SS override
 32551 000054B1 36C53E[E205]                    LDS     DI,[SS:CURBUF]
 32552                                  	;;;lea	bx,[di+16]
 32553                                  	;;lea	bx,[di+20] ; MSDOS 6.0
 32554                                  	;lea	bx,[di+24] ; PCDOS 7.1	; 25/02/2024
 32555 000054B6 8D5D18                  	LEA     BX,[DI+BUFINSIZ]
 32556 000054B9 29DE                            SUB     SI,BX                   ; Position in buffer
 32557 000054BB E86A10                          call	PLACEBUF
 32558                                  	;cmp	si,[es:bp+2]
 32559 000054BE 263B7602                	CMP	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE] ; Read Last byte?
 32560 000054C2 7205                            JB	short RBUFPLACEDC ; ds<>ss ; No, leave buf where it is
 32561                                  ;M039
 32562                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 32563                                  	;call	PLACEHEAD               ; Make it prime candidate for chucking
 32564                                                                          ;  even though it is MRU.
 32565                                          ; MSDOS 6.0
 32566 000054C4 36893E[6D00]            	MOV	[ss:BufferQueue],DI	; Make it prime candidate for
 32567                                  ;M039					; chucking even though it is MRU.
 32568                                  
 32569                                  RBUFPLACEDC:
 32570 000054C9 F8                              CLC
 32571                                  ;RBUFPLACED:
 32572 000054CA 16                      	push	ss
 32573 000054CB 1F                      	pop	ds
 32574                                  RBUFPLACED:	; 25/02/2024 (ds=ss)
 32575 000054CC C3                              retn
 32576

 32579                                  ; Procedure : BUFWRT
 32580                                  ;
 32581                                  ; Do a partial sector write via one of the system buffers
 32582                                  ; ES:BP Points to DPB

 32584                                  ;

 32769                                  ;Break	<OPTIMIZE -- DO A USER DISK REQUEST WELL>
 32770                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32771                                  ;
 32772                                  ; Procedure Name : OPTIMIZE
 32773                                  ;
 32774                                  ; Inputs:
 32775                                  ;	  BX = Physical cluster
 32776                                  ;	  CX = No. of records
 32777                                  ;	  DL = sector within cluster
 32778                                  ;	  ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 32779                                  ;	  [NEXTADD] = transfer address
 32780                                  ; Outputs:
 32781                                  ;	  AX = No. of records remaining
 32782                                  ;	  BX = Transfer address
 32783                                  ;	  CX = No. or records to be transferred
 32784                                  ;	  DX = Physical sector address (LOW)
 32785                                  ;	  [HIGH_SECTOR] = Physical sector address (HIGH)
 32786                                  ;	  DI = Next cluster
 32787                                  ;	  [CLUSNUM] = Last cluster accessed
 32788                                  ;	  [NEXTADD] updated
 32789                                  ;	  Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 32790                                  ; ES:BP unchanged. Note that segment of transfer not set.
 32791                                  ;
 32792                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32793                                  
 32794                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32795                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 32796                                  
 32797                                  OPTIMIZE:
 32798 0000556F 52                      	PUSH	DX
 32799                                  	; 27/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 32800                                  	;;;
 32801 00005570 FF36[E80A]              	push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 32802                                  	;;;
 32803 00005574 53                      	PUSH	BX
 32804                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+4]
 32805 00005575 268A4604                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]
 32806 00005579 FEC0                    	INC	AL		; Number of sectors per cluster
 32807 0000557B 88C4                    	MOV	AH,AL
 32808 0000557D 28D0                    	SUB	AL,DL		; AL = Num of sectors left in first cluster
 32809 0000557F 89CA                    	MOV	DX,CX
 32810                                  	;MOV	CX,0
 32811                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 32812                                  	; 16/12/2022
 32813 00005581 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx	; sub cx,cx
 32814                                  OPTCLUS:
 32815                                  ; AL has number of sectors available in current cluster
 32816                                  ; AH has number of sectors available in next cluster
 32817                                  ; BX has current physical cluster
 32818                                  ; CX has number of sequential sectors found so far
 32819                                  ; DX has number of sectors left to transfer
 32820                                  ; ES:BP Points to DPB
 32821                                  ; ES:SI has FAT pointer
 32822                                  
 32823                                  do_norm3:
 32824 00005583 E8B109                  	call	UNPACK
 32825 00005586 7263                    	JC	short OP_ERR	; ds=ss ; 27/02/2024
 32826                                  ;clusgot2:
 32827 00005588 00C1                    	ADD	CL,AL
 32828 0000558A 80D500                  	ADC	CH,0

 33040                                  
 33041                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33042                                  ; DOSCODE:8DC2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 33043                                  
 33044                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 33045                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset
 33046                                  
 33047                                  ;Break   <ALLOCATE -- Assign disk space>
 33048                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33049                                  ;
 33050                                  ; Procedure Name : ALLOCATE - Allocate Disk Space
 33051                                  ;
 33052                                  ;   ALLOCATE is called to allocate disk clusters. The new clusters are
 33053                                  ;   FAT-chained onto the end of the existing file.
 33054                                  ;
 33055                                  ;   The DPB contains the cluster # of the last free cluster allocated
 33056                                  ;   (dpb_next_free). We start at this cluster and scan towards higher
 33057                                  ;   numbered clusters, looking for the necessary free blocks.
 33058                                  ;
 33059                                  ;   Once again, fancy terminology gets in the way of correct coding. When
 33060                                  ;   using next_free, start scanning AT THAT POINT and not the one following it.
 33061                                  ;   This fixes the boundary condition bug when only free = next_free = 2.
 33062                                  ;
 33063                                  ;       If we get to the end of the disk without satisfaction:
 33064                                  ;
 33065                                  ;           if (dpb_next_free == 2) then we've scanned the whole disk.
 33066                                  ;               return (insufficient_disk_space)
 33067                                  ;           ELSE
 33068                                  ;               dpb_next_free = 2; start scan over from the beginning.
 33069                                  ;
 33070                                  ;   Note that there is no multitasking interlock. There is no race when
 33071                                  ;   examining the entrys in an in-core FAT block since there will be no
 33072                                  ;   context switch. When UNPACK context switches while waiting for a FAT read
 33073                                  ;   we are done with any in-core FAT blocks, so again there is no race. The
 33074                                  ;   only special concern is that V2 and V3 MSDOS left the last allocated
 33075                                  ;   cluster as "00"; marking it EOF only when the entire alloc request was
 33076                                  ;   satisfied. We can't allow another activation to think this cluster is
 33077                                  ;   free, so we give it a special temporary mark to show that it is, indeed,
 33078                                  ;   allocated.
 33079                                  ;
 33080                                  ;   Note that when we run out of space this algorithem will scan from
 33081                                  ;   dpb_next_free to the end, then scan from cluster 2 through the end,
 33082                                  ;   redundantly scanning the later part of the disk. This only happens when
 33083                                  ;   we run out of space, so sue me.
 33084                                  ;
 33085                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 33086                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 33087                                  ;                                                                          ;
 33088                                  ;   The use of FATBYT and RESTFATBYT is somewhat mysterious. Here is the
 33089                                  ;   explanation:
 33090                                  ;
 33091                                  ;   In the NUL file case (sf_firclus currently 0) ALLOCATE is called with
 33092                                  ;   entry BX = 0. What needs to be done in this case is to stuff the cluster
 33093                                  ;   number of the first cluster allocated in sf_firclus when the ALLOCATE is
 33094                                  ;   complete. THIS VALUE IS SAVED TEMPORARILY IN CLUSTER 0, HENCE THE CURRENT
 33095                                  ;   VALUE IN CLUSTER 0 MUST BE SAVED AND RESTORED. This is a side effect of
 33096                                  ;   the fact that PACK and UNPACK don't treat requests for clusters 0 and 1 as
 33097                                  ;   errors. This "stuff" is done by the call to PACK which is right before
 33098                                  ;   the
 33099                                  ;           LOOP   findfre         ; alloc more if needed
 33100                                  ;   instruction when the first cluster is allocated to the nul file. The
 33101                                  ;   value is recalled from cluster 0 and stored at sf_firclus at ads4:
 33102                                  ;
 33103                                  ;   This method is obviously useless (because it is non-reentrant) for
 33104                                  ;   multitasking, and will have to be changed. Storing the required value on
 33105                                  ;   the stack is recommended. Setting sf_firclus at the PACK of cluster 0
 33106                                  ;   (instead of actually doing the PACK) is BAD because it doesn't handle
 33107                                  ;   problems with INT 24 well.
 33108                                  ;
 33109                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 33110                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 33111                                  ;                                                                          ;
 33112                                  ;       ENTRY   BX = Last cluster of file (0 if null file)
 33113                                  ;               CX = No. of clusters to allocate
 33114                                  ;               ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 33115                                  ;               [THISSFT] = Points to SFT
 33116                                  ;
 33117                                  ;       EXIT   'C' set if insufficient space
 33118                                  ;                [FAILERR] can be tested to see the reason for failure
 33119                                  ;                CX = max. no. of clusters that could be added to file
 33120                                  ;              'C' clear if space allocated
 33121                                  ;                BX = First cluster allocated
 33122                                  ;                FAT is fully updated
 33123                                  ;                sf_FIRCLUS field of SFT set if file was null
 33124                                  ;
 33125                                  ;       USES    ALL but SI, BP
 33126                                  
 33127                                  ;callmagic  proc near
 33128                                  ;       push    ds                             ;push segment of routine 
 33129                                  ;       push    Offset MagicPatch              ;push offset for routine
 33130                                  ;       retf                                   ;simulate jmp far
 33131                                  ;                                              ;far return address is on
 33132                                  ;                                              ;stack, so far return from
 33133                                  ;                                              ;call will return this routine
 33134                                  ;callmagic  endp
 33135                                  
 33136                                  ; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33137                                  ;PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9AC5h
 33138                                  
 33139                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8DC2h)
 33140                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C078h)
 33141                                  
 33142                                  ; 07/03/2025
 33143                                  ; 25/09/2023
 33144                                  %if 0	; 27/02/2024
 33145                                  callmagic:
 33146                                  	push	ds
 33147                                  	push	word [ss:OffsetMagicPatch]
 33148                                  	retf	
 33149                                  %endif
 33150                                  
 33151                                  ; 10/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33152                                  %if 1
 33153                                  ALLOCATE_X:
 33154 00005636 A3[F00A]                	mov	[CCOUNT_HW],ax
 33155                                  	;jmp	short ALLOCATE
 33156                                  %endif
 33157                                  
 33158                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33159                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9ACFh
 33160                                  
 33161                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8DC9h)
 33162                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C07Fh)
 33163                                  
 33164                                  ALLOCATE:

 33172                                  ;FAT would allows allocation, but the free space for compressed

 33175                                  ;;;	call    far ptr MAGICPATCH

 33200                                  Regular_Allocate_Path:

 33765                                  ; Inputs:

 33774                                  
 33775                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33776                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9D13h
 33777                                  
 33778                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8E86h)
 33779                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C27Fh)
 33780                                  
 33781                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 33782                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33783                                  RELEASE:
 33784 00005826 31D2                            XOR     DX,DX
 33785                                  	
 33786                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33787                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33788                                  	;;;
 33789 00005828 8916[EA0A]              	mov	[CLUSDATA_HW],dx ; (dx = 0, release)
 33790                                  	;;;
 33791                                  
 33792                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9D19h
 33793                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8E88h)
 33794                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C285h)
 33795                                  
 33796                                  	;entry	RELBLKS
 33797                                  RELBLKS:
 33798                                  
 33799                                  ;   Enter here with DX=0FFFFH to put an end-of-file mark in the first cluster
 33800                                  ;   and free the rest in the chain.
 33801                                  
 33802 0000582C E80807                  	call	UNPACK
 33803                                  	;jc	short RELEASE_flush
 33804                                  	;jz	short RELEASE_flush
 33805                                  	; 28/12/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33806 0000582F 7652                            jbe	short RET12 ; jna short RET12
 33807                                  				; CCONTENT_HW:DI= Content of FAT
 33808                                   				; for given cluster (next cluster)
 33809 00005831 89F8                    	MOV     AX,DI
 33810 00005833 52                              PUSH    DX
 33811                                  
 33812                                  	;;; 28/12/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33813                                  	;push	ax
 33814                                  	;;;
 33815                                  
 33816 00005834 E8AF07                  	call	PACK
 33817                                  
 33818                                  	;;; 28/12/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33819                                  	;pop	ax
 33820 00005837 8B16[EC0A]              	mov	dx,[CCONTENT_HW]
 33821 0000583B 8916[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],dx ; next cluster (hw) to be released
 33822 0000583F 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax		 ; next cluster (lw) to be released
 33823                                  	;;;
 33824                                          
 33825 00005841 5A                      	POP     DX
 33826                                  	;jc	short RELEASE_flush
 33827                                  	; 28/12/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33828 00005842 723F                    	jc	short RET12
 33829                                          
 33830 00005844 09D2                    	OR      DX,DX
 33831 00005846 751F                            JNZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; Was putting EOF mark
 33832                                  
 33833                                  ; 28/02/2024
 33834                                  %if 0
 33835                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1 ; MSDOS 3.3
 33836                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 33837                                  	CMP     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 33838                                          JZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; No
 33839                                          INC	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 33840                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 33841                                          MOV     BX,AX
 33842                                          dec     ax              	; check for "1"
 33843                                  	jz	short RELEASE_flush	; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 33844                                  %else
 33845                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33846                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33847                                  	;;;
 33848 00005848 3B16[EA0A]              	cmp	dx,[CLUSDATA_HW]	; > 0 ? (delete, release)
 33849 0000584C 7519                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC	; no, EOF (allocate, -1), (dx = 0)
 33850                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh
 33851 0000584E 26837E1FFF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],0FFFFh ; -1
 33852                                  					; Free count valid?
 33853 00005853 7412                    	jz	short NO_DEALLOC	; No (dx = 0)
 33854                                  relblks_ifc:
 33855                                  	;inc	word ptr es:[bp+1Fh]
 33856 00005855 26FF461F                	inc	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 33857 00005859 7519                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC2
 33858                                  
 33859                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],dx
 33860 0000585B 2639560F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],dx
 33861 0000585F 7513                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC2	; not FAT32
 33862                                  
 33863                                  	;inc	word [es:bp+21h]
 33864 00005861 26FF4621                	inc	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT+2]
 33865 00005865 EB0D                    	jmp	short NO_DEALLOC2
 33866                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 33867                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],dx
 33868 00005867 2639560F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],dx	; dx is -1 or 0
 33869                                  					; (valid 16 bit fat size is another number)
 33870 0000586B 7507                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC2 ; FAT (FAT16 or FAT12)
 33871                                  					; dx = 0, FAT32
 33872                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh
 33873 0000586D 26837E21FF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT+2],0FFFFh
 33874 00005872 75E1                    	jnz	short relblks_ifc
 33875                                  NO_DEALLOC2:
 33876 00005874 833E[E80A]00            	cmp	word [CLUSTNUM_HW],0
 33877 00005879 7503                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC3
 33878 0000587B 48                      	dec	ax			; check for "1"	
 33879 0000587C 7405                    	jz	short RET12		; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 33880                                  NO_DEALLOC3:
 33881                                  	;;;
 33882                                  %endif
 33883                                  
 33884 0000587E E88D06                  	call	IsEOF
 33885 00005881 72A3                            JB	short RELEASE	; Carry clear if JMP not taken
 33886                                  
 33887                                  	; 16/12/2022
 33888                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 33889                                  ; 28/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33890                                  %if 0
 33891                                  RELEASE_flush:
 33892                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33893                                  	mov	al,[es:bp]
 33894                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 33895                                  	push	si		; FLUSHBUF may trash these and we guarantee
 33896                                  	push	cx		;  them to be preserved.
 33897                                  	push	es
 33898                                  	push	bp
 33899                                  	call	FLUSHBUF	; commit buffers for this drive
 33900                                  	pop	bp
 33901                                  	pop	es
 33902                                  	pop	cx
 33903                                  	pop	si
 33904                                  %endif		; 28/02/2024
 33905                                  
 33906                                  RET12:
 33907 00005883 C3                      	retn
 33908                                  
 33909                                  ;Break	<GETEOF -- Find the end of a file>
 33910                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33911                                  ;
 33912                                  ; Procedure Name : GETEOF
 33913                                  ;
 33914                                  ; Inputs:
 33915                                  ;       ES:BP Points to DPB
 33916                                  ;       BX = Cluster in a file
 33917                                  ;       DS = CS
 33918                                  ; Outputs:
 33919                                  ;       BX = Last cluster in the file
 33920                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 33921                                  ; DI destroyed. No other registers affected.
 33922                                  ;
 33923                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33924                                  
 33925                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33926                                  %if 0
 33927                                  GETEOF:
 33928                                  	call	UNPACK
 33929                                          jc	short RET12
 33930                                          PUSH    BX
 33931                                          MOV     BX,DI
 33932                                  	call	IsEOF
 33933                                          POP     BX
 33934                                          JAE     short RET12
 33935                                          MOV     BX,DI
 33936                                          JMP     short GETEOF
 33937                                  %else
 33938                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33939                                  	;;;
 33940                                  GETEOF4:	; **
 33941 00005884 8F06[E80A]              	pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; * ; 28/02/2024
 33942                                  GETEOF1:
 33943 00005888 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 33944 0000588A 8916[F20A]              	mov	[CLUSTERS_HW],dx ; CLUSTERS_HW:DI = Cluster Count
 33945 0000588E 58                      	pop	ax
 33946 0000588F 5A                      	pop	dx
 33947 00005890 C3                      	retn
 33948                                  
 33949                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9D7Ch
 33950                                  GETEOF:
 33951 00005891 52                      	push	dx
 33952 00005892 50                      	push	ax
 33953 00005893 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx ; 0	; cluster count = 0
 33954 00005895 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax ; 0
 33955                                  GETEOF2:
 33956 00005897 E89D06                  	call	UNPACK
 33957 0000589A 72EC                    	jc	short GETEOF1
 33958                                  		; CCONTENT_HW:DI = next cluster (cluster content)
 33959 0000589C 40                      	inc	ax
 33960 0000589D 7501                    	jnz	short GETEOF3
 33961 0000589F 42                      	inc	dx
 33962                                  GETEOF3:
 33963 000058A0 FF36[E80A]              	push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; * ; 28/02/2024
 33964 000058A4 53                      	push    bx
 33965                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 33966 000058A5 8B1E[EC0A]              	mov	bx,[CCONTENT_HW]
 33967 000058A9 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 33968 000058AD 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 33969 000058AF E85C06                  	call	IsEOF
 33970                                  	;pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; * ; 28/02/2024
 33971 000058B2 5B                      	pop	bx
 33972                                  	;jae	short GETEOF1   ; EOF
 33973 000058B3 73CF                    	jae	short GETEOF4 ; ** ; 28/02/2024
 33974                                  	;mov	bx,[CCONTENT_HW] ; not EOF
 33975                                  	;mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 33976 000058B5 5B                      	pop	bx	; * ; 28/02/2024
 33977 000058B6 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 33978 000058B8 EBDD                    	jmp	short GETEOF2   ; get next cluster
 33979                                  	;;;
 33980                                  %endif

 34007                                  ;

 34020                                  ;
 34021                                  ; Procedure : MakeFcb
 34022                                  ;
 34023                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34024                                  
 34025                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34026                                  	; DOSCODE:8E77h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34027                                  
 34028                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34029                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9DB0h
 34030                                  
 34031                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8ED3h)
 34032                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:8D92h)
 34033                                  
 34034                                  MAKEFCB:
 34035                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34036                                  	;MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0
 34037 000058BA 30D2                    	XOR	DL,DL		; Flag--not ambiguous file name
 34038                                  	; 29/02/2024
 34039 000058BC 368816[4E03]            	mov	[ss:SpaceFlag],dl ; 0
 34040                                  	;test	al,2
 34041 000058C1 A802                    	test	AL,DRVBIT	; Use current drive field if default?
 34042 000058C3 7503                    	JNZ	short DEFDRV
 34043                                  	;MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0	; No - use default drive
 34044                                  	; 29/02/2024
 34045 000058C5 268815                  	mov	[es:di],dl ; 0
 34046                                  DEFDRV:
 34047 000058C8 47                      	INC	DI
 34048 000058C9 B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 34049                                  	;test	al,4
 34050 000058CC A804                    	test	AL,NAMBIT	; Use current name fields as default?
 34051 000058CE 93                      	XCHG	AX,BX		; Save bits in BX
 34052 000058CF B020                    	MOV	AL," "
 34053 000058D1 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB	; If not, go fill with blanks
 34054 000058D3 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 34055 000058D5 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX		; Don't fill any
 34056                                  FILLB:
 34057 000058D7 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34058 000058D9 B103                    	MOV	CL,3
 34059 000058DB F6C308                  	test	BL,EXTBIT	; Use current extension as default
 34060 000058DE 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB2
 34061 000058E0 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 34062 000058E2 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX
 34063                                  FILLB2:
 34064 000058E4 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34065 000058E6 91                      	XCHG	AX,CX		; Put zero in AX
 34066 000058E7 AB                      	STOSW
 34067 000058E8 AB                      	STOSW			; Initialize two words after to zero
 34068 000058E9 83EF10                  	SUB	DI,16		; Point back at start
 34069                                  	;test	bl,1
 34070 000058EC F6C301                  	test	BL,SCANSEPARATOR; Scan off separators if not zero
 34071 000058EF 7409                    	JZ	short SKPSPC
 34072 000058F1 E88800                  	CALL	SCANB		; Peel off blanks and tabs
 34073 000058F4 E81E01                  	CALL	DELIM		; Is it a one-time-only delimiter?
 34074 000058F7 7504                    	JNZ	short NOSCAN
 34075 000058F9 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over the delimiter
 34076                                  SKPSPC:
 34077 000058FA E87F00                  	CALL	SCANB		; Always kill preceding blanks and tabs
 34078                                  NOSCAN:
 34079 000058FD E8EC00                  	CALL	GETLET
 34080 00005900 761E                    	JBE	short NODRV	; Quit if termination character
 34081 00005902 803C3A                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],":"	; Check for potential drive specifier
 34082 00005905 7519                    	JNZ	short NODRV
 34083 00005907 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over colon
 34084 00005908 2C40                    	SUB	AL,"@"          ; Convert drive letter to drive number (A=1)
 34085 0000590A 760F                    	JBE	short BADDRV	; Drive letter out of range
 34086                                  
 34087 0000590C 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34088 0000590D E8961E                  	call	GetVisDrv
 34089 00005910 58                      	POP	AX
 34090 00005911 730A                    	JNC	short HAVDRV
 34091                                  
 34092                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34093                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34094                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34095 00005913 36803E[1006]1A          	CMP	byte [SS:DrvErr],error_not_DOS_disk ; 1Ah
 34096                                  					; if not FAT drive ;AN000;
 34097 00005919 7402                    	JZ	short HAVDRV		; assume ok	   ;AN000;
 34098                                  BADDRV:
 34099 0000591B B2FF                    	MOV	DL,-1
 34100                                  HAVDRV:
 34101 0000591D AA                      	STOSB			; Put drive specifier in first byte
 34102 0000591E 46                      	INC	SI
 34103 0000591F 4F                      	DEC	DI		; Counteract next two instructions
 34104                                  NODRV:
 34105 00005920 4E                      	DEC	SI		; Back up
 34106 00005921 47                      	INC	DI		; Skip drive byte
 34107                                  
 34108                                  	;entry	NORMSCAN
 34109                                  NORMSCAN:
 34110 00005922 B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 34111 00005925 E82200                  	CALL	GETWORD 	; Get 8-letter file name
 34112 00005928 803C2E                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],"."
 34113 0000592B 7510                    	JNZ	short NODOT
 34114 0000592D 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over dot if present
 34115                                  
 34116                                  	; 24/09/2023
 34117                                  	;mov	cx,3
 34118 0000592E B103                    	mov	cl,3	; ch=0
 34119                                  
 34120                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34121                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34122                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],DBCS_VOLID2 ; 100h ;AN000;
 34123                                  	; 10/06/2019
 34124 00005930 36F606[1206]01          	test	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(DBCS_VOLID2>>8) ; 1
 34125 00005936 7402                    	JZ	short VOLOK				;AN000;
 34126 00005938 A4                      	MOVSB			; 2nd byte of DBCS	;AN000;
 34127                                  	; 24/09/2023
 34128                                  	;MOV	CX,2					;AN000;
 34129 00005939 49                      	dec	cx  ; cx=2
 34130                                  	;JMP	SHORT contvol				;AN000;
 34131                                  VOLOK:
 34132                                  	;MOV	CX,3		; Get 3-letter extension
 34133                                  contvol:
 34134 0000593A E81300                  	CALL	MUSTGETWORD
 34135                                  NODOT:
 34136 0000593D 88D0                    	MOV	AL,DL
 34137                                  
 34138                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34139                                  	;and	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],0FEFFh
 34140                                  	; 18/12/2022
 34141 0000593F 368026[1206]FE          	and	byte [ss:DOS34_FLAG+1],0FEh ; (~DBCS_VOLID2)>>8
 34142                                  	;and	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],~DBCS_VOLID2 ; ### BUG FIX ###
 34143                                  
 34144 00005945 C3                      	retn
 34145                                  
 34146                                  NONAM:
 34147 00005946 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 34148 00005948 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34149 00005949 C3                      	retn
 34150                                  
 34151                                  GETWORD:
 34152 0000594A E89F00                  	CALL	GETLET		
 34153 0000594D 76F7                    	JBE	short NONAM	; Exit if invalid character
 34154 0000594F 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34155                                  
 34156                                  ;	UGH!!! Horrible bug here that should be fixed at some point:
 34157                                  ;	If the name we are scanning is longer than CX, we keep on reading!
 34158                                  
 34159                                  MUSTGETWORD:
 34160 00005950 E89900                  	CALL	GETLET
 34161                                  
 34162                                  ;	If spaceFlag is set then we allow spaces in a pathname
 34163                                  
 34164                                  ;IF NOT TABLELOOK
 34165                                  ;	JB	short FILLNAM  ; MSDOS 3.3
 34166                                  ;ENDIF
 34167 00005953 750C                    	JNZ	short MustCheckCX
 34168                                  
 34169                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34170 00005955 36F606[4E03]FF          	test	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0FFh
 34171 0000595B 7419                    	JZ	short FILLNAM
 34172 0000595D 3C20                    	CMP	AL," "
 34173 0000595F 7515                    	JNZ	short FILLNAM
 34174                                  
 34175                                  MustCheckCX:
 34176 00005961 E3ED                    	JCXZ	MUSTGETWORD
 34177 00005963 49                      	DEC	CX
 34178 00005964 3C2A                    	CMP	AL,"*"          ; Check for ambiguous file specifier
 34179 00005966 7504                    	JNZ	short NOSTAR
 34180 00005968 B03F                    	MOV	AL,"?"
 34181 0000596A F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34182                                  NOSTAR:
 34183 0000596C AA                      	STOSB
 34184 0000596D 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,"?"
 34185 0000596F 75DF                    	JNZ	short MUSTGETWORD
 34186 00005971 80CA01                  	OR	DL,1		; Flag ambiguous file name
 34187 00005974 EBDA                    	JMP	short MUSTGETWORD
 34188                                  FILLNAM:
 34189 00005976 B020                    	MOV	AL," "
 34190 00005978 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34191 0000597A 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34192 0000597B C3                      	retn
 34193                                  
 34194                                  SCANB:
 34195 0000597C AC                      	LODSB
 34196 0000597D E89D00                  	CALL	SPCHK
 34197 00005980 74FA                    	JZ	short SCANB
 34198 00005982 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34199                                  scanb_retn:
 34200 00005983 C3                      	retn

 34202                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34203                                  ;
 34204                                  ; Procedure Name : NameTrans
 34205                                  ;
 34206                                  ; NameTrans is used by FindPath to scan off an element of a path. We must
 34207                                  ; allow spaces in pathnames
 34208                                  ;
 34209                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI points to start of path element
 34210                                  ;   Outputs:	Name1 has unpacked name, uppercased
 34211                                  ;		ES = DOSGroup
 34212                                  ;		DS:SI advanced after name
 34213                                  ;   Registers modified: DI,AX,DX,CX
 34214                                  ;
 34215                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34216                                  
 34217                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34218                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34219                                  
 34220                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34221                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9E7Ch
 34222                                  
 34223                                  NameTrans:
 34224                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34225 00005984 36C606[4E03]01          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],1
 34226 0000598A 16                      	push	ss
 34227 0000598B 07                      	pop	es
 34228                                  
 34229                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 34230 0000598C BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 34231 0000598F 57                      	PUSH	DI
 34232                                  
 34233                                  ; 29/02/2024
 34234                                  %if 0
 34235                                  	MOV	AX,'  '	; 2020h
 34236                                  	MOV	CX,5
 34237                                  	STOSB
 34238                                  	REP	STOSW		; Fill "FCB" at NAME1 with spaces
 34239                                  	XOR	AL,AL		; Set stuff for NORMSCAN
 34240                                  	MOV	DL,AL
 34241                                  %else
 34242                                  	; 29/02/2024
 34243                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34244                                  	;;;
 34245 00005990 B020                    	mov     al, 20h ; ' '
 34246 00005992 B90B00                  	mov     cx, 11
 34247 00005995 F3AA                    	rep stosb               ; Fill "FCB" at NAME1 with spaces
 34248 00005997 91                      	xchg    ax, cx
 34249 00005998 99                      	cwd
 34250                                  	;;;
 34251                                  %endif
 34252                                  
 34253 00005999 AA                      	STOSB
 34254 0000599A 5F                      	POP	DI
 34255                                  
 34256 0000599B E884FF                  	CALL	NORMSCAN
 34257                                  
 34258                                  ;hkn; SS override for NAME1
 34259 0000599E 36803E[4B05]E5          	CMP	byte [SS:NAME1],0E5H
 34260 000059A4 75DD                    	jnz	short scanb_retn
 34261 000059A6 36C606[4B05]05          	MOV	byte [SS:NAME1],5 ; Magic name translation
 34262 000059AC C3                      	retn
 34263

 34267                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34268                                  ; DOSCODE:8FD2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34269                                  
 34270                                  ;If TableLook
 34271                                  
 34272                                  ;hkn; Table	SEGMENT
 34273                                  ;	PUBLIC	CharType
 34274                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34275                                  
 34276                                  ; Character type table for file name scanning
 34277                                  ; Table provides a mapping of characters to validity bits.
 34278                                  ; Four bits are provided for each character. Values 7Dh and above
 34279                                  ; have all bits set, so that part of the table is chopped off, and
 34280                                  ; the translation routine is responsible for screening these values.
 34281                                  ; The bit values are defined in DOSSYM.INC
 34282                                  
 34283                                  ;	      ; ^A and NUL
 34284                                  ;CharType:
 34285                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34286                                  ;	      ; ^C and ^B
 34287                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34288                                  ;	      ; ^E and ^D
 34289                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34290                                  ;	      ; ^G and ^F
 34291                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34292                                  ;	      ; TAB and BS
 34293                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34294                                  ;	      ; ^K and ^J
 34295                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34296                                  ;	      ; ^M and ^L
 34297                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34298                                  ;	      ; ^O and ^N
 34299                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34300                                  ;	      ; ^Q and ^P
 34301                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34302                                  ;	      ; ^S and ^R
 34303                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34304                                  ;	      ; ^U and ^T
 34305                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34306                                  ;	      ; ^W and ^V
 34307                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34308                                  ;	      ; ^Y and ^X
 34309                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34310                                  ;	      ; ESC and ^Z
 34311                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34312                                  ;	      ; ^] and ^;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34314                                  ;	      ; ^_ and ^^
 34315                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34316                                  ;	      ; ! and SPACE
 34317                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK)
 34318                                  ;	      ; # and "
 34319                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK)
 34320                                  ;	      ; $ - )
 34321                                  ;	 db   3 dup (0FFh)
 34322                                  ;	      ; + and *
 34323                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 34324                                  ;	      ; - and '
 34325                                  ;	 db   NOT (FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM)
 34326                                  ;	      ; / and .
 34327                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34328                                  ;	      ; 0 - 9
 34329                                  ;	 db   5 dup (0FFh)
 34330                                  ;	      ; ; and :
 34331                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 34332                                  ;	      ; = and <
 34333                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 34334                                  ;	      ; ? and >
 34335                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 34336                                  ;	      ; A - Z
 34337                                  ;	 db   13 dup (0FFh)
 34338                                  ;	      ; \ and [
 34339                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 34340                                  ;	      ; ^ and ]
 34341                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34342                                  ;	      ; _ - {
 34343                                  ;	 db   15 dup (0FFh)
 34344                                  ;	      ; } and |
 34345                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 34346                                  
 34347                                  ;CharType_last equ ($ - CharType) * 2	; This is the value of the last
 34348                                  ;					; character in the table
 34349                                  
 34350                                  ;FCHK	equ 1		; normal name char, no chks needed
 34351                                  ;FDELIM	equ 2		; is a delimiter
 34352                                  ;FSPCHK	equ 4		; set if character is not a space or equivalent
 34353                                  ;FFCB	equ 8		; is valid in an FCB
 34354                                  
 34355                                  ; DOSCODE:8FD2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34356                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34357                                  ; DOSCODE:8F76h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34358                                  
 34359                                  CharType: ; 63 bytes
 34360 000059AD 6666666606666666                db  66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 06h, 66h, 66h, 66h ; 0-7
 34361 000059B5 6666666666666666        	db  66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h ; 8-15
 34362 000059BD F8F6FFFFFF4FF46E        	db 0F8h,0F6h,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh, 4Fh,0F4h, 6Eh ; 16-23
 34363 000059C5 FFFFFFFFFF4444F4        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh, 44h, 44h,0F4h ; 24-31
 34364 000059CD FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh ; 32-39
 34365 000059D5 FFFFFFFFFF6F66FF        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh, 6Fh, 66h,0FFh ; 40-47
 34366 000059DD FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh ; 48-55
 34367 000059E5 FFFFFFFFFFFFF4          	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0F4h	   ; 56-62
 34368                                  
 34369                                  CharType_last equ ($ - CharType) * 2
 34370                                  
 34371                                  ; Offset 12CAh of IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), 1987
 34372                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34373                                  ;CharType:
 34374                                  ;       db 0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h
 34375                                  ;	db 0F6h,0F0h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h
 34376                                  ;	db 0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h
 34377                                  ;	db 0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h
 34378                                  ;	db 0F8h,0FFh,0F6h,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34379                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0F4h,0F4h,0FFh,0FEh,0F6h
 34380                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34381                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0F4h,0F4h,0F4h,0F4h,0F4h,0FFh
 34382                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34383                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34384                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34385                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0FFh,0FFh
 34386                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34387                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34388                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34389                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0F4h,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34390                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34391                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34392                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34393                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34394                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34395                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34396                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34397                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34398                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34399                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34400                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34401                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh

 34403                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34404                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34405                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 34406
