 34409                                  ;ENDIF
 34410                                  
 34411                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34412                                  ; DOSCODE:9011h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34413                                  
 34414                                  ; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34415                                  ; DOSCODE:8FB5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34416                                  
 34417                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34418                                  ;
 34419                                  ; Procedure Names : GetLet, UCase, GetLet3
 34420                                  ;
 34421                                  ; These routines take a character, convert it to upper case, and check
 34422                                  ; for delimiters.  Three different entry points:
 34423                                  ;	GetLet -  DS:[SI] = character to convert
 34424                                  ;	UCase  -  AL = character to convert
 34425                                  ;	GetLet3 - AL = character
 34426                                  ;		  [BX] = translation table to use
 34427                                  ;
 34428                                  ;	Exit (in all cases) : AL = upper case character
 34429                                  ;			      CY set if char is control char other than TAB
 34430                                  ;			      ZF set if char is a delimiter
 34431                                  ;	Uses : AX, flags
 34432                                  ;
 34433                                  ; NOTE: This routine exists in a fast table lookup version, and a slow
 34434                                  ; inline version.  Return with carry set is only possible in the inline
 34435                                  ; version. The table lookup version is the one in use.
 34436                                  ;
 34437                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34438                                  
 34439                                  ; This entry point has character at [SI]
 34440                                  
 34441                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5517h
 34442                                  GETLET:	
 34443 000059EC AC                      	LODSB
 34444                                  
 34445                                  ; This entry point has character in AL
 34446                                  
 34447                                  	;entry	UCase
 34448                                  UCase:	
 34449                                  	; 09/08/2018
 34450                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5518h
 34451                                  _UCase:
 34452 000059ED 53                      	PUSH	BX
 34453 000059EE BB[7E0B]                	MOV	BX,FILE_UCASE_TAB+2
 34454                                  
 34455                                  ; Convert the character in AL to upper case
 34456                                  
 34457                                  gl_0:
 34458 000059F1 3C61                    	CMP	AL,"a"
 34459 000059F3 7214                    	JB	short gl_2	; Already upper case, go check type
 34460 000059F5 3C7A                    	CMP	AL,"z"
 34461 000059F7 7702                    	JA	short gl_1
 34462 000059F9 2C20                    	SUB	AL,20H		; Convert to upper case
 34463                                  
 34464                                  ; Map European character to upper case
 34465                                  
 34466                                  gl_1:
 34467 000059FB 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80H
 34468 000059FD 720A                    	JB	short gl_2	; Not EuroChar, go check type
 34469 000059FF 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80H		; translate to upper case with this index
 34470                                  
 34471                                  	; M048 - Start 
 34472                                  	; Lantastic call Ucase thru int 2f without setting SS to DOSDATA.
 34473                                  	; So we shall set up DS and to access FILE_UCASE_TAB in BX and also 
 34474                                  	; preserve it.
 34475                                  
 34476                                  	; 09/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34477                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34478                                  	;;XLAT	BYTE [CS:BX]	; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 34479                                  	;CS	XLAT
 34480                                  
 34481                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34482                                  
 34483                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34484 00005A01 1E                      	push	ds
 34485                                  	;getdseg <ds>
 34486 00005A02 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 34487 00005A07 D7                      	XLAT			; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 34488 00005A08 1F                      	pop	ds
 34489                                  
 34490                                  	; M048 - End
 34491                                  
 34492                                  ; Now check the type
 34493                                  
 34494                                  ;If TableLook
 34495                                  gl_2:
 34496                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34497 00005A09 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34498                                  
 34499                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34500                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 34501                                  	;; 09/08/2018
 34502                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 34503                                  	;cs	xlat	
 34504                                  	
 34505                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34506 00005A0A E81800                  	CALL	GetCharType	; returns type flags in AL
 34507                                  	
 34508                                  	;test	al,1	
 34509 00005A0D A801                    	TEST	AL,FCHK 	; test for normal character
 34510 00005A0F 58                      	POP	AX
 34511                                  
 34512 00005A10 5B                      	POP	BX
 34513 00005A11 C3                      	RETN
 34514                                  
 34515                                  ; This entry has character in AL and lookup table in BX
 34516                                  
 34517                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34518                                  ;	;entry GetLet3
 34519                                  GETLET3: ; 10/08/2018
 34520 00005A12 53                      	PUSH	BX
 34521 00005A13 EBDC                    	JMP	short gl_0
 34522                                  ;ELSE
 34523                                  ;
 34524                                  ;gl_2:
 34525                                  ;	POP	BX
 34526                                  ;	CMP	AL,"."
 34527                                  ;	retz
 34528                                  ;	CMP	AL,'"'
 34529                                  ;	retz
 34530                                  ;	CALL	PATHCHRCMP
 34531                                  ;	retz
 34532                                  ;	CMP	AL,"["
 34533                                  ;	retz
 34534                                  ;	CMP	AL,"]"
 34535                                  ;	retz
 34536                                  ;ENDIF
 34537                                  
 34538                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------
 34539                                  ;
 34540                                  ; DELIM - check if character is a delimiter
 34541                                  ;	Entry : AX = character to check
 34542                                  ;	Exit  : ZF set if character is not a delimiter
 34543                                  ;	Uses  : Flags
 34544                                  ;
 34545                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
 34546                                  
 34547                                  	;entry	DELIM
 34548                                  DELIM:
 34549                                  ;IF TableLook
 34550                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34551 00005A15 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34552                                  
 34553                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34554                                  	;push	bx
 34555                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 34556                                  	;;09/08/2018
 34557                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 34558                                  	;cs	xlat
 34559                                  	;pop	bx
 34560                                  
 34561                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34562 00005A16 E80C00                  	CALL	GetCharType
 34563                                  	
 34564                                  	;test	al,2
 34565 00005A19 A802                    	TEST	AL,FDELIM
 34566 00005A1B 58                      	POP	AX
 34567 00005A1C C3                      	RETN
 34568                                  ;ELSE
 34569                                  ;	CMP	AL,":"
 34570                                  ;	retz
 34571                                  ;
 34572                                  ;	CMP	AL,"<"
 34573                                  ;	retz
 34574                                  ;	CMP	AL,"|"
 34575                                  ;	retz
 34576                                  ;	CMP	AL,">"
 34577                                  ;	retz
 34578                                  ;
 34579                                  ;	CMP	AL,"+"
 34580                                  ;	retz
 34581                                  ;	CMP	AL,"="
 34582                                  ;	retz
 34583                                  ;	CMP	AL,";"
 34584                                  ;	retz
 34585                                  ;	CMP	AL,","
 34586                                  ;	retz
 34587                                  ;ENDIF
 34588                                  
 34589                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34590                                  ;
 34591                                  ;  SPCHK - checks to see if a character is a space or equivalent
 34592                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to check
 34593                                  ;	Exit  : ZF set if character is a space
 34594                                  ;	Uses  : flags
 34595                                  ;
 34596                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34597                                  
 34598                                  	;entry SPCHK
 34599                                  SPCHK:
 34600                                  ;IF TableLook
 34601                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34602 00005A1D 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34603                                  
 34604                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34605                                  	;push	bx
 34606                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 34607                                  	;; 09/08/2018
 34608                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 34609                                  	;cs	xlat
 34610                                  	;pop	bx
 34611                                  
 34612                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34613 00005A1E E80400                  	CALL	GetCharType
 34614                                  	
 34615                                  	;test	al,4
 34616 00005A21 A804                    	TEST	AL,FSPCHK
 34617 00005A23 58                      	POP	AX
 34618 00005A24 C3                      	RETN
 34619                                  ;ELSE
 34620                                  ;	CMP	AL,9		; Filter out tabs too
 34621                                  ;	retz
 34622                                  ;; WARNING! " " MUST be the last compare
 34623                                  ;	CMP	AL," "
 34624                                  ;	return
 34625                                  ;ENDIF
 34626                                  
 34627                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34628                                  ;
 34629                                  ;  GetCharType - return flag bits indicating character type
 34630                                  ;	Bits are defined in DOSSYM.INC. Uses lookup table
 34631                                  ;	defined above at label CharType.
 34632                                  ;
 34633                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to return type flags for
 34634                                  ;	Exit  : AL = type flags
 34635                                  ;	Uses  : AL, flags
 34636                                  ;
 34637                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34638                                  
 34639                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34640                                  
 34641                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34642                                  
 34643                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34644                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34645                                  
 34646                                  GetCharType:
 34647                                  	;cmp	al,7Eh
 34648 00005A25 3C7E                    	cmp	al,CharType_last 	; beyond end of table?
 34649 00005A27 7314                    	jae	short gct_90		; return standard value
 34650                                  
 34651 00005A29 53                      	push	bx
 34652 00005A2A BB[AD59]                	mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 34653 00005A2D D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; adjust for half-byte table entry size
 34654                                  	;xlat	cs:[bx] 		; get flags
 34655 00005A2F 2ED7                    	cs	xlat	
 34656 00005A31 5B                      	pop	bx
 34657                                  
 34658                                  ; carry clear from previous shift means we want the low nibble.  Otherwise
 34659                                  ; we have to shift the flags down to the low nibble
 34660                                  
 34661 00005A32 7306                    	jnc	short gct_80		; carry clear, no shift needed
 34662                                  
 34663                                  ; 29/02/2024
 34664                                  %if 0
 34665                                  	shr	al,1			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 34666                                  	shr	al,1
 34667                                  	shr	al,1
 34668                                  	shr	al,1
 34669                                  %else
 34670                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34671                                  	;;;
 34672 00005A34 51                      	push	cx
 34673 00005A35 B104                    	mov	cl,4			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 34674 00005A37 D2E8                    	shr	al,cl
 34675 00005A39 59                      	pop	cx
 34676                                  	;;;
 34677                                  %endif
 34678                                  
 34679                                  gct_80:
 34680 00005A3A 240F                    	and	al,0Fh			; clear the unused nibble
 34681 00005A3C C3                      	retn
 34682                                  gct_90:
 34683 00005A3D B00F                    	mov	al,0Fh			; set all flags
 34684 00005A3F C3                      	retn
 34685                                  
 34686                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34687                                  ;
 34688                                  ; Procedure : PATHCHRCMP
 34689                                  ;
 34690                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34691                                  
 34692                                  PATHCHRCMP:
 34693 00005A40 3C2F                    	CMP	AL,'/'
 34694 00005A42 7606                    	JBE	short PathRet
 34695 00005A44 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'
 34696 00005A46 C3                      	retn
 34697                                  GotFor:
 34698 00005A47 B05C                    	MOV	AL,'\'
 34699 00005A49 C3                      	retn
 34700                                  PathRet:
 34701 00005A4A 74FB                    	JZ	short GotFor
 34702 00005A4C C3                      	retn

 34711                                  ; 15/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11, CTRLC.ASM, 1983)
 34712                                  
 34713                                  ;**	MSCTRLC.ASM - ^C and error handler for MSDOS
 34714                                  
 34715                                  ;	TITLE	Control C detection, Hard error and EXIT routines
 34716                                  ;	NAME	IBMCTRLC
 34717                                  
 34718                                  ;**	Low level routines for detecting special characters on CON input,
 34719                                  ;	the ^C exit/int code, the Hard error INT 24 code, the
 34720                                  ;	process termination code, and the INT 0 divide overflow handler.
 34721                                  ;
 34722                                  ;	FATAL

 35053                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35054                                  ;
 35055                                  ; Procedure Name : CNTHAND ( CTRLC_C HANDLER )
 35056                                  ;
 35057                                  ; "^C" and CR/LF is printed. Then the user registers are restored and the
 35058                                  ; user CTRL-C handler is executed. At this point the top of the stack has 1)
 35059                                  ; the interrupt return address should the user CTRL-C handler wish to allow
 35060                                  ; processing to continue; 2) the original interrupt return address to the code
 35061                                  ; that performed the function call in the first place. If the user CTRL-C
 35062                                  ; handler wishes to continue, it must leave all registers unchanged and RET
 35063                                  ; (not IRET) with carry CLEAR. If carry is SET then an terminate system call
 35064                                  ; is simulated.
 35065                                  ;
 35066                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35067                                  
 35068                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 35069                                  
 35070                                  CNTCHAND:
 35071                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; SS override
 35072                                  					; AN002; from RAWOUT
 35073                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],CTRL_BREAK_FLAG  
 35074                                  	;JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 35075                                  
 35076                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35077                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS DOSCODE:91C4h, 29/12/2022)
 35078 00005B95 36F606[1206]02          	TEST	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(CTRL_BREAK_FLAG>>8)  ; 2 
 35079 00005B9B 7508                    	JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 35080                                  
 35081 00005B9D B003                            MOV     AL,3			; Display "^C"
 35082 00005B9F E8D9C0                          CALL	BUFOUT
 35083 00005BA2 E86EBF                          CALL	CRLF
 35084                                  around_deadlock:
 35085 00005BA5 16                              PUSH    SS
 35086 00005BA6 1F                              POP     DS
 35087 00005BA7 803E[5703]00                    CMP     BYTE [CONSWAP],0
 35088 00005BAC 7403                            JZ      SHORT NOSWAP
 35089 00005BAE E833DE                          CALL	SWAPBACK
 35090                                  NOSWAP:
 35091 00005BB1 FA                      	CLI				; Prepare to play with stack
 35092 00005BB2 8E16[8605]              	MOV	SS,[USER_SS]		; User stack now restored
 35093 00005BB6 8B26[8405]              	MOV	SP,[USER_SP]
 35094 00005BBA E898A8                          CALL	restore_world       ; User registers now restored
 35095                                  
 35096                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 
 35097                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56ACh)
 35098                                          ; 14/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 35099                                  	;MOV	BYTE [CS:INDOS],0	
 35100                                          ;MOV	BYTE [CS:ERRORMODE],0
 35101                                          ;MOV	[CS:ConC_Spsave],SP
 35102                                  	;clc	;30/07/2018
 35103                                          ;INT	int_ctrl_c ; 23h    ; Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 35104                                  	;;int	23h	; DOS - CONTROL "C" EXIT ADDRESS
 35105                                  			; Return: return via RETF 2 with CF set
 35106                                  			; DOS will abort program with errorlevel 0
 35107                                  			; else
 35108                                  			; interrupted DOS call continues
 35109                                  
 35110                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35111                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS,91ECh) 
 35112                                  
 35113                                  	; CS was used to address these variables. We have to use DOSDATA
 35114                                  	
 35115 00005BBD 07                      	pop	es ; *	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, DOSCODE:91ECh)
 35116                                  			; (pop es, after 'call restore_world')	
 35117 00005BBE 1E                      	push	ds
 35118                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 35119 00005BBF 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35120 00005BC4 C606[2103]00            	mov	byte [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 35121                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35122                                  	;;;
 35123 00005BC9 C606[C011]00            	mov	byte [INDOS_FLAG],0	; 2nd 'in dos' flag (what for?)
 35124                                  	;;;
 35125 00005BCE C606[2003]00            	mov	byte [ERRORMODE],0
 35126 00005BD3 8926[3203]              	mov	[ConC_Spsave],SP	; save his SP
 35127                                  	; User SP has changed because of push. Adjust for it
 35128 00005BD7 8306[3203]02            	add	word [ConC_Spsave],2
 35129                                  
 35130 00005BDC 803E[660D]00            	cmp	byte [DosHasHMA],0	; Q: is dos running in HMA (M021)
 35131 00005BE1 1F                       	pop	ds	; restore ds
 35132 00005BE2 7505                    	jne	short do_low_int23	; Y: the int must be done from low mem
 35133 00005BE4 F8                      	CLC				
 35134 00005BE5 CD23                    	INT	int_ctrl_c  ; int 23h	; N: Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 35135 00005BE7 EB06                    	jmp	short ctrlc_ret_addr
 35136                                  
 35137                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35138                                  do_low_int23:
 35139 00005BE9 F8                      	clc
 35140 00005BEA 2EFF1E[4D5A]            	call	far [cs:LowInt23Addr]
 35141                                  
 35142                                  	; 30/07/2018 
 35143                                  
 35144                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56C0h)
 35145                                  
 35146                                  ; The user has returned to us. The circumstances we allow are:
 35147                                  ;
 35148                                  ;   IRET	We retry the operation by redispatching the system call
 35149                                  ;   CLC/RETF	POP the stack and retry
 35150                                  ;   ... 	Exit the current process with ^C exit
 35151                                  ;
 35152                                  ; User's may RETURN to us and leave interrupts on. 
 35153                                  ; Turn 'em off just to be sure
 35154                                  
 35155                                  ctrlc_ret_addr: ; 05/05/2019
 35156                                  
 35157 00005BEF FA                      	CLI
 35158                                  
 35159                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 
 35160                                  	;MOV	[CS:USER_IN_AX],ax	; save the AX
 35161                                  	;PUSHF				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 35162                                  	;POP	AX
 35163                                  
 35164                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35165                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35166                                  
 35167                                  	; We have to use DOSDATA for these variables. Previously CS was used 
 35168                                  
 35169 00005BF0 50                      	push	ax
 35170 00005BF1 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds
 35171                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 35172 00005BF3 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35173 00005BF8 A3[630D]                	mov	[TEMPSEG],ax
 35174 00005BFB 58                      	pop	ax
 35175 00005BFC A3[3A03]                	MOV	[USER_IN_AX],ax		; save the AX
 35176 00005BFF 9C                      	pushf				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 35177 00005C00 58                      	pop	ax
 35178                                  
 35179                                  ; See if the input stack is identical to the output stack
 35180                                  
 35181                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35182                                  	;CMP	SP,[CS:ConC_Spsave]
 35183                                  	;JNZ	SHORT ctrlc_try_new	; current SP not the same as saved SP
 35184                                  
 35185                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35186 00005C01 3B26[3203]              	CMP	SP,[ConC_Spsave]
 35187 00005C05 750A                    	JNZ	SHORT ctrlc_try_new	; current SP not the same as saved SP
 35188                                  
 35189                                  ; Repeat the operation by redispatching the system call.
 35190                                  
 35191                                  ctrlc_repeat:
 35192                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35193                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:USER_IN_AX]
 35194                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35195                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35196 00005C07 A1[3A03]                	mov	ax,[USER_IN_AX]

 35419                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35420                                  ;
 35421                                  ; Procedure Name : HardErr
 35422                                  ;
 35423                                  ; Hard disk error handler. Entry conditions:
 35424                                  ;	DS:BX = Original disk transfer address
 35425                                  ;	DX = Original logical sector number
 35426                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors to go (first one gave the error)
 35427                                  ;	AX = Hardware error code
 35428                                  ;	DI = Original sector transfer count	
 35429                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 35430                                  ;	[READOP] = 0 for read, 1 for write
 35431                                  ;	Allowed Set with allowed responses to this error (other bits MUST BE 0)
 35432                                  ; Output:
 35433                                  ;	[FAILERR] will be set if user responded FAIL
 35434                                  ;
 35435                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35436                                  
 35437                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35438                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35439                                  HARDERR:
 35440                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35441                                  	; 30/07/2018
 35442                                  	; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

 35444                                  	;and	di,0FFh

 35494                                  	;cmp	dx,[es:bp+2Bh]
 35495 00005CEE 263B562B                	cmp	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FCLUS_FSECTOR+2]

 35584                                  ;	EXITHOLD set for restore of ES:BP.

 35597                                      
 35598                                  	; Wango!!! We may need to free some user state info... In 
 35599                                  	; particular, we may have locked down a JFN for a user and he may
 35600                                  	; NEVER return to us. Thus,we need to free it here and then
 35601                                  	; reallocate it when we come back.

 35647 00005DA7 EB05                    	jmp	short criterr_ret_addr

 35745

 35751                                  	; turn this abort into a fail.

 35763                                  
 35764                                  	; we are truly aborting the process. Go restore information from 
 35765                                  	; the PDB as necessary.
 35766                                  
 35767 00005E42 E95410                  	jmp	exit_inner
 35768                                  
 35769                                  ;** --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35770                                  ;
 35771                                  ; reset_environment checks the DS value against the CurrentPDB. If they are
 35772                                  ; different, then an old-style return is performed. If they are the same,
 35773                                  ; then we release jfns and restore to parent. We still use the PDB at DS:0 as
 35774                                  ; the source of the terminate addresses.
 35775                                  ;
 35776                                  ; Some subtlety: We are about to issue a bunch of calls that *may* generate
 35777                                  ; INT 24s. We *cannot* allow the user to restart the abort process; we may
 35778                                  ; end up aborting the wrong process or turn a terminate/stay/resident into a
 35779                                  ; normal abort and leave interrupt handlers around. What we do is to set a
 35780                                  ; flag that will indicate that if any abort code is seen, we just continue the
 35781                                  ; operation. In essence, we dis-allow the abort response.
 35782                                  ;
 35783                                  ; output:   none.
 35784                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35785                                  
 35786                                  	;entry	reset_environment
 35787                                  	
 35788                                  reset_environment:
 35789                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35790                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 588Ah 
 35791                                  
 35792                                  ;***	invoke	Reset_Version		; AN007 ;MS. reset version number
 35793                                  
 35794 00005E45 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save PDB of process
 35795                                  
 35796                                  	; There are no critical sections in force. Although we may enter
 35797                                  	; here with critical sections locked down, they are no longer 
 35798                                  	; relevant. We may safely free all allocated resources.
 35799                                  
 35800 00005E46 B482                    	MOV	AH,82h
 35801                                  		; Microsoft Networks - END DOS CRITICAL SECTIONS 0 THROUGH 7
 35802                                  	;int	2Ah 	
 35803 00005E48 CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM
 35804                                  
 35805                                  					; SS override
 35806 00005E4A 36C606[5903]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:fAborting],-1	; signal abort in progress
 35807                                  
 35808                                  					; DOS 4.00 doesn't need it
 35809                                  	;CallInstall NetResetEnvironment, MultNET, 34  
 35810                                  					; Allow REDIR to clear some stuff
 35811                                  					; On process exit.
 35812 00005E50 B82211                  	mov	ax, 1122h

 35814                                  			; SS = DOS CS
 35815                                  	;mov	al,22h	
 35816 00005E55 B022                    	MOV	AL,int_terminate

 35818

 35829                                  	; is not Exit_keep_process

 35836                                  
 35837                                  					; SS override
 35838                                  	;cmp	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3

 35840 00005E76 7406                    	JZ	short reset_to_parent 	; keeping this process
 35841                                  
 35842                                  	; We are truly removing a process. Free all allocation blocks
 35843                                  	; belonging to this PDB
 35844                                  
 35845                                  	;invoke	arena_free_process
 35846 00005E78 E85D10                  	call	arena_free_process
 35847                                  
 35848                                  	; Kill off remainder of this process. Close file handles and signal
 35849                                  	; to relevant network folks that this process is dead. Remember that
 35850                                  	; CurrentPDB is STILL the current process!
 35851                                  
 35852                                  	;invoke	DOS_ABORT
 35853 00005E7B E819D7                  	call	DOS_ABORT
 35854                                  
 35855                                  reset_to_parent:
 35856                                  					; SS override
 35857 00005E7E 368F06[3003]            	POP	word [SS:CurrentPDB]	; set up process as parent
 35858                                  
 35859                                  reset_return:				; come here for normal return
 35860                                  	;Context DS			; DS is used to refer to DOSDATA
 35861 00005E83 16                      	push	ss
 35862 00005E84 1F                      	pop	ds

 35867                                  	; we cannot "FAIL" the abort, the program being aborted is dead.
 35868

 35954                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35955                                  ;
 35956                                  ; Procedure Name : SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR
 35957                                  ;
 35958                                  ; This routine handles extended error codes.
 35959                                  ; Input : DI = error code from device
 35960                                  ; Output: All EXTERR fields are set
 35961                                  ;
 35962                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35963                                  
 35964                                  SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR:
 35965 00005EE7 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35966                                  					; ErrMap24End is in DOSDATA
 35967 00005EE8 B8[BB0E]                	MOV	AX,ErrMap24End
 35968 00005EEB 2D[AB0E]                	SUB	AX,ErrMap24
 35969                                  					; Change to dosdata to access
 35970                                  					; ErrMap24 and EXTERR -SR
 35971                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35972                                  	
 35973                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35974 00005EEE 1E                      	push	ds
 35975                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds ->dosdata
 35976 00005EEF 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35977                                  
 35978                                  	; AX is the index of the first unavailable error. Do not translate
 35979                                  	; if greater or equal to AX.
 35980                                  
 35981 00005EF4 39C7                    	CMP	DI,AX
 35982 00005EF6 89F8                    	MOV	AX,DI
 35983 00005EF8 7306                    	JAE	short NoTrans
 35984                                  
 35985                                  	;MOV	AL,[CS:DI+ErrMap24]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 35986 00005EFA 8A85[AB0E]              	mov	al,[ErrMap24+di] ; MSDOS 6.0
 35987 00005EFE 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH

 35996                                  	; error locus class and recommended action.

 35999                                  					; ERR_TABLE_24 is in DOSCODE 
 36000 00005F06 BE[5B0E]                	MOV	SI,ERR_TABLE_24
 36001 00005F09 E8B6A7                  	call	CAL_LK			; Set other extended error fields

 36005                                  ;============================================================================
 36006                                  ; FAT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 36007                                  ;============================================================================
 36008                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36009                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36010                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36011                                  
 36012                                  ;	TITLE	FAT - FAT maintenance routines
 36013                                  ;	NAME	FAT
 36014                                  
 36015                                  ;**	FAT.ASM
 36016                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36017                                  ;	Low level local device routines for performing disk change sequence,
 36018                                  ;	setting cluster validity, and manipulating the FAT
 36019                                  ;
 36020                                  ;	IsEof
 36021                                  ;	UNPACK
 36022                                  ;	PACK
 36023                                  ;	MAPCLUSTER
 36024                                  ;	FATREAD_SFT
 36025                                  ;	FATREAD_CDS
 36026                                  ;	FAT_operation
 36027                                  ;
 36028                                  ;	Revision history:
 36029                                  ;
 36030                                  ;	  AN000  version Jan. 1988
 36031                                  ;	   A001  PTM	      -- disk changed for look ahead buffers
 36032                                  ;
 36033                                  ;	M014 - if a request for pack\unpack cluster 0 is made we write\read
 36034                                  ;	       from CL0FATENTRY rather than disk.
 36035                                  
 36036                                  ; DOSCODE:94FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36037                                  
 36038                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36039                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:A40Ch
 36040                                  
 36041                                  ;Break <IsEOF - check the quantity in BX for EOF>
 36042                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36043                                  ;
 36044                                  ; Procedure Name : IsEOF
 36045                                  ;
 36046                                  ; IsEOF - check the fat value in BX for eof.
 36047                                  ;
 36048                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:BP point to DPB
 36049                                  ;		BX has fat value
 36050                                  ;   Outputs:	JAE eof
 36051                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 36052                                  ;
 36053                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36054                                  
 36055                                  IsEOF:
 36056                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36057                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 36058                                  	;;;
 36059 00005F0E E89801                  	call	IsFAT32			; is it FAT32 drive ?
 36060 00005F11 730D                    	jnc	short IsEOF_FAT		; no, it has 12 or 16 bit FAT
 36061                                  
 36062                                  	; FAT32 fs
 36063 00005F13 36813E[E80A]FF0F        	cmp	word [ss:CLUSTNUM_HW],0FFFh
 36064 00005F1A 7503                    	jnz     short IsEOF_other1	; not EOF
 36065 00005F1C 83FBF8                  	cmp     bx,0FFF8h		; 32 bit compare
 36066                                  IsEOF_other1:
 36067 00005F1F C3                      	retn 				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36068                                  
 36069                                  IsEOF_FAT:
 36070                                  	;;;
 36071                                  
 36072                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 36073 00005F20 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; is this 16 bit fat?
 36074 00005F26 730B                    	JAE	short EOF16			; yes, check for eof there
 36075                                  
 36076                                  ;J.K. 8/27/86
 36077                                  ;Modified to accept 0FF0h as an eof. This is to handle the diskfull case
 36078                                  ;of any media that has "F0"(Other) as a MediaByte.
 36079                                  ;Hopely, this does not create any side effect for those who may use any value
 36080                                  ;other than "FF8-FFF" as an EOF for their own file.
 36081                                  
 36082 00005F28 81FBF00F                	cmp	bx,0FF0h
 36083 00005F2C 7404                    	je	short IsEOF_other
 36084                                  
 36085 00005F2E 81FBF80F                	CMP	BX,0FF8h		; do the 12 bit compare
 36086                                  IsEOF_other:
 36087 00005F32 C3                      	retn
 36088                                  EOF16:
 36089 00005F33 83FBF8                  	CMP	BX,0FFF8h		; 16 bit compare
 36090 00005F36 C3                      	retn				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36091                                  
 36092                                  ; DOSCODE:9511h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36093                                  
 36094                                  ;Break	<UNPACK -- UNPACK FAT ENTRIES>
 36095                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36096                                  ;
 36097                                  ; Procedure Name : UNPACK
 36098                                  ;
 36099                                  ; Inputs:
 36100                                  ;	BX = Cluster number (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36101                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 36102                                  ; Outputs:
 36103                                  ;	DI = Contents of FAT for given cluster (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36104                                  ;	Zero set means DI=0 (free cluster)
 36105                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36106                                  ; SI Destroyed, No other registers affected. Fatal error if cluster too big.
 36107                                  ;
 36108                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 36109                                  ;
 36110                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36111                                  
 36112                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36113                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A44Eh
 36114                                  	;
 36115                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS .SYS - DOSCODE:9511h)
 36116                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C368h)
 36117                                  
 36118                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36119                                  	; DOSCODE:94B5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36120                                  
 36121                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36122                                  UNPACK:
 36123                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - Start
 36124 00005F37 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we unpacking cluster 0
 36125 00005F39 7519                    	jnz	short up_cont		; N: proceed with normal unpack
 36126                                  
 36127                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36128                                  %if 0
 36129                                  	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]	; Y: return value in CL0FATENTRY
 36130                                  	or	di,di 			; return z if di=0

 36310                                  ;Break	<PACK -- PACK FAT ENTRIES>
 36311                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36312                                  ;
 36313                                  ; Procedure Name : PACK
 36314                                  ;
 36315                                  ; Inputs:
 36316                                  ;	BX = Cluster number
 36317                                  ;	DX = Data
 36318                                  ;	ES:BP = Pointer to drive DPB
 36319                                  ; Outputs:
 36320                                  ;	The data is stored in the FAT at the given cluster.
 36321                                  ;	SI,DX,DI all destroyed
 36322                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36323                                  ;	No other registers affected
 36324                                  ;
 36325                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then data in DX is stored in CL0FATENTRY.
 36326                                  ;
 36327                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36328                                  
 36329                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36330                                  
 36331                                  	; INPUT:
 36332                                  	;  [CLUSDATA_HW]:DX = cluster data/content
 36333                                  	;  [CLUSTNUM_HW]:BX = cluster number (to be updated)
 36334                                  	;  ES:BP = pointer to DPB
 36335                                  
 36336                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36337                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 36339                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - start

 36341 00005FE8 7513                    	jnz	short p_cont		; N: proceed with normal pack
 36342                                  
 36343                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36344                                  %if 0
 36345                                  	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx	; Y: place value in CL0FATENTRY
 36346                                  	retn				; done
 36347                                  %else
 36348                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36349                                  	;;;
 36350 00005FEA 391E[E80A]              	cmp	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx ; 0
 36351 00005FEE 750D                    	jnz	short p_cont
 36352                                  
 36353                                  	;push	ax
 36354                                  	;mov	ax,[CLUSDATA_HW]	; Cluster Data/Content (High Word)
 36355                                  	;mov	[CL0FATENTRY_HW],ax
 36356                                  	;pop	ax
 36357 00005FF0 FF36[EA0A]              	push	word [CLUSDATA_HW]
 36358 00005FF4 8F06[350F]              	pop	word [CL0FATENTRY_HW]
 36359                                  
 36360 00005FF8 8916[8100]              	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx
 36361 00005FFC C3                      	retn
 36362                                  	;;;
 36363                                  %endif
 36364

 36366                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0

 36374 0000600B 59                      	POP	CX

 36529                                  ;Break	<MAPCLUSTER - BUFFER A FAT SECTOR>
 36530                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36531                                  ;
 36532                                  ; Procedure Name : MAPCLUSTER
 36533                                  ;
 36534                                  ; Inputs:
 36535                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 36536                                  ;	BX Is cluster number
 36537                                  ; Function:
 36538                                  ;	Get a pointer to the cluster
 36539                                  ; Outputs:
 36540                                  ;	DS:DI Points to contents of FAT for given cluster
 36541                                  ;	DS:SI Points to start of buffer
 36542                                  ;	Zero Not set if cluster data is in high 12 bits of word
 36543                                  ;	Zero set if cluster data is in low 12 or 16 bits
 36544                                  ;	Carry set if failed.
 36545                                  ; SI is destroyed.
 36546                                  ;
 36547                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36548                                  
 36549                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36550                                  	; DOSCODE:9601h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36551                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36552                                  	; DOSCODE:95A5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36553                                  
 36554                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36555                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A5D7h
 36556                                  
 36557                                  MAPCLUSTER:
 36558                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5A15h
 36559 000060BE C606[7805]00            	MOV	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT],0
 36560                                  	;SAVE	<AX,BX,CX,DX>
 36561 000060C3 50                      	push	ax
 36562 000060C4 53                      	push	bx
 36563 000060C5 51                      	push	cx
 36564 000060C6 52                      	push	dx
 36565                                  	; 02/03/2024
 36566                                  	;MOV	AX,BX			; AX = BX
 36567                                  
 36568                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36569                                  	;;;
 36570                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36571 000060C7 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx
 36572 000060C9 8B16[E80A]              	mov	dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36573                                  	;
 36574 000060CD 52                      	push	dx ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36575                                  	;
 36576 000060CE 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 36577 000060D0 E8D6FF                  	call	IsFAT32
 36578 000060D3 730E                    	jnc	short mapcl1 ; not FAT32
 36579                                  	; FAT32
 36580 000060D5 D1E0                    	shl	ax,1
 36581 000060D7 D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 36582 000060D9 D1D7                    	rcl	di,1
 36583 000060DB D1E0                    	shl	ax,1
 36584 000060DD D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 36585 000060DF D1D7                    	rcl	di,1
 36586                                  	; DI:DX:AX = 4*(DX:AX)
 36587 000060E1 EB14                    	jmp	short Map16		; 32 bit FAT	
 36588                                  mapcl1:
 36589                                  	;;;
 36590 000060E3 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10  ; MZ 16 bit fat?
 36591                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36592                                  	;JAE	short Map16		; MZ yes, do 16 bit algorithm
 36593                                  	;SHR	AX,1			; AX = BX/2
 36594                                  	;
 36595                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36596                                  	;;;
 36597 000060E9 7304                    	jae	short mapcl2		; 16 bit FAT
 36598                                  	; 12 bit FAT
 36599 000060EB D1EA                    	shr	dx,1
 36600 000060ED D1D8                    	rcr     ax,1
 36601                                  mapcl2:
 36602 000060EF 01D8                    	add     ax,bx
 36603 000060F1 1316[E80A]              	adc     dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36604 000060F5 11FF                    	adc	di,di
 36605                                  	;;;
 36606                                  Map16:	
 36607                                  
 36608                                  ; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36609                                  ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36610                                  %if 0
 36611                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; MZ skip prev => AX=2*BX
 36612                                  	XOR	DI,DI ; *		; >32mb fat ;AN000;
 36613                                  	
 36614                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36615                                  	ADD	AX,BX			; AX = 1.5*fat = byte offset in fat
 36616                                  	ADC	DI,DI ; * MSDOS 6.0	; >32mb fat ;DI is zero before op;AN000;
 36617                                  %endif
 36618                                  
 36619 000060F7 268B4E02                	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 36620                                  
 36621                                  ;IF FastDiv
 36622                                  ;
 36623                                  ; Gross hack: 99% of all disks have 512 bytes per sector. We test for this
 36624                                  ; case and apply a really fast algorithm to get the desired results
 36625                                  ;
 36626                                  ; Divide method takes 157+4*4=173 (MOV and DIV)
 36627                                  ; Fast method takes 39+20*4=119
 36628                                  ;
 36629                                  ; This saves a bunch.
 36630                                  
 36631 000060FB 81F90002                	CMP	CX,512			; 4  Is this 512 byte sector?
 36632 000060FF 751C                    	jne	short _DoDiv		; 4  for no jump
 36633                                  
 36634                                  ; 02/04/2024
 36635                                  %if 0
 36636                                  	MOV	DX,AX			; 2  get set for remainder
 36637                                  	AND	DX,512-1		; 4  Form remainder
 36638                                  	MOV	AL,AH			; 2  Quotient in formation in AL
 36639                                  	; MDOS 3.3
 36640                                  	;shr	al,1
 36641                                  	; MDOS 6.0
 36642                                  	shr	di,1			; 2
 36643                                  	rcr	al,1			; 2
 36644                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36645                                  	xor	ah,ah			; 3
 36646                                  %else
 36647                                  	; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36648                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36649                                  	;;;
 36650 00006101 50                      	push	ax
 36651 00006102 D1EF                    	shr	di,1
 36652 00006104 D1DA                    	rcr	dx,1
 36653 00006106 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 36654 00006108 88E0                    	mov	al,ah			; 9 bit shift to right
 36655 0000610A 88D4                    	mov	ah,dl
 36656 0000610C 88F2                    	mov	dl,dh
 36657 0000610E 30F6                    	xor	dh,dh
 36658 00006110 D1EF                    	shr	di,1
 36659 00006112 10F6                    	adc	dh,dh
 36660 00006114 87FA                    	xchg	dx,di		; DI:AX = sector contains requested cluster data
 36661 00006116 5A                      	pop	dx
 36662 00006117 81E2FF01                	and	dx,1FFh			; offset in sector
 36663                                  	;;;
 36664                                  %endif
 36665 0000611B EB07                    	jmp	short DivDone		; 16
 36666                                  
 36667                                  _DoDiv:
 36668                                  ;ENDIF
 36669                                  
 36670                                  ; 02/04/2024
 36671                                  %if 0
 36672                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 36673                                  	;xor	dx,dx
 36674                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36675                                  	mov	dx,di			; 2
 36676                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36677                                  	DIV	CX			; 155 AX is FAT sector # DX is sector index
 36678                                  %else
 36679                                  	; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36680                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36681                                  	;;;
 36682 0000611D 97                      	xchg	ax,di
 36683 0000611E 92                      	xchg	ax,dx
 36684 0000611F F7F1                    	div	cx

 36688                                  	;;;
 36689                                  %endif

 36693                                  ;ENDIF

 36696

 36698                                  	;;;

 36700                                  	;;;
 36701                                  
 36702 0000612B 49                      	DEC	CX			; CX is sector size - 1
 36703                                  
 36704                                  	;SAVE	<AX,DX,CX>
 36705                                  
 36706                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36707                                  	;;;
 36708 0000612C 57                      	push	di ; 4*
 36709                                  	;;;
 36710 0000612D 50                      	push	ax ; 3*

 36713

 36715

 36717                                  	; mov [HIGH_SECTOR],di ; *!* ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 36718 00006132 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 36719                                  	;
 36720

 36722                                  	; 22/09/2023
 36723                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb  low sector #
 36724                                  	;
 36725                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36726                                  	;XOR	AL,AL	   ; *
 36727                                  	;MOV	SI,1	   ; *
 36728                                  	;;invoke GETBUFFRB ; *
 36729                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *
 36730                                  	; 22/09/2023
 36731 00006134 E83D04                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *! ; *!* ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36732                                  
 36733                                  	;RESTORE <CX,AX,DX>		; CX is sec siz-1, AX is offset in sec
 36734 00006137 59                      	pop	cx ; 1*

 36746                                  	;;lea	di,[si+20] ; MSDOS 6.0

 36748 00006141 8D7C18                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]

 36750 00006146 39C8                    	CMP	AX,CX
 36751 00006148 7530                    	JNZ	short MAPRET	; ds<>ss

 36798                                  	;;;

 36801 00006180 59                      	pop	cx

 36803

 36805

 36807                                  	;;;

 36811

 36820

 36827                                  	;;;

 36844                                  ;Break	<FATREAD_SFT/FATREAD_CDS -- CHECK DRIVE GET FAT>
 36845                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36846                                  ;
 36847                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_SFT
 36848                                  ;
 36849                                  ; Inputs:
 36850                                  ;	ES:DI points to an SFT for the drive of interest (local only,
 36851                                  ;		giving a NET SFT will produce system crashing results).
 36852                                  ;	DS DOSDATA
 36853                                  ; Function:
 36854                                  ;	Can be used by an SFT routine (like CLOSE) to invalidate buffers
 36855                                  ;	if disk changed.
 36856                                  ;	In other respects, same as FATREAD_CDS.
 36857                                  ;	(note ES:DI destroyed!)
 36858                                  ; Outputs:
 36859                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36860                                  ; NOTE: This routine may cause FATREAD_CDS to "miss" a disk change
 36861                                  ;	as far as invalidating curdir_ID is concerned.
 36862                                  ;	Since getting a true disk changed on this call is a screw up
 36863                                  ;	anyway, that's the way it goes.
 36864                                  ;
 36865                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36866                                  
 36867                                  FATREAD_SFT:
 36868 000061A0 26C46D07                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]
 36869                                  
 36870                                  fatread_gotdpb:	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36871                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36872                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 36873                                  	; 15/12/2022
 36874 000061A4 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 36875 000061A8 A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 36876 000061AB E8C8A4                  	call	GOTDPB			; Set THISDPB
 36877                                  	;CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 36878                                  	; 17/12/2022
 36879 000061AE E99C00                  	jmp	FAT_GOT_DPB
 36880                                  ;fatread_sft_retn:
 36881                                  	;retn
 36882                                  
 36883                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36884                                  ;
 36885                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_CDS
 36886                                  ;
 36887                                  ; Inputs:
 36888                                  ;	DS:DOSDATA
 36889                                  ;	ES:DI points to an CDS for the drive of interest (local only,
 36890                                  ;		giving a NET or NUL CDS will produce system crashing results).
 36891                                  ; Function:
 36892                                  ;	If disk may have been changed, media is determined and buffers are
 36893                                  ;	flagged invalid. If not, no action is taken.
 36894                                  ; Outputs:
 36895                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameter block
 36896                                  ;	THISDPB = ES:BP
 36897                                  ;	THISDRV set
 36898                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36899                                  ; DS preserved , all other registers destroyed
 36900                                  ;
 36901                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36902                                  
 36903                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36904                                  	; DOSCODE:96C5h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36905                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36906                                  	; DOSCODE:9669h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36907                                  
 36908                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36909                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A6D8h
 36910                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C644h)
 36911                                  
 36912                                  FATREAD_CDS:
 36913 000061B1 06                      	PUSH	ES
 36914 000061B2 57                      	PUSH	DI
 36915                                  
 36916                                  	;les	bp,[es:di+45h]
 36917 000061B3 26C46D45                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 36918                                  
 36919                                  ; 03/03/2024
 36920                                  %if 0
 36921                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36922                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 36923                                  	; 15/12/2022
 36924                                  	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 36925                                  	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 36926                                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 36927                                  	CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 36928                                  %else
 36929                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36930                                  	;;;
 36931 000061B7 E8EAFF                  	call	fatread_gotdpb
 36932                                  	;;;
 36933                                  %endif
 36934 000061BA 5F                      	POP	DI			;Get back CDS pointer
 36935 000061BB 07                      	POP	ES
 36936 000061BC 72E1                    	jc	short fatread_sft_retn
 36937 000061BE 7542                    	JNZ	short NO_CHANGE		;Media NOT changed
 36938                                  
 36939                                  ;	Media changed. We now need to find all CDS structures which use this
 36940                                  ;	DPB and invalidate their ID pointers.
 36941                                  
 36942                                  MED_CHANGE:
 36943                                  	;XOR	AX,AX
 36944                                  	;DEC	AX			; AX = -1
 36945                                  	; 03/03/2024
 36946 000061C0 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh ; -1
 36947                                  	
 36948 000061C3 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 36949 000061C4 8A0E[4700]              	MOV	CL,[CDSCOUNT]
 36950 000061C8 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH			; CX is number of structures
 36951                                  	;lds	si,[es:di+45h]
 36952 000061CA 26C57545                	LDS	SI,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr] ; Find all CDS with this devptr
 36953                                  
 36954                                  ;hkn; SS override
 36955                                  
 36956                                  ;	Find all CDSs with this DevPtr
 36957                                  ;
 36958                                  ;	(ax) = -1
 36959                                  ;	(ds:si) = DevPtr
 36960                                  
 36961 000061CE 36C43E[3C00]            	LES	DI,[SS:CDSADDR]		; (es:di) = CDS pointer
 36962                                  frcd20: 
 36963                                  	;;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 36964                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 36965 000061D3 26F6454480              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 36966 000061D8 7522                    	JNZ	short frcd25		; Leave NET guys alone!!
 36967                                  
 36968                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 36969                                  	;push	es
 36970                                  	;push	di
 36971                                  	;les	di,[es:di+45h]
 36972                                  	;;les	di,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 36973                                  	;call	POINTCOMP
 36974                                  	;pop	di
 36975                                  	;pop	es
 36976                                  	;jnz	short frcd25
 36977                                  
 36978                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36979 000061DA 263B7545                	cmp	si,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 36980 000061DE 751C                    	jne	short frcd25		; no match
 36981 000061E0 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds
 36982 000061E2 263B5D47                	cmp	bx,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr+2]
 36983 000061E6 7514                    	jne	short frcd25		; CDS not for this drive
 36984                                  
 36985                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36986                                  	;test	[es:di+49h],ax	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A70Fh

 36988                                  	;JZ	short frcd25 ; = 0	; If root (0), leave root
 36989                                  		; !!! test es:[di+49h],ax
 36990                                  		; !!! jz short frcd25	
 36991                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM bug (!?) ; Erdogan Tan - 03/03/2024
 36992                                  		; test dword ptr es:[di+49h],-1 ; Win ME - BIOSCODE:0C694h
 36993                                  		; jz short frcd25
 36994                                  		;
 36995                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36996 000061EC 7506                    	jnz	short frcd24
 36997                                  
 36998                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36999                                  	;;;
 37000                                  	;test	[es:di+4Bh],ax
 37001 000061EE 2685454B                	test	[es:di+curdir.ID+2],AX
 37002 000061F2 7408                    	jz	short frcd25 ; = 0
 37003                                  frcd24:		; 03/03/2024
 37004                                  	;;;
 37005                                  	;mov	[es:di+49h],ax
 37006 000061F4 26894549                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX	; else invalid
 37007                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37008                                  	;;;
 37009                                  	;mov	[es:di+4Bh],ax
 37010 000061F8 2689454B                	mov	[es:di+curdir.ID+2],ax ; -1
 37011                                  	;;;
 37012                                  frcd25:	
 37013                                  	;;add	di,81  ; MSDOS 3.3
 37014                                  	;add	di,88  ; MSDOS 6.0	 
 37015 000061FC 83C758                  	ADD	DI,curdir.size		; Point to next CDS
 37016 000061FF E2D2                    	LOOP	frcd20
 37017 00006201 1F                      	POP	DS
 37018                                  NO_CHANGE:
 37019 00006202 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 37020 00006206 F8                      	CLC
 37021 00006207 C3                      	retn
 37022                                  
 37023                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E =======================================
 37024                                  ; 05/01/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 37025                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A7Fh
 37026                                  ;;;
 37027                                  chk_set_first_access:
 37028                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0
 37029 00006208 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],0
 37030 0000620D 750D                    	jnz	short chk_set_fa_1	; FAT (FAT12 or FAT16)
 37031                                  	; FAT32
 37032                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh
 37033 0000620F 26837E21FF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT_HW],0FFFFh ; -1

 37035 00006214 26C74621FFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT_HW],0FFFFh ; -1
 37036 0000621A 7505                    	jne	short chk_set_fa_2
 37037                                  chk_set_fa_1:
 37038                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh
 37039 0000621C 26837E1FFF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],0FFFFh ; -1
 37040                                  chk_set_fa_2:
 37041                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh	; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 37042 00006221 26C7461FFFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],0FFFFh ; -1
 37043 00006227 7405                    	je	short chk_set_fa_3

 37045 00006229 26804E1801              	or	byte [es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS],1
 37046                                  chk_set_fa_3:
 37047 0000622E C3                      	retn
 37048                                  ;;;

 37064                                  FAT_operation:
 37065                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37066                                  FATERR:
 37067                                  
 37068                                  ; 03/03/2024

 37501                                  	;mov	[di-09h],ax					;AC000;
 37502                                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_wrtcntinc-BUFINSIZ],AX 
 37503                                  					;>32mb Correct buffer info ;AC000;
 37504                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 37505                                  	push	ss
 37506                                  	pop	ds
 37507                                  	XOR	AL,AL			;Media changed (Z), Carry clear
 37508                                  	retn
 37509                                  
 37510                                  FATERRJ: 
 37511                                  	JMP	FATERR
 37512                                  
 37513                                  %else
 37514                                  	; 04/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37515                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM

 37524                                  				; byte BUFFINFO.buf_flags = 0

 37526

 37750                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
