 37752                                  ;
 37753                                  ; buffer management for MSDOS
 37754                                  ;
 37755                                  ;CODE	SEGMENT BYTE PUBLIC  'CODE'
 37756                                  ;       ASSUME  SS:DOSGROUP,CS:DOSGROUP
 37757                                  ;
 37758                                  ;SUBTTL SETVISIT,SKIPVISIT -- MANAGE BUFFER SCANS
 37759                                  ;
 37760                                  ;SETVISIT:
 37761                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37762                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CAFh
 37763                                  ;; Inputs:
 37764                                  ;;      None
 37765                                  ;; Function:
 37766                                  ;;      Set up a scan of I/O buffers
 37767                                  ;; Outputs:
 37768                                  ;;      All visit flags = 0
 37769                                  ;;              NOTE: This pre-scan is needed because a hard disk error
 37770                                  ;;                    may cause a scan to stop in the middle leaving some
 37771                                  ;;                    visit flags set, and some not set.
 37772                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to [BUFFHEAD]
 37773                                  ;; No other registers altered
 37774                                  ;
 37775                                  ;       LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 37776                                  ;	PUSH    AX
 37777                                  ;       ;;XOR	AX,AX	  ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37778                                  ;	;mov	al,0DFh
 37779                                  ;	mov	al,~buf_visit
 37780                                  ;SETLOOP:
 37781                                  ;       ;;MOV	[DI+7],AL ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37782                                  ;	;and	[DI+5],al
 37783                                  ;	AND	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],AL
 37784                                  ;       LDS     DI,[DI]
 37785                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 37786                                  ;       JNZ     SHORT SETLOOP
 37787                                  ;       POP     AX ; 09/09/2018
 37788                                  ;	LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 37789                                  ;SVISIT_RETN:
 37790                                  ;       RETN
 37791                                  ;
 37792                                  ;SKIPVISIT:
 37793                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37794                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CC8h
 37795                                  ;
 37796                                  ;; Inputs:
 37797                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to a buffer
 37798                                  ;; Function:
 37799                                  ;;      Skip visited buffers
 37800                                  ;; Outputs:
 37801                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to next unvisited buffer
 37802                                  ;;      Zero is set if skip to LAST buffer
 37803                                  ;; No other registers altered
 37804                                  ;
 37805                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 37806                                  ;       ;retz
 37807                                  ;       JZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 37808                                  ;
 37809                                  ;	;;CMP	BYTE [DI+7],1 ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37810                                  ;       ;;;retnz
 37811                                  ;       ;;JNZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 37812                                  ;
 37813                                  ;	;test	byte [di+5],20h
 37814                                  ;	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_visit	
 37815                                  ;	JNZ	short SKIPLOOP
 37816                                  ;	
 37817                                  ;	push	ax
 37818                                  ;	or	al,1
 37819                                  ;	pop	ax
 37820                                  ;	retn	
 37821                                  ;
 37822                                  ;SKIPLOOP:
 37823                                  ;	LDS     DI,[DI]
 37824                                  ;       JMP     SHORT SKIPVISIT
 37825                                  
 37826                                  ;============================================================================
 37827                                  ; BUF.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 37828                                  ;============================================================================
 37829                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37830                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37831                                  ; 06/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37832                                  
 37833                                  ;	TITLE	BUF - MSDOS buffer management
 37834                                  ;	NAME	BUF
 37835                                  
 37836                                  ;**	BUF.ASM - Low level routines for buffer cache management
 37837                                  ;
 37838                                  ;	GETCURHEAD
 37839                                  ;	ScanPlace
 37840                                  ;	PLACEBUF
 37841                                  ;	PLACEHEAD
 37842                                  ;	PointComp
 37843                                  ;	GETBUFFR
 37844                                  ;	GETBUFFRB
 37845                                  ;	FlushBuf
 37846                                  ;	BufWrite
 37847                                  ;	SET_RQ_SC_PARMS
 37848                                  ;
 37849                                  ;	Revision history:
 37850                                  ;
 37851                                  ;		AN000  version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 37852                                  ;		A004   PTM 3765 -- Disk reset failed
 37853                                  ;		M039 DB 10/17/90 - Disk write optimization
 37854                                  ;		I001   5.0 PTR 722211 - Preserve CY when in buffer in HMA
 37855                                  
 37856                                  ;Break	<GETCURHEAD -- Get current buffer header>
 37857                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37858                                  ; Procedure Name : GetCurHead
 37859                                  ; Inputs:
 37860                                  ;	 No Inputs
 37861                                  ; Function:
 37862                                  ;	Returns the pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 37863                                  ;	and updates FIRST_BUFF_ADDR
 37864                                  ;       and invalidates LASTBUFFER (recency pointer)
 37865                                  ; Outputs:
 37866                                  ;	DS:DI = pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 37867                                  ;	FIRST_BUFF_ADDR = offset ( DI ) of First buffer in Queue
 37868                                  ;       LASTBUFFER = -1
 37869                                  ; No other registers altered
 37870                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37871                                  
 37872                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37873                                  ; DOSCODE:98D2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37874                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37875                                  ; DOSCODE:9876h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37876                                  
 37877                                  ; 06/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37878                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0AA4Bh
 37879                                  
 37880                                  GETCURHEAD:
 37881 0000650F 36C53E[6D00]            	lds	di,[ss:BufferQueue]	; Pointer to the first buffer
 37882 00006514 36C706[1E00]FFFF        	mov	word [ss:LastBuffer],-1	; invalidate last buffer
 37883 0000651B 36893E[1711]            	mov	[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],di	; save first buffer address
 37884 00006520 C3                      	retn
 37885                                  
 37886                                  ;Break	<SCANPLACE, PLACEBUF -- PUT A BUFFER BACK IN THE POOL>
 37887                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37888                                  ; Procedure Name : ScanPlace
 37889                                  ; Inputs:
 37890                                  ;	Same as PLACEBUF
 37891                                  ; Function:
 37892                                  ;	Save scan location and call PLACEBUF
 37893                                  ; Outputs:
 37894                                  ;	DS:DI Points to saved scan location
 37895                                  ; All registers, except DS:DI, preserved.
 37896                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37897                                  ;M039: Rewritten to preserve registers.
 37898                                  
 37899                                  ;SCANPLACE:
 37900                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37901                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5DDCh
 37902                                  ;	push	es
 37903                                  ;	les	si,[di]
 37904                                  ;	;les	si,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_link]
 37905                                  ;	call	PLACEBUF
 37906                                  ;	push	es
 37907                                  ;	pop	ds
 37908                                  ;	mov	di,si
 37909                                  ;	pop	es
 37910                                  ;scanplace_retn:
 37911                                  ;	retn	
 37912                                  	
 37913                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37914                                  SCANPLACE:
 37915 00006521 FF35                    	push	word [di]
 37916                                  	;push	word [di+BUFFINFO.buf_next] ;Save scan location
 37917 00006523 E80200                  	call	PLACEBUF
 37918 00006526 5F                      	pop	di
 37919 00006527 C3                      	retn
 37920                                  
 37921                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37922                                  ; Procedure Name : PlaceBuf
 37923                                  ; Input:
 37924                                  ;	DS:DI points to buffer (DS->BUFFINFO array, DI=offset in array)
 37925                                  ; Function:
 37926                                  ;	Remove buffer from queue and re-insert it in proper place.
 37927                                  ; NO registers altered
 37928                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37929                                  
 37930                                  ;procedure PLACEBUF,NEAR
 37931                                  
 37932                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37933                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37934                                  PLACEBUF:
 37935                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37936                                  
 37937                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37938 00006528 50                      	push	AX			;Save only regs we modify	;AN000;
 37939 00006529 53                      	push	BX							;AN000;
 37940                                  	; 23/09/2023
 37941                                  	;push	SI							;AN000;
 37942                                  	
 37943 0000652A 8B05                    	mov	ax,[di]
 37944                                  	;mov	ax,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next]
 37945 0000652C 368B1E[6D00]            	mov	bx,[ss:BufferQueue]	; bx = offset of head of list;smr;SS Override
 37946                                  	
 37947 00006531 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx				;Buf = last?		;AN000;
 37948 00006533 7422                    	je	short nret			;Yes, special case	;AN000;
 37949 00006535 39DF                    	cmp	di,bx				;Buf = first?		;AN000;
 37950 00006537 7506                    	jne	short not_first 		;Yes, special case	;AN000;
 37951 00006539 36A3[6D00]              	mov	[ss:BufferQueue],ax		;smr;SS Override
 37952 0000653D EB18                    	jmp	short nret 			;Continue with repositioning;AN000;
 37953                                  not_first:
 37954                                  	; 23/09/2023
 37955 0000653F 56                      	push	si
 37956                                  	;mov	si,[di+2]
 37957 00006540 8B7502                  	mov	SI,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_prev]	;No, SI = prior Buf	;AN000;
 37958 00006543 8904                    	mov	[si],ax
 37959                                  	;mov	[SI+BUFFINFO.buf_next],AX	; ax has di->buf_next	;AN000;

 38112                                  ;Break	<POINTCOMP -- 20 BIT POINTER COMPARE>
 38113                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38114                                  ;
 38115                                  ; Procedure Name : PointComp
 38116                                  ; Inputs:
 38117                                  ;         DS:SI & ES:DI
 38118                                  ; Function:
 38119                                  ;          Checks for ((SI==DI) && (ES==DS))
 38120                                  ;	   Assumes that pointers are normalized for the
 38121                                  ;	   same segment
 38122                                  ;
 38123                                  ; Compare DS:SI to ES:DI (or DS:DI to ES:SI) for equality
 38124                                  ; DO NOT USE FOR < or >
 38125                                  ; No Registers altered
 38126                                  ;
 38127                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38128                                  
 38129                                  POINTCOMP:
 38130                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38131                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D84h

 38140 00006571 5A                      	POP	DX
 38141 00006572 59                      	POP	CX

 38145                                  ; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38146                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D93h 
 38147                                  
 38148                                  ;Break	<GETBUFFR, GETBUFFRB -- GET A SECTOR INTO A BUFFER>
 38149                                  
 38150                                  ;**	GetBuffr - Get a non-FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38151                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38152                                  ;	GetBuffr does normal ( non-FAT ) sector buffering
 38153                                  ;	It gets the specified local sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38154                                  ;	and shuffles the queue
 38155                                  ; 
 38156                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38157                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38158                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	      (LOW)
 38159                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38160                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38161                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38162                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38163                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38164                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38165                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38166                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38167                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38168                                  
 38169                                  ;**	GetBuffrb - Get a FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38170                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38171                                  ;	GetBuffrb reads a sector from the FAT file system's FAT table.
 38172                                  ;	It gets the specified sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38173                                  ;	and shuffles the queue. We need a special entry point so that
 38174                                  ;	we can read the alternate FAT sector if the first read fails, also
 38175                                  ;	so we can mark the buffer as a FAT sector.
 38176                                  ; 
 38177                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38178                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38179                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	     (LOW)
 38180                                  ;		(SI) != 0
 38181                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38182                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38183                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38184                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38185                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38186                                  ;		CUR ddBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38187                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38188                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38189                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38190                                  
 38191                                  	; 22/09/2023 - RetroDOS v4.2 MSDOS.SYS (optimization)

 38807                                  ;
 38808                                  ; Procedure Name : CHECKFLUSH
 38809                                  ;
 38810                                  ; Inputs : AL - Drive number, -1 means do not check for drive
 38811                                  ;	   DS:DI - pointer to buffer
 38812                                  ;
 38813                                  ; Function : Write out a buffer if it is dirty
 38814                                  ;
 38815                                  ; Carry set if problem (currently user FAILed to I 24)

 38817                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38818

 38821                                  CHECKFLUSH:
 38822                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 38823 0000673D B4FF                    	mov	ah,-1	; 01/08/2018 Retro DOS v3.0
 38824                                  	;cmp	[di+4],ah
 38825 0000673F 386504                  	CMP	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AH
 38826 00006742 74F8                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Skip free buffer, carry clear

 38829                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 38830 00006748 3A4504                  	CMP	AL,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 38831 0000674B F8                      	CLC
 38832 0000674C 75EE                    	jnz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not for this unit or SFT
 38833                                  
 38834                                  	; 07/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 38835                                  	;;;

 38839 00006752 36F687[1012]08          	test	byte [ss:bx+drive_flags],8 ; bit 3
 38840 00006758 75E2                    	jnz	short flushbuf_retn
 38841                                  	;;;
 38842                                  
 38843                                  DOBUFFER:
 38844                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 38845 0000675A F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 38846 0000675E 74DC                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not dirty, carry clear by TEST
 38847 00006760 50                      	PUSH	AX
 38848                                  	;push	word [di+4]
 38849 00006761 FF7504                  	PUSH	WORD [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]

 38855                                  	;mov	[di+4],ax
 38856 0000676D 894504                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AX
 38857                                  LEAVE_BUF:
 38858 00006770 58                      	POP	AX			; Search info
 38859                                  checkflush_retn:

 38862                                  ;Break	<BUFWRITE -- WRITE OUT A BUFFER IF DIRTY>
 38863                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38864                                  ;
 38865                                  ;	BufWrite writes a buffer to the disk, if it's dirty.
 38866                                  ;
 38867                                  ;	ENTRY	DS:DI Points to the buffer
 38868                                  ;
 38869                                  ;	EXIT	Buffer marked free
 38870                                  ;		Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 38871                                  ;
 38872                                  ;	USES	All buf DS:DI
 38873                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR
 38874                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38875                                  
 38876                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 38877                                  	; DOSCODE:9AA0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 38878                                  
 38879                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38880                                  	; DOSCODE:9A45h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 38881                                  
 38882                                  	; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 38883                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0ACB1h
 38884                                  
 38885                                  BUFWRITE:
 38886                                  	; 10/09/2018
 38887                                  	; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38888                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E94h
 38889 00006772 B8FF00                  	MOV	AX,00FFH
 38890                                  	;xchg	ax,[di+4]

 38892 00006778 3CFF                    	CMP	AL,0FFH

 39170                                  ;============================================================================
 39171                                  ; MSPROC.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1992
 39172                                  ;============================================================================
 39173                                  ; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39174                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39175                                  ; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 39176                                  
 39177                                  ; (15/04/2018 - RetrO DOS v2.0, MSDOS 2.11 - PROC.ASM - 1983)
 39178                                  
 39179                                  ; Pseudo EXEC system call for DOS
 39180                                  
 39181                                  ;	TITLE	MSPROC - process maintenance
 39182                                  ;	NAME	MSPROC
 39183                                  
 39184                                  ; =========================================================================
 39185                                  ;**	Process related system calls and low level routines for DOS 2.X.
 39186                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 39187                                  ;
 39188                                  ;	$WAIT
 39189                                  ;	$EXEC
 39190                                  ;	$Keep_process
 39191                                  ;	Stay_resident
 39192                                  ;	$EXIT
 39193                                  ;	$ABORT
 39194                                  ;	abort_inner
 39195                                  ;
 39196                                  ;	Modification history:
 39197                                  ;
 39198                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 39199                                  ;		AN000	version 4.0 jan. 1988
 39200                                  ;		A007	PTM 3957 - fake vesrion for IBMCACHE.COM
 39201                                  ;		A008	PTM 4070 - fake version for MS WINDOWS
 39202                                  ;
 39203                                  ;		M000	added support for loading programs into UMBs 7/9/90
 39204                                  ;
 39205                                  ;		M004 - MS PASCAL 3.2 support. Please see under tag M003 in 
 39206                                  ;		       dossym.inc. 7/30/90
 39207                                  ;		M005 - Support for EXE programs with out STACK segment and 
 39208                                  ;		       with resident size < 64K - 256 bytes. A 256 byte 
 39209                                  ;		       stack is provided at the end of the program. Note that
 39210                                  ;		       only SP is changed.
 39211                                  ;		M020 - Fix for Rational bug for details see exepatch.asm
 39212                                  ;
 39213                                  ;		M028 - 4b04 implementation
 39214                                  ;
 39215                                  ;		M029 - Support for EXEs without stack rewritten. If EXE is
 39216                                  ;			in memory block >= 64K, sp = 0. If memory block
 39217                                  ;			obtained is <64K, point sp at the end of the memory
 39218                                  ;			block. For EXEs smaller than 64K, 256 bytes are still
 39219                                  ;			added for a stack segment which may be needed if it
 39220                                  ;			is loaded in low memory situations.
 39221                                  ;
 39222                                  ;		M030 - Fixing bug in EXEPACPATCH & changing 4b04 to 4b05
 39223                                  ;
 39224                                  ;		M040 - Bug #3052. The environment sizing code would flag a
 39225                                  ;			a bad environment if it reached 32767 bytes. Changed
 39226                                  ;			to allow 32768 bytes of environment.
 39227                                  ;
 39228                                  ;		M047 - Release the allocated UMB when we failed to load a 
 39229                                  ;		       COM file high. Also ensure that if the biggest block
 39230                                  ;		       into which we load the com file is less than 64K then
 39231                                  ;		       we provide atleast 256 bytes of stack to the user.
 39232                                  ;
 39233                                  ;		M050 - Made Lie table search CASE insensitive
 39234                                  ;
 39235                                  ;		M060 - Removed special version table from the kernal and
 39236                                  ;                      put it in a device drive which puts the address
 39237                                  ;                      in the DOS DATA area location UU_IFS_DOS_CALL
 39238                                  ;		       as a DWORD.
 39239                                  ;
 39240                                  ;		M063 - Modified UMB support. If the HIGH_ONLY bit is set on
 39241                                  ;		       entry do not try to load low if there is no space in
 39242                                  ;		       UMBs.
 39243                                  ;
 39244                                  ;		M068 - Support for copy protect apps. Call ChkCopyProt to 
 39245                                  ;		       set a20off_count. Set bit EXECA20BIT in DOS_FLAG. Also
 39246                                  ;		       change return address to LeaveDos if AL=5.
 39247                                  ;
 39248                                  ;               20-Jul-1992 bens  Added ifdef RESTRICTED_BUILD code that
 39249                                  ;                      controls building a version of MSDOS.SYS that only
 39250                                  ;                      runs programs from a fixed list (defined in the
 39251                                  ;                      file RESTRICT.INC).  Search for "RESTRICTED_BUILD"
 39252                                  ;                      for details.  This feature is used to build a
 39253                                  ;                      "special" version of DOS that can be handed out to
 39254                                  ;                      OEM/ISV customers as part of a "service" disk.
 39255                                  ;
 39256                                  ; =========================================================================
 39257                                  
 39258                                  ;SAVEXIT  EQU  10
 39259                                  
 39260                                  ;BREAK	<$WAIT - return previous process error code>
 39261                                  ; =========================================================================
 39262                                  ;	$WAIT - Return previous process error code.
 39263                                  ;
 39264                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 39265                                  ;
 39266                                  ;	    MOV     AH, WaitProcess
 39267                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 39268                                  ;
 39269                                  ;	ENTRY	none
 39270                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = exit code
 39271                                  ;	USES	all
 39272                                  ; =========================================================================
 39273                                  
 39274                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39275                                  	; DOSCODE:9B55h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 39276                                  
 39277                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39278                                  	; DOSCODE:9A5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 39279                                  
 39280                                  	; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 39281                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0AD78h	
 39282                                  
 39283                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:9B55h)
 39284                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:944Ch)
 39285                                  
 39286                                  _$WAIT:
 39287                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39288                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E1h
 39289                                  
 39290 00006834 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 39291 00006836 368706[3403]            	xchg	AX,[ss:exit_code]
 39292 0000683B E9419E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK

 39294                                  ; =========================================================================
 39295                                  ;BREAK <$exec - load/go a program>
 39296                                  ;	EXEC.ASM - EXEC System Call
 39297                                  ;
 39298                                  ;
 39299                                  ; Assembler usage:
 39300                                  ;	    lds     DX, Name
 39301                                  ;	    les     BX, Blk
 39302                                  ;	    mov     AH, Exec
 39303                                  ;	    mov     AL, FUNC
 39304                                  ;	    int     INT_COMMAND
 39305                                  ;
 39306                                  ;	AL  Function
 39307                                  ;	--  --------
 39308                                  ;	 0  Load and execute the program.
 39309                                  ;	 1  Load, create the program header but do not
 39310                                  ;	    begin execution.
 39311                                  ;	 3  Load overlay. No header created.
 39312                                  ;
 39313                                  ;	    AL = 0 -> load/execute program
 39314                                  ;
 39315                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39316                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 39317                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 39318                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39319                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 39320                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 39321                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39322                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39323                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 39324                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39325                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39326                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 39327                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39328                                  ;
 39329                                  ;	    AL = 1 -> load program
 39330                                  ;
 39331                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39332                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 39333                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 39334                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39335                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 39336                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 39337                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39338                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39339                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 39340                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39341                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39342                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 39343                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39344                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 39345                                  ;	    | CS:IP			|
 39346                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39347                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 39348                                  ;	    | SS:IP			|
 39349                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39350                                  ;
 39351                                  ;	    AL = 3 -> load overlay
 39352                                  ;
 39353                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39354                                  ;	    | WORD segment address where|
 39355                                  ;	    | file will be loaded.	|
 39356                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39357                                  ;	    | WORD relocation factor to |
 39358                                  ;	    | be applied to the image.	|
 39359                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39360                                  ;
 39361                                  ; Returns:
 39362                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 39363                                  ;	       = error_bad_format
 39364                                  ;	       = error_bad_environment
 39365                                  ;	       = error_not_enough_memory
 39366                                  ;	       = error_file_not_found
 39367                                  ; =========================================================================
 39368                                  ;
 39369                                  ;   Revision history:
 39370                                  ;
 39371                                  ;	 A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 39372                                  ;
 39373                                  ; =========================================================================
 39374                                  
 39375                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer		EQU	OPENBUF
 39376                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer_Size	EQU	(128+128+53+curdirLen)
 39377                                  
 39378                                  ; =========================================================================
 39379                                  
 39380                                  ;IF1		; warning message on buffers
 39381                                  ;%out	Please make sure that the following are contiguous and of the
 39382                                  ;%out	following sizes:
 39383                                  ;%out
 39384                                  ;%out	OpenBuf     128
 39385                                  ;%out	RenBuf	    128
 39386                                  ;%out	SearchBuf    53
 39387                                  ;%out	DummyCDS    curdirLen
 39388                                  ;ENDIF

 39398                                  
 39399                                  	; 30/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 39402                                  	; 08/03/2024

 39409                                  _$EXEC:
 39410                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39411                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5EF1h
 39412                                  
 39413                                  EXEC001S:
 39414                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Blk		,DWORD
 39415                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Func		,BYTE
 39416                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_High	,BYTE
 39417                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_FH		,WORD
 39418                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Rel_Fac	,WORD
 39419                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Res_Len_Para	,WORD
 39420                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Environ	,WORD
 39421                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Size		,WORD
 39422                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_Block	,WORD
 39423                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA		,WORD
 39424                                  	;LocalVar    ExecNameLen 	,WORD
 39425                                  	;LocalVar    ExecName		,DWORD
 39426                                  	;
 39427                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA_Save	,WORD
 39428                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_NoStack	,BYTE
 39429                                  
 39430                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 39431                                  	;%define	Exec_Blk	dword [bp-4]
 39432                                  	%define		Exec_Blk	[bp-4] ; 09/08/2018
 39433                                  	%define		Exec_BlkL	word [bp-4]
 39434                                  	%define		Exec_BlkH	word [bp-2]
 39435                                  	%define		Exec_Func	byte [bp-5]
 39436                                  	%define		Exec_Load_High	byte [bp-6]
 39437                                  	%define		Exec_FH		word [bp-8]
 39438                                  	%define		Exec_Rel_Fac	word [bp-10]
 39439                                  	%define		Exec_Res_Len_Para word [bp-12]
 39440                                  	%define		Exec_Environ	word [bp-14]
 39441                                  	%define		Exec_Size	word [bp-16]
 39442                                  	%define		Exec_Load_Block	word [bp-18]
 39443                                  	%define		Exec_DMA	word [bp-20]
 39444                                  	%define		ExecNameLen	word [bp-22]
 39445                                  	;%define	ExecName	dword [bp-26]
 39446                                  	%define		ExecName	[bp-26] ; 09/08/2018
 39447                                  	%define		ExecNameL	word [bp-26]
 39448                                  	%define		ExecNameH	word [bp-24]
 39449                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39450                                  	%define		Exec_DMA_Save	word [bp-28]
 39451                                  	%define		Exec_NoStack	byte [bp-29]
 39452                                  	
 39453                                  	; ==================================================================
 39454                                  	; validate function
 39455                                  	; ==================================================================
 39456                                  		      	
 39457                                  	; M068 - Start
 39458                                  	;
 39459                                  	; Reset the A20OFF_COUNT to 0. This is done as there is a
 39460                                  	; possibility that the count may not be decremented all the way to
 39461                                  	; 0. A typical case is if the program for which we intended to keep
 39462                                  	; the A20 off for a sufficiently long time (A20OFF_COUNT int 21 
 39463                                  	; calls), exits pre-maturely due to error conditions.
 39464                                  
 39465                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39466 0000683E 36C606[8500]00          	mov	byte [SS:A20OFF_COUNT], 0
 39467                                  
 39468                                  	; If al=5 (ExecReady) we'll change the return address on the stack
 39469                                  	; to be LeaveDos in msdisp.asm. This ensures that the EXECA20OFF
 39470                                  	; bit set in DOS_FLAG by ExecReady is not cleared in msdisp.asm
 39471                                  
 39472 00006844 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; Q: is this ExecReady call
 39473                                  	;jne	short @f
 39474 00006846 7505                    	jne	short Exec_@f		; N: continue
 39475                                  					; Y: change ret addr. to LeaveDos.
 39476 00006848 59                      	pop	cx			; Note CX is not input to ExecReady
 39477 00006849 B9[0A04]                	mov	cx,LeaveDOS
 39478 0000684C 51                      	push	cx
 39479                                  ;@@:
 39480                                  Exec_@f:
 39481                                  	; M068 - End
 39482                                  	
 39483                                  	;Enter
 39484                                  
 39485 0000684D 55                      	push	bp
 39486 0000684E 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 39487                                  	;;sub	sp,26	; MSDOS 3.3
 39488                                  	; 30/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 39489                                  	;sub	sp,29	; MSDOS 6.0 & MSDOS 6.22 & PCDOS 7.1 ; 07/03/2024
 39490                                  	; 17/12/2022
 39491                                  	; 20/05/2019
 39492 00006850 83EC1E                  	sub	sp,30	; Retro DOS v4.0
 39493                                  
 39494                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39495 00006853 3C05                    	cmp	AL,5			; only 0, 1, 3 or 5 are allowed ;M028
 39496                                  					; M030
 39497 00006855 7611                    	jna	short Exec_Check_2
 39498                                  
 39499                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 39500                                  	;cmp	AL,3
 39501                                  	;jna	short Exec_Check_2
 39502                                  
 39503                                  Exec_Bad_Fun:
 39504                                  	;mov	byte [ss:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; 1

 39557

 41063                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41064                                  ;SUBTTL Terminate and stay resident handler
 41065                                  ;
 41066                                  ; Input:    DX is an offset from CurrentPDB at which to
 41067                                  ;	    truncate the current block.
 41068                                  ;
 41069                                  ; output:   The current block is truncated (expanded) to be [DX+15]/16
 41070                                  ;	    paragraphs long. An exit is simulated via resetting CurrentPDB
 41071                                  ;	    and restoring the vectors.
 41072                                  ;
 41073                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41074                                  
 41075                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41076                                  	; DOSCODE:A19Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41077                                  
 41078                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41079                                  	; DOSCODE:A13Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41080                                  
 41081                                  	; 09/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 41082                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B3BCh
 41083                                  
 41084                                  _$KEEP_PROCESS:
 41085 00006E4A 50                      	push	AX			; keep exit code around
 41086                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 41087 00006E4B 36C606[7C05]03          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS
 41088 00006E51 368E06[3003]            	mov	ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]
 41089 00006E56 83FA06                  	cmp	DX,6h			; keep enough space around for system
 41090 00006E59 7303                    	jae	short Keep_Shrink	; info
 41091                                  
 41092 00006E5B BA0600                  	mov	DX,6h
 41093                                  
 41094                                  Keep_Shrink:
 41095 00006E5E 89D3                    	mov	BX,DX
 41096 00006E60 53                      	push	BX
 41097 00006E61 06                      	push	ES
 41098 00006E62 E82F02                  	call	_$SETBLOCK		; ignore return codes.
 41099 00006E65 1F                      	pop	DS
 41100 00006E66 5B                      	pop	BX
 41101 00006E67 7207                    	jc	short Keep_Done		; failed on modification
 41102                                  
 41103 00006E69 8CD8                    	mov	AX,DS
 41104 00006E6B 01D8                    	add	AX,BX
 41105                                  	;mov	[2],ax
 41106 00006E6D A30200                  	mov	[PDB.BLOCK_LEN],AX	;PBUGBUG
 41107                                  
 41108                                  Keep_Done:
 41109 00006E70 58                      	pop	AX
 41110 00006E71 EB26                    	jmp	SHORT exit_inner	; and let abort take care of the rest
 41111

 41146                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41147                                  	; IBMDOSDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 6375h

 41165                                  
 41166                                  ;BREAK <$ABORT -- Terminate a process>
 41167                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41168                                  ; Inputs:
 41169                                  ;	user_CS:00 must point to valid program header block
 41170                                  ; Function:
 41171                                  ;	Restore terminate and Cntrl-C addresses, flush buffers and transfer
 41172                                  ;	to the terminate address
 41173                                  ; Returns:
 41174                                  ;	TO THE TERMINATE ADDRESS
 41175                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41176                                  
 41177                                  _$ABORT:
 41178 00006EA6 30C0                    	xor	AL,AL
 41179                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],0
 41180                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],AL ; = 0
 41181 00006EA8 36C606[7C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_ABORT
 41182                                  
 41183                                  	; abort_inner must have AL set as the exit code! The exit type
 41184                                  	; is retrieved from exit_type. Also, the PDB at user_CS needs
 41185                                  	; to be correct as the one that is terminating.
 41186                                  
 41187                                  abort_inner:
 41188 00006EAE 368A26[7C05]            	mov	AH,[SS:EXIT_TYPE]
 41189 00006EB3 36A3[3403]              	mov	[SS:exit_code],AX
 41190 00006EB7 E8D195                  	call	Get_User_Stack
 41191                                  
 41192                                  	;mov	ds,[si+14h]
 41193 00006EBA 8E5C14                  	mov	DS,[SI+user_env.user_CS] ; set up old interrupts ;PBUGBUG
 41194 00006EBD 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 41195 00006EBF 8EC0                    	mov	ES,AX
 41196                                  	;mov	si,10
 41197 00006EC1 BE0A00                  	mov	SI,SAVEXIT
 41198                                  	;mov	di,88h
 41199 00006EC4 BF8800                  	mov	DI,addr_int_terminate
 41200 00006EC7 A5                      	movsw
 41201 00006EC8 A5                      	movsw
 41202 00006EC9 A5                      	movsw
 41203 00006ECA A5                      	movsw
 41204 00006ECB A5                      	movsw
 41205 00006ECC A5                      	movsw
 41206 00006ECD E975EF                  	jmp	reset_environment

 41402                                  ;**	Arena_Next - Find Next item in Arena
 41403                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41404                                  ;	ENTRY	DS - pointer to block head
 41405                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41406                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 41407                                  ;		'C' set iff arena damaged
 41408                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41409                                  
 41410                                  arena_next:
 41411 00006F0A 8CD8                            MOV     AX,DS                   ; AX <- current block
 41412 00006F0C 03060300                        ADD     AX,[ARENA.SIZE]		; AX <- AX + current block length
 41413 00006F10 40                              INC     AX                      ; remember that header!
 41414                                  
 41415                                  ;       fall into check_signature and return
 41416                                  ;
 41417                                  ;       CALL    check_signature         ; ES <- AX, carry set if error
 41418                                  ;       RETN
 41419                                  
 41420                                  ;**	Check_Signature - Check Memory Block Signature
 41421                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41422                                  ;	ENTRY	(AX) = address of block header
 41423                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41424                                  ;	EXIT	 ES = AX
 41425                                  ;		'C' clear if signature good
 41426                                  ;		'C' set if signature bad
 41427                                  ;	USES	ES, Flags
 41428                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41429                                  
 41430                                  check_signature:        
 41431                                  
 41432 00006F11 8EC0                    	MOV     ES,AX                   ; ES <- AX
 41433                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di],4Dh ; 'M'
 41434 00006F13 26803D4D                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_normal
 41435                                                                          ; IF next signature = not_end THEN
 41436 00006F17 7407                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 41437                                  	;cmp 	byte [es:di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 41438 00006F19 26803D5A                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_end
 41439                                                                          ; IF next signature = end then
 41440 00006F1D 7401                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 41441 00006F1F F9                              STC                             ; set error
 41442                                  ret_label: ; MSDOS 6.0
 41443                                  ;AFP_RETN:	; 10/03/2024
 41444                                   	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 41445                                  check_signature_ok:
 41446                                  COALESCE_RETN:
 41447 00006F20 C3                      	RETN
 41448                                  
 41449                                  ;**	Coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 41450                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41451                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 41452                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 41453                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 41454                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 41455                                  ;
 41456                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds) = pointer to the head of a free block
 41457                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41458                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 41459                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 41460                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 41461                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 41462                                  ;	USES	(cx)
 41463                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41464                                          
 41465                                  Coalesce:
 41466                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 41467 00006F21 803D5A                  	CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 41468                                                                          ; IF current signature = END THEN
 41469                                          ;retz				;   GOTO ok
 41470 00006F24 74FA                            jz	short COALESCE_RETN
 41471 00006F26 E8E1FF                  	CALL    arena_next              ; ES, AX <- next block, Carry set if error
 41472                                          ;retc				; IF no error THEN GOTO check
 41473 00006F29 72F5                    	jc	short COALESCE_RETN
 41474                                  
 41475                                  coalesce_check:
 41476                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di
 41477 00006F2B 26393E0100                      CMP     [ES:ARENA.OWNER],DI
 41478                                          ;retnz				; IF next block isnt free THEN return
 41479 00006F30 75EE                            JNZ	SHORT COALESCE_RETN
 41480                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:3]
 41481 00006F32 268B0E0300              	MOV     CX,[ES:ARENA.SIZE]	; CX <- next block size
 41482 00006F37 41                              INC     CX                      ; CX <- CX + 1 (for header size)
 41483                                          ;ADD	[3],CX
 41484 00006F38 010E0300                	ADD     [ARENA.SIZE],CX		; current size <- current size + CX
 41485 00006F3C 268A0D                          MOV     CL,[ES:DI]              ; move up signature
 41486 00006F3F 880D                            MOV     [DI],CL
 41487 00006F41 EBDE                            JMP     SHORT Coalesce		; try again

 41489                                  ; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41490                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 641Fh
 41491                                  
 41492                                  ;	BREAK  <$Alloc - allocate space in memory>
 41493                                  
 41494                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 41495                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41496                                  ;**	$Alloc - Allocate Memory Space
 41497                                  ;
 41498                                  ;	$Alloc services the INT21 that allocates memory space to a program.
 41499                                  ;	Alloc returns a pointer to a free block of memory that
 41500                                  ;	has the requested size in paragraphs.
 41501                                  ;
 41502                                  ;	If the allocation strategy is HIGH_FIRST or HIGH_ONLY memory is 
 41503                                  ;	scanned from umb_head if not from arena_head. If the strategy is
 41504                                  ; 	HIGH_FIRST the scan is continued from arena_head if a block of 
 41505                                  ;	appropriate size is not found in the UMBs. If the strategy is 
 41506                                  ;	HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY only the UMBs are scanned for memory.
 41507                                  ;
 41508                                  ;	In either case if bit 0 of UmbFlag is not initialized then the scan
 41509                                  ;	starts from arena_head.
 41510                                  ;
 41511                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 41512                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 41513                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 41514                                  ;           INT     21h
 41515                                  ;
 41516                                  ;	BUGBUG - a lot can be done to improve performance. We can set marks
 41517                                  ;	so that we start searching the arena at it's first non-trivial free
 41518                                  ;	block, we can peephole the code, etc. (We can move some subr calls
 41519                                  ;	inline, etc.) I assume that this is called rarely and that the arena
 41520                                  ;	doesn't have too many memory objects in it beyond the first free one.
 41521                                  ;	verify that this is true; if so, this can stay as is
 41522                                  ;
 41523                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = requested size, in bytes
 41524                                  ;		(DS) = (ES) = DOSGROUP
 41525                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if memory allocated
 41526                                  ;		  (ax:0) = address of requested memory
 41527                                  ;		'C' set if request failed
 41528                                  ;		  (AX) = error_not_enough_memory
 41529                                  ;		    (bx) = max size we could have allocated
 41530                                  ;		  (ax) = error_arena_trashed
 41531                                  ;	USES	All
 41532                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41533                                  
 41534                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 41535                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41536                                  ;SUBTTL $Alloc - allocate space in memory
 41537                                  ;
 41538                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 41539                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 41540                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 41541                                  ;           INT     21h
 41542                                  ;         AX:0 is pointer to allocated memory
 41543                                  ;         BX is max size if not enough memory
 41544                                  ;
 41545                                  ;   Description:
 41546                                  ;           Alloc returns  a  pointer  to  a  free  block of
 41547                                  ;       memory that has the requested  size  in  paragraphs.
 41548                                  ;
 41549                                  ;   Error return:
 41550                                  ;           AX = error_not_enough_memory
 41551                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 41552                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41553                                  
 41554                                  ; DOSCODE:A28Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41555                                  
 41556                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 41892                                  ;	BREAK $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 41893                                  
 41894                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 41895                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41896                                  ;**	$SETBLOCK - Change size of an Allocated Block
 41897                                  ;
 41898                                  ;	Setblock changes the size of an allocated block. First, we coalesce
 41899                                  ;	any following free space onto this block; then we try to trim the
 41900                                  ;	block down to the size requested.
 41901                                  ;
 41902                                  ;	Note that if the guy wants to grow the block but that growth fails,
 41903                                  ;	we still go ahead and coalesce any trailing free blocks onto it.
 41904                                  ;	Thus the maximum-size-possible value that we return has already
 41905                                  ;	been allocated! This is a bug, dare we fix it? BUGBUG
 41906                                  ;
 41907                                  ;	NOTE - $SETBLOCK is in bed with $ALLOC and jumps into $ALLOC to
 41908                                  ;		finish it's work. For this reason we build the allocsf
 41909                                  ;		structure on the frame, to make us compatible with $ALLOCs
 41910                                  ;		code.
 41911                                  ;
 41912                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = segment of old block
 41913                                  ;		(bx) = newsize
 41914                                  ;		(ah) = SETBLOCK
 41915                                  ;
 41916                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 41917                                  ;		'C' set if error
 41918                                  ;		  (ax) = error_invalid_block
 41919                                  ;		       = error_arena_trashed
 41920                                  ;		       = error_not_enough_memory
 41921                                  ;		       = error_invalid_function
 41922                                  ;		  (bx) = maximum size possible, iff (ax) = error_not_enough_memory
 41923                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 41924                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41925                                  
 41926                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 41927                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41928                                  ;SUBTTL $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 41929                                  ;
 41930                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 41931                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 41932                                  ;           MOV     BX,newsize
 41933                                  ;           MOV     AH,setblock
 41934                                  ;           INT     21h
 41935                                  ;         if setblock fails for growing, BX will have the maximum
 41936                                  ;         size possible
 41937                                  ;   Error return:
 41938                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_block
 41939                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 41940                                  ;              = error_not_enough_memory
 41941                                  ;              = error_invalid_function
 41942                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41943                                  
 41944                                  _$SETBLOCK:        
 41945                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41946                                  	;EnterCrit   critMem
 41947 00007094 E801A8                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 41948                                  
 41949 00007097 BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE

 42039                                  ;	BREAK $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42040                                  
 42041                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42042                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42043                                  ;**	$AllocOper - Get/Set Allocation Mechanism
 42044                                  ;
 42045                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 42046                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42047                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42048                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42049                                  ;           INT     21h
 42050                                  ;
 42051                                  ;	ENTRY	
 42052                                  ;		(al) = 0
 42053                                  ;		  Get allocation Strategy in (ax)
 42054                                  ;
 42055                                  ;		(al) = 1, (bx) = method = zw0000xy
 42056                                  ;		  Set allocation strategy.
 42057                                  ;		   w  = 1  => HIGH_ONLY
 42058                                  ;		   z  = 1  => HIGH_FIRST
 42059                                  ;		   xy = 00 => FIRST_FIT
 42060                                  ;		      = 01 => BEST_FIT
 42061                                  ;		      = 10 => LAST_FIT
 42062                                  ;
 42063                                  ;		(al) = 2
 42064                                  ;		  Get UMB link state in (al)
 42065                                  ;
 42066                                  ;		(al) = 3
 42067                                  ;		  Set UMB link state
 42068                                  ;		   (bx) = 0 => Unlink UMBs
 42069                                  ;		   (bx) = 1 => Link UMBs
 42070                                  ;
 42071                                  ;
 42072                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42073                                  ;
 42074                                  ;		 if (al) = 0
 42075                                  ;		  (ax) = existing method
 42076                                  ;		 if (al) = 1
 42077                                  ;		  Sets allocation strategy
 42078                                  ;		 if (al) = 2
 42079                                  ;		  (al) = 0 => UMBs not linked
 42080                                  ;		  (al) = 1 => UMBs linked in
 42081                                  ;		 if (al) = 3
 42082                                  ;		  Links/Unlinks the UMBs into DOS chain
 42083                                  ;
 42084                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42085                                  ;		  AX = error_invalid_function
 42086                                  ;
 42087                                  ;	Rev. M000 - added support for HIGH_FIRST in (al) = 1. 7/9/90
 42088                                  ; 	Rev. M003 - added functions (al) = 2 and (al) = 3. 7/18/90
 42089                                  ;	Rev. M009 - (al) = 3 will return 'invalid function' in ax if
 42090                                  ;		    umbhead has'nt been initialized by sysinit and 'trashed
 42091                                  ;		    arena' if an arena sig is damaged.
 42092                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42093                                  
 42094                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 42095                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42096                                  ;SUBTTL $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42097                                  ;
 42098                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42099                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42100                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42101                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42102                                  ;           INT     21h
 42103                                  ;
 42104                                  ;   Error return:
 42105                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_function
 42106                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42107
