 42327                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42328                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42329                                  ; Procedure Name : GetLastArena		-  M003
 42330                                  ;
 42331                                  ; Inputs	 : cx = umb_head
 42332                                  ;
 42333                                  ;
 42334                                  ; Outputs	 : If UMBs are linked
 42335                                  ;			ES = umb_head
 42336                                  ;			DS = arena before umb_head
 42337                                  ;		   else
 42338                                  ;			DS = last arena
 42339                                  ;			ES = next arena. will be umb_head if NC.
 42340                                  ;
 42341                                  ;		   CY if error
 42342                                  ;
 42343                                  ; Uses		 : DS, ES, DI, BX
 42344                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42345                                  
 42346                                  ; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42347                                  ; DOSCODE:A4D6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 42348                                  
 42349                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42350                                  ; DOSCODE:A476h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 42351                                  
 42352                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42353                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B6D9h
 42354                                  
 42355                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0A4D6h)
 42356                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:9F25h)
 42357                                  
 42358                                  GetLastArena:
 42359 0000715D 50                      	push	ax			; save ax
 42360                                  
 42361 0000715E 36A1[2400]              	mov	ax,[ss:arena_head]
 42362 00007162 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; es = arena_head
 42363 00007164 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 42364                                  
 42365 00007166 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 42366                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 42367 0000716A 7416                    	je	short GLA_done		; Y: return last arena in ES
 42368                                  
 42369                                  GLA_next:
 42370 0000716C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 42371 0000716E E899FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 42372                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42373                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 42374                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42375 00007171 7222                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 42376                                  
 42377                                  ; 10/03/2024
 42378                                  %if 0
 42379                                  	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 42380                                  	jnz	short GLA_chkumb	; Y: terminating condition is
 42381                                  					;    umb_head
 42382                                  					; N: terminating condition is 05Ah
 42383                                  %else
 42384                                  	; 10/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42385                                  	;;;
 42386 00007173 E85BFD                  	call	test_umb_flag
 42387 00007176 7506                    	jnz	short GLA_chkumb
 42388                                  	;;;
 42389                                  %endif
 42390 00007178 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 42391                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 42392 0000717C EB02                    	jmp	short GLA_@f
 42393                                  GLA_chkumb:
 42394 0000717E 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 42395                                  GLA_@f:
 42396 00007180 75EA                    	jne	short GLA_next		; N: get next arena
 42397                                  
 42398                                  GLA_done:
 42399                                  
 42400                                  ; 10/03/2024
 42401                                  %if 0
 42402                                  					; M061 - Start
 42403                                  	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 42404                                  	jnz	short GLA_ret		; Y: we're done
 42405                                  					; N: let us confirm that the next
 42406                                  					;    arena is umb_head
 42407                                  %else
 42408                                  	; 10/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42409                                  	;;;
 42410 00007182 E84CFD                  	call	test_umb_flag
 42411 00007185 750B                    	jnz	short GLA_ret ; cf=0
 42412                                  	;;;
 42413                                  %endif
 42414 00007187 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 42415 00007189 E87EFD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 42416                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 42417 0000718C 7207                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 42418 0000718E 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 42419 00007190 7502                    	jne	short GLA_err		; N: error
 42420                                  					; M061 - End
 42421                                  GLA_ret:
 42422                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42423                                  	;clc
 42424                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42425                                  	;clc
 42426 00007192 58                      	pop	ax			; M061
 42427 00007193 C3                      	retn				; M061
 42428                                  
 42429                                  GLA_err:
 42430 00007194 F9                      	stc				; M061
 42431                                  GLA_err2:
 42432 00007195 58                      	pop	ax
 42433                                  
 42434                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 
 42435                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42436                                  	;;;
 42437 00007196 58                      	pop	ax	; return address to _$ALLOCOPER (the caller)
 42438 00007197 E847A1                  	call	set_exerr_locus_mem
 42439 0000719A E910FE                  	jmp	alloc_trashed2	; (error return from _$ALLOCOPER)
 42440                                  	;;;
 42441                                  
 42442                                  	; 10/03/2024
 42443                                  	;retn

 42512                                  ;
 42513                                  ; Procedure Name : $ServerCall
 42514                                  ;
 42515                                  ; Inputs:
 42516                                  ;	DS:DX -> DPL  (except calls 7,8,9)
 42517                                  ; Function:
 42518                                  ;	AL=0	Server DOS call
 42519                                  ;	AL=1	Commit All files
 42520                                  ;	AL=2	Close file by name (SHARING LOADED ONLY) DS:DX in DPL -> name
 42521                                  ;	AL=3	Close all files for DPL_UID
 42522                                  ;	AL=4	Close all files for DPL_UID/PID_PID
 42523                                  ;	AL=5	Get open file list entry
 42524                                  ;		    IN: BX File Index
 42525                                  ;			CX User Index
 42526                                  ;		    OUT:ES:DI -> Name
 42527                                  ;			BX = UID
 42528                                  ;		    CX = # locked blocks held by this UID
 42529                                  ;	AL=6	Get DOS data area
 42530                                  ;		    OUT: DS:SI -> Start
 42531                                  ;			CX size in bytes of swap if indos
 42532                                  ;			DX size in bytes of swap always
 42533                                  ;	AL=7	Get truncate flag
 42534                                  ;	AL=8	Set truncate flag
 42535                                  ;	AL=9	Close all spool files
 42536                                  ;	AL=10	SetExtendedError
 42537                                  ;
 42538                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42539                                  
 42540                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42541                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B735h
 42542

 42730 0000725E E86DA5                  	call	XCHGP
 42731

 42733                                  ; ES:DI point to stack
 42734                                  ;

 42739 00007265 F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW			; Put in AX,BX,CX,DX,SI,DI

 42746                                  	;MOV	AX,[SI+DPL.AX]
 42747                                  	;mov	bx,[si+2]

 42759                                  	;mov	ds,[si+12]

 42764 00007284 368C1E[EC05]            	MOV	[SS:SAVEDS],DS

 42766 0000728E 36C606[7205]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; set no redirect flag
 42767 00007294 E9F290                  	jmp	REDISP

 42769                                  GET_DOS_DATA:

 42864                                  ;	BREAK	<pJFNFromHandle - return pointer to JFN table entry>
 42865                                  
 42866                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 42867                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42868                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 42869                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 42870                                  ;
 42871                                  ;	NOTE:
 42872                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 42873                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42874                                  ;
 42875                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 42876                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 42877                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 42878                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42879                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 42880                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 42881                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42882                                  
 42883                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42884                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42885                                  
 42886                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 42887                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42888                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 42889 000072EB 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42890                                  	
 42891                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 42892 000072F0 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 42893                                  
 42894                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 42895 000072F5 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 42896 000072FA 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 42897                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 42898                                  	;mov	al,6
 42899 000072FC B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42900                                  ReturnCarry:
 42901 000072FE F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 42902 000072FF C3                      	retn				; go back
 42903                                  pjfn10: 
 42904                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 42905 00007300 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 42906 00007305 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'
 42907                                  	;clc
 42908                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 42909 00007307 C3                      	retn
 42910                                  
 42911                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 42912                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42913                                  ;
 42914                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 42915                                  ;
 42916                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 42917                                  ;
 42918                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 42919                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 42920                                  ;                   AX has error code
 42921                                  ;               Carry Reset
 42922                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 42923                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 42924                                  ; NOTE:
 42925                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 42926                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42927                                  ;
 42928                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42929                                  
 42930                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42931                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42932                                  
 42933                                  SFFromHandle:
 42934 00007308 E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 42935                                  	;retc				; return if error
 42936 0000730B 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 42937 0000730D 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 42938                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 42939                                  	;;mov	al,6
 42940                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42941                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 42942                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42943                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42944 00007311 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 42945                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 42946                                  	;;mov	al,6
 42947                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42948                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 42949                                  GetSF:
 42950 00007313 53                      	push	bx			; save handle
 42951 00007314 268A1D                  	MOV     BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFN
 42952 00007317 30FF                    	XOR     BH,BH                   ; ignore upper half
 42953 00007319 E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot
 42954 0000731C 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore
 42955 0000731D C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye
 42956                                  
 42957                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 42958                                  
 42959                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 42960                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42961                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 42962                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 42963                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 42964                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 42965                                  ;
 42966                                  ;   NOTE:
 42967                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 42968                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42969                                  ;
 42970                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 42971                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42972                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 42973                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 42974                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 42975                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42976                                  
 42977                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42978                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42979                                  
 42980                                  SFFromSFN:
 42981                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42982                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 42983 0000731E 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42984                                  
 42985                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 42986 00007323 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 42987                                  sfsfn5:	
 42988                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 42989 00007328 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 42990 0000732C 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 42991                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 42992 0000732E 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 42993 00007332 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 42994                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 42995 00007335 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 42996 00007338 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 42997 0000733A F9                      	STC
 42998 0000733B C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 42999                                  sfsfn7:
 43000 0000733C 50                      	push	ax
 43001                                  	;;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 43002                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 5.0 to PCDOS 7.1 (to Win ME) ; 11/03/2024
 43003                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 43004                                  	
 43005                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43006 0000733D B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 43007                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43008                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 43009                                  	
 43010 0000733F F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 43011 00007341 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 43012 00007343 58                      	pop	ax
 43013                                  	;add	di,6
 43014 00007344 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 43015 00007347 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 43016                                  
 43017                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 43018                                  
 43019                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 43020                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43021                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 43022                                  ;
 43023                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43024                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 43025                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 43026                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 43027                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43028                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43029                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 43030                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43031                                  
 43032                                  JFNFree:
 43033 00007348 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 43034                                  jfnf1:	
 43035 0000734A E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 43036 0000734D 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 43037 0000734F 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 43038 00007353 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 43039 00007355 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 43040 00007356 EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 43041                                  
 43042                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 43043                                  jfnf5:	
 43044                                  	;mov	al,4
 43045 00007358 B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 43046                                  jfnfx:	
 43047 0000735A C3                      	retn				; bye
 43048                                  
 43049                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 43050                                  
 43051                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 43052                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43053                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 43054                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43055                                  ;
 43056                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 43057                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 43058                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 43059                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 43060                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 43061                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 43062                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 43063                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 43064                                  ;
 43065                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 43066                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 43067                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 43068                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 43069                                  ;
 43070                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43071                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 43072                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 43073                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43074                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43075                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43076                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43077                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 43078                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43079                                  
 43080                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43081                                  	; DOSCODE:A682h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43082                                  
 43083                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43084                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B8DEh
 43085                                  
 43086                                  SFNFree:
 43087                                  	; 12/08/2018
 43088                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43089                                  	;
 43090                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 43091 0000735B 50                      	push	ax
 43092 0000735C 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; (bx) = SFN to consider
 43093                                  sfnf5:	
 43094 0000735E 53                      	push	bx
 43095 0000735F E8BCFF                  	call	SFFromSFN		; get the potential handle
 43096 00007362 5B                      	pop	bx
 43097 00007363 723A                    	jc	short sfnf95		; no more free SFNs
 43098 00007365 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0
 43099                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0 ; free?
 43100 00007369 741D                    	je	short sfnf20			; yep, got one
 43101                                  	
 43102                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 43103 0000736B 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43104                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43105 0000736F 7403                    	je	short sfnf10		; special busy mark
 43106                                  sfnf7:	
 43107 00007371 43                      	inc	bx			; try the next one
 43108 00007372 EBEA                    	jmp	short sfnf5
 43109                                  
 43110                                  ;	The SFT has the special "busy" mark; if it belongs to us then
 43111                                  ;	it was abandoned during a earlier call and we can use it.
 43112                                  ;
 43113                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43114                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43115                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43116                                  
 43117                                  sfnf10:	
 43118 00007374 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43119                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43120 00007378 2639452F                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43121 0000737C 75F3                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; not ours
 43122 0000737E 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43123                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 43124 00007382 26394531                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43125 00007386 75E9                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; can't use this one, try the next
 43126                                  
 43127                                  ;	We have an SFT to allocate
 43128                                  ;
 43129                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43130                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43131                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43132                                  
 43133                                  sfnf20:
 43134                                  	; cf = 0 ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43135                                  
 43136                                  	;mov	word [es:di],0FFFFh
 43137 00007388 26C705FFFF              	mov	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43138                                  					; make sure that this is allocated
 43139                                  	;mov	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43140                                  
 43141 0000738D 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43142                                  	;mov	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43143 00007391 2689452F                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43144 00007395 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43145                                  	;mov	[es:di+31h],ax
 43146 00007399 26894531                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43147                                  sfnf21: ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43148                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43149                                  	;pop	ax
 43150                                  	;;clc
 43151                                  	;retn				; return with no error
 43152                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43153 0000739D 58                      	pop	ax
 43154                                  	;clc
 43155 0000739E C3                      	retn
 43156                                  
 43157                                  ;**	Error - no more free SFNs
 43158                                  ;
 43159                                  ;	'C' set
 43160                                  ;	(TOS) = saved ax
 43161                                  
 43162                                  sfnf95: 
 43163 0000739F 58                      	pop	ax
 43164                                  
 43165                                  ; 11/03/2024
 43166                                  %if 0
 43167                                  	;mov	al,4
 43168                                  	mov	al,error_too_many_open_files
 43169                                  	retn				; return with 'C' and error
 43170                                  %else
 43171                                  	; 11/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43172                                  	;;;
 43173 000073A0 EBB6                    	jmp	short jfnf5
 43174                                  	;;;
 43175                                  %endif
 43176

 43180                                  ; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43181                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 43183                                  
 43184                                  ; DOSCODE:A72Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 43185                                  
 43186                                  ;	BREAK <$Close - return a handle to the system>
 43187                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43188                                  ;
 43189                                  ;**	$Close - Close a file Handle
 43190                                  ;
 43191                                  ;	BUGBUG - close gets called a LOT with invalid handles - sizzle that
 43192                                  ;		path
 43193                                  ;
 43194                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 43195                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 43196                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Close

 43215                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 43216

 43222 000073AD 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 43223                                  
 43224                                  ; DS:SI point to JFN table entry.
 43225                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 43226                                  ;
 43227                                  ; We now examine the user's JFN entry; If the file was a 70-mode file (network
 43228                                  ; FCB, we examine the ref count on the SFT; if it was 1, we free the JFN.
 43229                                  ; If the file was not a net FCB, we free the JFN too.

 43243                                  ; -1.

 44317                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 44318                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44319                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 44320                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 44321                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 44322                                  ;   that it does not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 44323                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 44324                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 44325                                  ;
 44326                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 44327                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 44328                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 44329                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 44330                                  ;	USES	none
 44331                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44332                                  
 44333                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44334                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44335                                  CheckOwner:
 44336                                  	; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 44337                                  
 44338 0000769B E86AFC                  	call	SFFromHandle
 44339 0000769E 721B                    	jc	short co_ret_label	; retc
 44340                                  
 44341 000076A0 50                      	push	ax
 44342                                  
 44343                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 44344

 44346                                  ;SR; are shared across multiple VMs in win386.

 44382                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 44383                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 44384                                  
 44385                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 44386                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 44387                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 44388                                  
 44389                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 44390                                  ;
 44391                                  ;	$AssignOper
 44392                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 44393                                  ;	InitCDS
 44394                                  ;	$UserOper
 44395                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 44396                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 44397                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 44398                                  ;
 44399                                  ;   Revision history:
 44400                                  ;
 44401                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 44402                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 44403                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 44404                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 44405                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 44406                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 44407                                  ;				    aliasing.
 44408                                  ;
 44409                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 44410                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 44411                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 44412                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 44413                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 44414                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 44415                                  ;
 44416                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 44417                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 44418                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 44419                                  ;
 44420                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 44421                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 44422                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 44423                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 44424                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 44425                                  ;
 44426                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 44427                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 44428                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 44429                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 44430                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 44431                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 44432                                  ;
 44433                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 44434                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 44435                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 44436                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 44437                                  ;   number.
 44438                                  ;
 44439                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 44440                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 44441                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 44442                                  ;   TransPath.
 44443                                  ;
 44444                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 44445                                  
 44446                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 44447                                  
 44448                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 44449                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 44450                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 44451                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 44452                                  ;					; current drive)
 44453                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 44454                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 44455                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 44456                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 44457                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 44458                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 44459                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 44460                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 44461                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error

 44463                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 44464                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44465                                  ; Inputs:
 44466                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 44467                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 44468                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 44469                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 44470                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 44471                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 44472                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 44473                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 44474                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 44475                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 44476                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 44477                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 44478                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 44479                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 44480                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 44481                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 44482                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 44483                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 44484                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 44485                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,
 44486                                  ; Function:
 44487                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 44488                                  ; Returns:
 44489                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return
 44490                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44491                                  
 44492                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 44563                                  ;Break <FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a drive number>
 44564                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44565                                  ;**	FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a Drive #
 44566                                  ;
 44567                                  ;	ENTRY	AL has drive number A = 0
 44568                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set
 44569                                  ;		    No DPB for this drive number
 44570                                  ;		'C' clear
 44571                                  ;		    DS:SI points to DPB for drive
 44572                                  ;	USES	SI, DS, Flags
 44573                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44574                                  
 44575                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44576                                  FIND_DPB:
 44577 000076F5 36C536[2600]            	LDS	SI,[SS:DPBHEAD]		;smr;SS Override
 44578                                  fdpb5:

 44584                                  	;;lds	si,[si+18h] ; MSDOS 3.3
 44585                                  	;lds	si,[si+19h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 44586 00007703 C57419                  	LDS	SI,[SI+DPB.NEXT_DPB]
 44587 00007706 EBF2                    	JMP	short fdpb5

 44663                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 44664                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44665                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 44666                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 44667                                  ;
 44668                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 44669                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 44670                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 44671                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 44672                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 44673                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 44674                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 44675                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 44676                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number

 44678                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word

 44975                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 44976                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44977                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 44978                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 44979                                  ;
 44980                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 44981                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 44982                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 44983                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 44984                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 44985                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 44986                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 44987                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44988                                  
 44989                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44990                                  TransFCB:
 44991                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44992                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 44993                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 44994                                  	;ENTER
 44995 00007831 55                      	push	bp
 44996 00007832 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 44997                                  	;sub	sp,15	; MSDOS 3.3
 44998 00007834 83EC10                  	sub	sp,16	; MSDOS 6.0
 44999 00007837 16                      	push	ss
 45000 00007838 07                      	pop	es
 45001 00007839 06                      	push	es
 45002 0000783A 57                      	push	di
 45003                                  	;lea	di,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 45004                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp 
 45005 0000783B 8D7EF0                  	lea	di,[bp-16]		; point to FCB temp area
 45006 0000783E 36C606[6C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0	; no extended FCB found ;smr;SS Override
 45007 00007844 36C606[6D05]00          	mov	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0	; default search attributes;smr;SS Override
 45008 0000784A E8B3A9                  	call	GetExtended             ; get FCB, extended or not
 45009                                  	; 06/12/2022
 45010 0000784D 740D                    	jz	short GetDrive		; not an extended FCB, get drive
 45011 0000784F 8A44FF                  	mov	AL,[SI-1]               ; get attributes
 45012 00007852 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],AL		; store search attributes;smr;SS Override
 45013 00007856 36C606[6C05]FF          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],-1	; signal extended FCB  ;smr;SS Override
 45014                                  GetDrive:
 45015 0000785C AC                      	lodsb				; get drive byte
 45016 0000785D E862FF                  	call	GETTHISDRV
 45017 00007860 722A                    	jc	short BadPack
 45018 00007862 E86F03                  	call	TextFromDrive           ; convert 0-based drive to text
 45019                                  
 45020                                  ; Scan the source to see if there are any illegal chars
 45021                                  
 45022                                  	;mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 45023 00007865 B90B00                  	mov	cx,11
 45024 00007868 56                      	push	si			; back over name, ext
 45025                                  FCBScan:
 45026 00007869 AC                      	lodsb				; get a byte
 45027                                  	
 45028                                  	; 09/08/2018
 45029                                  	;;xlat	byte [es:bx]
 45030                                  	;es	xlat
 45031                                  
 45032                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 45033 0000786A E8B8E1                  	call	GetCharType		; get flags
 45034                                  
 45035                                  	;test	al,8	
 45036 0000786D A808                    	test	al,FFCB
 45037 0000786F 741B                    	jz	short BadPack
 45038                                  NextCh:

 45040 00007873 5E                      	pop	si
 45041 00007874 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 45042 00007876 E8E4AD                  	call	PackName                ; crunch the path
 45043 00007879 5F                      	pop	di			; get original destination
 45044 0000787A 07                      	pop	es
 45045 0000787B 16                      	push	ss			; get DS addressability
 45046 0000787C 1F                      	pop	ds

 45048                                  	;LEA	SI,FCBTmp		; point at new pathname

 45050 00007880 803F00                  	cmp	byte [bx],0
 45051 00007883 7407                    	jz	short BadPack

 45063 00007891 5D                      	pop	bp
