 45066                                  
 45067                                  ; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 45068                                  
 45069                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 45070                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45071                                  ;
 45072                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 45073                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 45074                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 45075                                  ;       exactly.
 45076                                  ;
 45077                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 45078                                  ;       matches splice.
 45079                                  ;
 45080                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 45081                                  ;
 45082                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 45083                                  ;
 45084                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 45085                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 45086                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 45087                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 45088                                  ;
 45089                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 45090                                  ;
 45091                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 45092                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 45093                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 45094                                  ;
 45095                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 45096                                  ;
 45097                                  ;       if fSharing then
 45098                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45099                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45100                                  ;           splice
 45101                                  ;           fatRead
 45102                                  ;           return
 45103                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 45104                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 45105                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45106                                  ;           return
 45107                                  ;       if device then
 45108                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45109                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45110                                  ;           return
 45111                                  ;       if file then
 45112                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 45113                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 45114                                  ;           Copy current dir
 45115                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 45116                                  ;           splice
 45117                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 45118                                  ;           if local then
 45119                                  ;               fatread
 45120                                  ;           return
 45121                                  ;
 45122                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 45123                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 45124                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 45125                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 45126                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 45127                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path
 45128                                  ;               DS - DOSDATA
 45129                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 45130                                  ;
 45131                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45132                                  
 45133                                  ; 22/05/2019
 45134                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45135                                  ; DOSCODE:AB99h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45136                                  
 45137                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45138                                  ; DOSCODE:AB39h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 45139                                  
 45140                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45141                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0BE1Dh
 45142                                  
 45143                                  TransPath:
 45144 00007893 30C0                    	XOR     AL,AL
 45145 00007895 EB02                    	JMP     SHORT SetSplice
 45146                                  TransPathSet:
 45147 00007897 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 45148                                  SetSplice:
 45149 00007899 36A2[4C03]              	MOV	[SS:NoSetDir],AL	; NoSetDir = !fExact;	;smr;SS Override
 45150 0000789D B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 45151                                  TransPathNoSet:
 45152 0000789F 36A2[7105]              	MOV	[SS:FSPLICE],AL		; fSplice = TRUE;	;smr;SS Override
 45153 000078A3 36C606[7A05]FF          	MOV	byte [ss:CMETA],-1      			;smr;SS Override
 45154 000078A9 36893E[B205]            	MOV     [SS:WFP_START],DI 				;smr;SS Override
 45155 000078AE 36C706[B605]FFFF        	MOV	word [SS:CURR_DIR_END],-1 ; crack from start	;smr;SS Override
 45156 000078B5 16                      	push	ss
 45157 000078B6 07                      	pop	es
 45158                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 45159 000078B7 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; end of buffer
 45160                                  ;
 45161                                  ; if this is through the server dos call, fsharing is set. We set up a
 45162                                  ; dummy cds and let the operation go.
 45163                                  ;
 45164                                  	;TEST	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; if no sharing		;smr;SS Override
 45165                                  	;JZ	short CheckUNC		; skip to UNC check
 45166                                  	; 13/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45167                                  	;;;
 45168 000078BB 36803E[7205]00          	cmp	byte [ss:FSHARING],0
 45169 000078C1 7435                    	jz	short CheckUNC
 45170                                  	;;;
 45171                                  ;
 45172                                  ; ES:DI point to buffer
 45173                                  ;
 45174 000078C3 E8F802                  	CALL	DriveFromText           ; get drive and advance DS:SI
 45175 000078C6 E8F9FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; Set ThisCDS and convert to 0-based
 45176 000078C9 722A                    	jc	short NoPath
 45177 000078CB E80603                  	CALL	TextFromDrive		; drop in new
 45178 000078CE 8D5D01                  	LEA	BX,[DI+1]               ; backup limit
 45179 000078D1 E83401                  	CALL	Canonicalize            ; copy and canonicalize
 45180 000078D4 72BC                    	jc	short TransPath_retn	; errors
 45181                                  ;
 45182                                  ; Perform splices for net guys.
 45183                                  ;
 45184 000078D6 16                      	push	ss
 45185 000078D7 1F                      	pop	ds
 45186 000078D8 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START] 		; point to name
 45187 000078DC F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 45188 000078E1 7403                    	JZ	short NoServerSplice
 45189 000078E3 E82D02                  	CALL    Splice
 45190                                  NoServerSplice:
 45191 000078E6 16                      	push	ss
 45192 000078E7 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; for FATREAD
 45193 000078E8 C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; for fatread
 45194 000078EC E8A99F                  	call	ECritDisk
 45195 000078EF E8BFE8                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 45196 000078F2 E8D09F                  	call	LCritDisk
 45197                                  NoPath:
 45198                                  	;mov	al,3
 45199 000078F5 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45200 000078F7 C3                      	retn				; any errors are in Carry flag
 45201                                  
 45202                                  ; Let the network decide if the name is for a spooled device. It will map
 45203                                  ; the name if so.
 45204                                  
 45205                                  CheckUNC:
 45206 000078F8 36C706[A205]FFFF        	MOV     WORD [SS:THISCDS],-1	; NULL thisCDS		;smr;SS Override
 45207                                  	;CallInstall NetSpoolCheck,MultNET,35
 45208 000078FF B82311                  	mov	ax,1123h
 45209 00007902 CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - QUALIFY REMOTE FILENAME
 45210                                  			; DS:SI -> ASCIZ filename to canonicalize
 45211                                  			; ES:DI -> 128-byte buffer for qualified name
 45212                                  			; Return: CF set if not resolved
 45213 00007904 7329                    	JNC	short UNCDone
 45214                                  
 45215                                  ; At this point the name is either a UNC-style name (prefixed with two leading
 45216                                  ; \\s) or is a local file/device. Remember that if a net-spooled device was
 45217                                  ; input, then the name has been changed to the remote spooler by the above net
 45218                                  ; call. Also, there may be a drive in front of the \\.
 45219                                  
 45220                                  NO_CHECK:
 45221 00007906 E8B502                  	CALL    DriveFromText		; eat drive letter
 45222 00007909 50                      	PUSH    AX                      ; save it
 45223 0000790A 8B04                    	MOV     AX,[SI]			; get first two bytes of path
 45224 0000790C E831E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 45225 0000790F 86C4                    	XCHG    AH,AL                   ; swap for second byte
 45226 00007911 E82CE1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 45227 00007914 751F                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; not a path char
 45228 00007916 38C4                    	CMP     AH,AL                   ; are they same?
 45229 00007918 751B                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; nope
 45230                                  
 45231                                  ; We have a UNC request. We must copy the string up to the beginning of the
 45232                                  ; local machine root path
 45233                                  
 45234 0000791A 58                      	POP     AX
 45235 0000791B A5                      	MOVSW                           ; get the lead \\.
 45236                                  UNCCpy:
 45237 0000791C AC                      	LODSB                           ; get a byte
 45238 0000791D E8CDE0                   	call	UCase                   ;AN000;; convert the char
 45239 00007920 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 45240 00007922 740E                    	JZ	short UNCTerm		; end of string. All done.
 45241 00007924 E819E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char?
 45242 00007927 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; backup position
 45243 00007929 AA                      	STOSB
 45244 0000792A 75F0                    	JNZ	short UNCCpy		; no, go copy
 45245 0000792C E8D900                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham (and set cMeta)
 45246                                  UNCDone:
 45247 0000792F 16                      	push	ss
 45248 00007930 1F                      	pop	ds
 45249 00007931 C3                       	retn				; return error code
 45250                                  UNCTerm:
 45251 00007932 AA                      	STOSB                           ;AN000;
 45252 00007933 EBFA                    	JMP	short UNCDone		;AN000;
 45253                                  
 45254                                  CheckDevice:
 45255                                  
 45256                                  ; Check DS:SI for device. First eat any path stuff
 45257                                  
 45258 00007935 58                      	POP     AX                      ; retrieve drive info
 45259 00007936 803C00                  	CMP     BYTE [SI],0		; check for null file
 45260 00007939 7504                    	JNZ	short CheckPath
 45261                                  	;mov	al,2 
 45262 0000793B B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; bad file error
 45263 0000793D F9                      	STC                             ; signal error on null input
 45264 0000793E C3                      	RETN				; bye!
 45265                                  CheckPath:
 45266 0000793F 50                      	push	ax
 45267 00007940 55                      	push	bp			; save drive number
 45268                                  
 45269                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45270                                  %if 0
 45271                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 45272                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 45273                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 45274                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 45275                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 45276                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 45277                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 45278                                  ;;;
 45279                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 45280                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 45281                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 45282                                  ;;;
 45283                                  ;;;More info:
 45284                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 45285                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.
 45286                                  ;;;
 45287                                  	call	no5Dshere
 45288                                  start5Dhack:
 45289                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice
 45290                                  backfrom5Dhack:
 45291                                  
 45292                                  %endif
 45293                                  
 45294                                  ; 13/03/2024
 45295                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:BECBh
 45296                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:AC47h)
 45297                                  ; ((Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:A6C2h))
 45298                                  %if 0
 45299                                  	call	no5Dshere
 45300                                  %else
 45301                                  ; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 45302                                  
 45303                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45304                                  	; Note: 'call no5Dshere' is not required for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 45305 00007941 E8C0D3                  	call    CheckThisDevice	; E8h,6Fh,0D6h
 45306                                  %endif
 45307 00007944 5D                      	pop	bp
 45308 00007945 58                      	pop	ax			; get drive letter back
 45309 00007946 731C                    	JNC	short DoFile		; yes we have a file.
 45310                                  
 45311                                  ; We have a device. AX has drive letter. At this point we may fake a CDS ala
 45312                                  ; sharing DOS call. We know by getting here that we are NOT in a sharing DOS
 45313                                  ; call.
 45314                                  
 45315 00007948 36C606[7205]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; simulate sharing dos call;smr;SS Override
 45316 0000794E E871FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; set ThisCDS and init DUMMYCDS
 45317 00007951 36C606[7205]00          	MOV     byte [SS:FSHARING],0	;                       ;smr;SS Override
 45318                                  
 45319                                  ; Now that we have noted that we have a device, we put it into a form that
 45320                                  ; getpath can understand. Normally getpath requires d:\ to begin the input
 45321                                  ; string. We relax this to state that if the d:\ is present then the path
 45322                                  ; may be a file. If D:/ (note the forward slash) is present then we have
 45323                                  ; a device.
 45324                                  
 45325 00007957 E87A02                  	CALL    TextFromDrive
 45326 0000795A B02F                    	MOV     AL,'/'                  ; path sep.
 45327 0000795C AA                      	STOSB
 45328 0000795D E8429E                  	call	StrCpy			; move remainder of string
 45329                                  
 45330 00007960 F8                      	CLC                             ; everything OK.
 45331 00007961 16                      	push	ss
 45332 00007962 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; remainder of OK stuff
 45333                                  DoFile_retn:
 45334 00007963 C3                      	retn
 45335                                  
 45336                                  ; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 45337                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:BEEEh
 45338                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:AC6Ah)
 45339                                  ; ((Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:A6F2h))
 45340                                  ;%if 1
 45341                                  
 45342                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45343                                  %if 0
 45344                                  
 45345                                  no5Dshere:
 45346                                  	; 10/08/2018
 45347                                  	jmp	CheckThisDevice		; snoop for device
 45348                                  %endif
 45349                                  
 45350                                  ;.erre (no5Dshere - start5Dhack - 5D)
 45351                                  
 45352                                  ; We have a file. Get the raw CDS.
 45353                                  
 45354                                  DoFile:
 45355                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 45356                                  
 45357 00007964 E83FFE                  	call	GetVisDrv               ; get proper CDS
 45358                                  	;mov	al,3 
 45359 00007967 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad file error
 45360 00007969 72F8                    	jc	short DoFile_retn  ; CARRY set -> bogus drive/spliced
 45361                                  
 45362                                  ; ThisCDS has correct CDS. DS:SI advanced to point to beginning of path/file.
 45363                                  ; Make sure that CDS has valid directory; ValidateCDS requires a temp buffer
 45364                                  ; Use the one that we are going to use (ES:DI).
 45365                                  
 45366                                  	;SAVE    <DS,SI,ES,DI>		; save all string pointers.
 45367 0000796B 1E                      	push	ds
 45368 0000796C 56                      	push	si
 45369 0000796D 06                      	push	es
 45370 0000796E 57                      	push	di
 45371 0000796F E8C5D2                  	call	ValidateCDS             ; poke CDS and make everything OK
 45372                                  	;RESTORE <DI,ES,SI,DS>		; get back pointers
 45373 00007972 5F                      	pop	di
 45374 00007973 07                      	pop	es
 45375 00007974 5E                      	pop	si
 45376 00007975 1F                      	pop	ds
 45377                                  	;mov	al,3
 45378 00007976 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45379                                  	;retc				; someone failed an operation
 45380 00007978 72E9                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 45381                                  
 45382                                  ; ThisCDS points to correct CDS. It contains the correct text of the
 45383                                  ; current directory. Copy it in.
 45384                                  
 45385 0000797A 1E                      	push	ds
 45386 0000797B 56                      	push	si
 45387 0000797C 36C536[A205]            	LDS     SI,[SS:THISCDS]		; point to CDS	;smr;SS Override
 45388 00007981 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; point to destination
 45389                                  	;add	bx,[si+79] ; MSDOS 6.0
 45390 00007983 035C4F                  	ADD     BX,[SI+curdir.end]	; point to backup limit
 45391                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 45392 00007986 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; regenerate end of buffer
 45393                                  					;AN000;
 45394 0000798A E8249E                  	call	FStrCpy                 ; copy string. ES:DI point to end
 45395 0000798D 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to NUL byte
 45396                                  
 45397                                  ; Make sure that there is a path char at end.
 45398                                  
 45399 0000798E B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'
 45400 00007990 263845FF                	CMP     [ES:DI-1],AL
 45401 00007994 7401                    	JZ	short GetOrig
 45402 00007996 AA                      	STOSB
 45403                                  
 45404                                  ; Now get original string.
 45405                                  
 45406                                  GetOrig:
 45407 00007997 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to path char
 45408 00007998 5E                      	pop	si
 45409 00007999 1F                      	pop	ds
 45410                                  
 45411                                  ; BX points to the end of the root part of the CDS (at where a path char
 45412                                  ; should be). Now, we decide whether we use this root or extend it with the
 45413                                  ; current directory. See if the input string begins with a leading 
 45415 0000799A E8CE00                  	CALL    PathSep                 ; is DS:SI a path sep?
 45416 0000799D 7511                    	JNZ	short PathAssure	; no, DI is correct. Assure a path char
 45417 0000799F 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL                   ; end of string?
 45418 000079A1 7410                    	JZ	short DoCanon		; yes, skip.
 45419                                  ;
 45420                                  ; The string does begin with a \. Reset the beginning of the canonicalization
 45421                                  ; to this root. Make sure that there is a path char there and advance the
 45422                                  ; source string over all leading \'s.
 45423                                  ;
 45424 000079A3 89DF                    	MOV     DI,BX                   ; back up to root point.
 45425                                  SkipPath:
 45426 000079A5 AC                      	LODSB
 45427 000079A6 E897E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 45428 000079A9 74FA                    	JZ	short SkipPath
 45429 000079AB 4E                      	DEC     SI
 45430 000079AC 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 45431 000079AE 7403                    	JZ	short DoCanon
 45432                                  
 45433                                  ; DS:SI start at some file name. ES:DI points at some path char. Drop one in
 45434                                  ; for yucks.
 45435                                  
 45436                                  PathAssure:
 45437 000079B0 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 45438 000079B2 AA                      	STOSB
 45439                                  
 45440                                  ; ES:DI point to the correct spot for canonicalization to begin.
 45441                                  ; BP is the max extent to advance DI
 45442                                  ; BX is the backup limit for ..
 45443                                  
 45444                                  DoCanon:
 45445 000079B3 E85200                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham.
 45446                                  	;retc				; badly formatted path.
 45447 000079B6 72AB                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 45448                                  
 45449                                  ; The string has been moved to ES:DI. Reset world to DOS context, pointers
 45450                                  ; to wfp_start and do string substitution. BP is still the max position in
 45451                                  ; buffer.
 45452                                  
 45453 000079B8 16                      	push	ss
 45454 000079B9 1F                      	pop	ds
 45455 000079BA 8B3E[B205]              	MOV     DI,[WFP_START]		; DS:SI point to string
 45456 000079BE C536[A205]              	LDS     SI,[THISCDS]		; point to CDS
 45457 000079C2 E81702                  	CALL    PathPref                ; is there a prefix?
 45458 000079C5 7514                    	JNZ	short DoSplice		; no, do splice
 45459                                  
 45460                                  ; We have a match. Check to see if we ended in a path char.
 45461                                  
 45462 000079C7 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]		; last char to match
 45463 000079CA E873E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; did we end on a path char? (root)
 45464 000079CD 740C                    	JZ	short DoSplice		; yes, no current dir here.
 45465                                  Pathline:                               ; 2/13/KK
 45466 000079CF 26803D00                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],0		; end at NUL?
 45467 000079D3 7406                    	JZ	short DoSplice
 45468 000079D5 47                      	INC     DI                      ; point to after current path char
 45469 000079D6 36893E[B605]            	MOV     [SS:CURR_DIR_END],DI	; point to correct spot ;smr;SS Override
 45470                                  
 45471                                  ; Splice the result.
 45472                                  
 45473                                  DoSplice:
 45474 000079DB 16                      	push	ss
 45475 000079DC 1F                      	pop	ds			; back to DOSDATA
 45476 000079DD 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START]		; point to beginning of string
 45477 000079E1 31C9                    	XOR     CX,CX
 45478 000079E3 F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 45479 000079E8 7403                    	JZ	short SkipSplice
 45480 000079EA E82601                  	CALL    Splice                  ; replaces in place.
 45481                                  SkipSplice:
 45482                                  
 45483                                  ; The final thing is to assure ourselves that a FATREAD is done on the local
 45484                                  ; device.
 45485                                  
 45486 000079ED 16                      	push	ss
 45487 000079EE 1F                      	pop	ds
 45488 000079EF C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; point to correct drive
 45489                                  	;test	word [es:di+67],8000h
 45490                                  	; 17/12/2022
 45491                                  	;test	byte [es:di+68],80h

 45506                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 45507                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45508                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 45509                                  ;
 45510                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 45511                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 45512                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 45513                                  ;               BP - end of buffer
 45514                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 45515                                  ;                   syntax, etc.
 45516                                  ;               Carry Clear -
 45517                                  ;                   DS:DI - advanced to end of string
 45518                                  ;                   ES:DI - advanced to end of canonicalized form after nul
 45519                                  ;   Registers modified: AX CX DX (in addition to those above)
 45520                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45521                                  
 45522                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45523

 45527

 45541                                  ; component (no leading path separators) and ES:DI being the destination
 45542                                  ; buffer.

 45547                                  ; a potential drive specifier is correctly terminated with a path sep char.
 45548                                  ; Otherwise, do nothing

 45800                                  ;Break <Splice - pseudo mount by string substitution>
 45801                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45802                                  ;   Splice - take a string and substitute a prefix if one exists. Change
 45803                                  ;       ThisCDS to point to physical drive CDS.
 45804                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to string
 45805                                  ;               NoSetDir = TRUE => exact matches with splice fail
 45806                                  ;   Outputs:    DS:SI points to thisCDS
 45807                                  ;               ES:DI points to DPB
 45808                                  ;               String at DS:SI may be reduced in length by removing prefix
 45809                                  ;               and substituting drive letter.
 45810                                  ;               CX = 0 If no splice done
 45811                                  ;               CX <> 0 otherwise

 45813                                  ;                   left alone

 45897                                  ;Break <$NameTrans - partially process a name>
 45898                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45899                                  ;   $NameTrans - allow users to see what names get mapped to. This call
 45900                                  ;   performs only string substitution and canonicalization, not splicing.  Due
 45901                                  ;   to Transpath playing games with devices, we need to insure that the output
 45902                                  ;   has drive letter and : in it.
 45903                                  ;
 45904                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source string for translation
 45905                                  ;               ES:DI - pointer to buffer
 45906                                  ;   Outputs:
 45907                                  ;       Carry Clear
 45908                                  ;               Buffer at ES:DI is filled in with data
 45909                                  ;               ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string in buffer
 45910                                  ;       Carry Set
 45911                                  ;               AX = error_path_not_found
 45912                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 45913                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45914                                  
 45915                                  _$NameTrans:
 45916 00007B99 1E                      	push	ds
 45917 00007B9A 56                      	push	si

 45920 00007B9D 51                      	push	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 45921                                  	
 45922                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 45923                                  ; M027 - Start
 45924                                  ;
 45925                                  ; Sattrib must be set up with default values here. Otherwise, the value from
 45926                                  ; a previous DOS call is used for attrib and DevName thinks it is not a 
 45927                                  ; device if the old call set the volume attribute bit. Note that devname in
 45928                                  ; dir2.asm gets ultimately called by Transpath. See also M026. Also save
 45929                                  ; and restore CX.
 45930                                  
 45931                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 45932 00007B9E B516                    	mov     ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 45933 00007BA0 E8EE02                  	call	SetAttrib
 45934

 45936                                  
 45937                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 45938 00007BA3 BF[BE03]                	MOV     DI,OPENBUF
 45939 00007BA6 E8EAFC                  	CALL    TransPath               ; to translation (everything)
 45940 00007BA9 59                      	pop	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 45941 00007BAA 5F                      	pop     di
 45942 00007BAB 07                      	pop	es

 45944 00007BAD 1F                      	pop     ds

 45947                                  TransOK:

 45950 00007BB7 1F                      	pop	ds

 45955                                  ;Break   <DriveFromText - return drive number from a text string>
 45956                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45957                                  ;   DriveFromText - examine DS:SI and remove a drive letter, advancing the
 45958                                  ;   pointer.
 45959                                  ;
 45960                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to a text string
 45961                                  ;   Outputs:    AL has drive number
 45962                                  ;               DS:SI advanced
 45963                                  ;   Registers modified: AX,SI.
 45964                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 45973 00007BC8 75CE                    	jnz	short Splice_retn

 45984                                  ;Break   <TextFromDrive - convert a drive number to a text string>
 45985                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45986                                  ;   TextFromDrive - turn AL into a drive letter: and put it at es:di with
 45987                                  ;   trailing :. TextFromDrive1 takes a 1-based number.
 45988                                  ;
 45989                                  ;   Inputs:     AL has 0-based drive number
 45990                                  ;   Outputs:    ES:DI advanced

 46000 00007BDA AB                      	STOSW
 46001                                  PathPref_retn:

 46004                                  ;Break   <PathPref - see if one path is a prefix of another>
 46005                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46006                                  ;   PathPref - compare DS:SI with ES:DI to see if one is the prefix of the
 46007                                  ;   other.  Remember that only at a pathchar break are we allowed to have a
 46008                                  ;   prefix: A:\ and A:\FOO
 46009                                  ;
 46010                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI potential prefix
 46011                                  ;               ES:DI string
 46012                                  ;   Outputs:    Zero set => prefix found
 46013                                  ;                   DI/SI advanced past matching part
 46014                                  ;               Zero reset => no prefix, DS/SI garbage
 46015                                  ;   Registers modified: CX
 46016                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46017                                  
 46018                                  PathPref:

 46020 00007BDF 49                      	DEC     CX                      ; do not include nul byte
 46021 00007BE0 F3A6                    	REPZ    CMPSB                   ; compare
 46022 00007BE2 75F7                    	jnz	short PathPref_retn	; if NZ then return NZ
 46023 00007BE4 50                      	push	ax			; save char register
 46024 00007BE5 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]               ; get last byte to match
 46025 00007BE8 E855DE                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char (Root!)
 46026 00007BEB 7406                    	JZ	short Prefix		; yes, match root (I hope)
 46027                                  NotSep:                                 ; 2/13/KK
 46028 00007BED 268A05                  	MOV     AL,[ES:DI]		; get next char to match
 46029 00007BF0 E87AFE                  	CALL    PathSepGotCh            ; was it a pathchar?
 46030                                  Prefix:
 46031 00007BF3 58                      	pop	ax			; get back original
 46032 00007BF4 C3                      	retn

 46034                                  ;Break   <ScanPathChar - see if there is a path character in a string>
 46035                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46036                                  ;     ScanPathChar - search through the string (pointed to by DS:SI) for
 46037                                  ;     a path separator.
 46038                                  ;
 46039                                  ;     Input:    DS:SI target string (null terminated)
 46040                                  ;     Output:   Zero set => path separator encountered in string
 46041                                  ;               Zero clear => null encountered

 46067                                  ; MSDOS 2.11
 46068                                  ;BREAK <$Open - open a file handle>
 46069                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46070                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 46071                                  ;           LDS     DX, Name
 46072                                  ;           MOV     AH, Open
 46073                                  ;           MOV     AL, access
 46074                                  ;           INT     int_command
 46075                                  ;
 46076                                  ;       ACCESS          Function
 46077                                  ;       ------          --------
 46078                                  ;       open_for_read   file is opened for reading
 46079                                  ;       open_for_write  file is opened for writing
 46080                                  ;       open_for_both   file is opened for both reading and writing.
 46081                                  ;
 46082                                  ;   Error returns:
 46083                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_access
 46084                                  ;              = error_file_not_found
 46085                                  ;              = error_access_denied
 46086                                  ;              = error_too_many_open_files
 46087                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46088                                  
 46089                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 46090                                  ;	BREAK <$Open - open a file from a path string>
 46091                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46092                                  ;
 46093                                  ;**	$OPen - Open a File
 46094                                  ;
 46095                                  ;	given a path name in DS:DX and an open mode in AL, $Open opens the
 46096                                  ;	file and and returns a handle
 46097                                  ;
 46098                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = pointer to asciz name
 46099                                  ;		(AL) = open mode
 46100                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 46101                                  ;		  (ax) = file handle
 46102                                  ;		'C' set if error
 46103                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 46104                                  ;	USES	all
 46105                                  ;
 46106                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46107                                  
 46108                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 46109                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46110                                  
 46111                                  ; 14/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46112                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C194h
 46113                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0AF10h)
 46114                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0A9A7h)

 46116                                  _$OPEN:

 46128                                  ;*	General file open/create code. The $CREATE call and the various
 46129                                  ;	$OPEN calls all come here.
 46130                                  ;
 46131                                  ;	We'll share a lot of the standard stuff of allocating SFTs, cracking
 46132                                  ;	path names, etc., and then dispatch to our individual handlers.
 46133                                  ;	WARNING - this info and list is just a guess, not definitive - jgl
 46134                                  ;
 46135                                  ;	(TOS) = create mode
 46136                                  ;	(CX) = address of routine to call to do actual function
 46137                                  ;	(DS:DX) = ASCIZ name
 46138                                  ;	SAttrib = Attribute mask
 46139

 46152 00007C1E 368C06[A005]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT+2],ES	; save the SF segment	;smr;SS Override
 46153                                  
 46154                                  ;	Find a free area in the user's JFN table.
 46155                                  
 46156 00007C23 E822F7                  	call	JFNFree			; get a free jfn
 46157                                  	;jnc	short SaveJFN

 46163

 46166 00007C2D 368C06[B005]            	MOV	[ss:PJFN+2],ES		; save the jfn segment	;smr;SS Override
 46167 00007C32 36891E[AC05]            	MOV	[ss:JFN],BX		; save the jfn itself	;smr;SS Override
 46168                                  
 46169                                  ;	We have been given an JFN. We lock it down to prevent other tasks from
 46170                                  ;	reusing the same JFN.
 46171                                  
 46172 00007C37 368B1E[AA05]            	MOV	BX,[ss:SFN]					;smr;SS Override

 46226                                  	;MOV	word [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],0

 46229                                  ;**	Check if this is an extended open. If so you must set the
 46230                                  ;	modes in sf_mode. Call Set_EXT_mode to do all this. See
 46231                                  ;	Set_EXT_mode in creat.asm

 46354                                  ;
 46355                                  ;**	$Creat - Create a File
 46356                                  ;
 46357                                  ;	$Creat creates the directory entry specified in DS:DX and gives it the
 46358                                  ;	initial attributes contained in CX
 46359                                  ;
 46360                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = ASCIZ path name
 46361                                  ;		(CX) = initial attributes

 46363                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 46364                                  ;		'C' clear if OK

 46397                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46398                                  
 46399                                  	; 14/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46400                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C27Ch

 46402                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0AAB2h)
 46403                                  
 46404                                  _$CHMOD:
 46405                                  	; 14/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46406                                  	;;;

 46525                                  ;
 46526                                  ;**	$UNLINK - Delete a File
 46527                                  ;
 46528                                  ;
 46529                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 46530                                  ;	    LDS     DX, name
 46531                                  ;	    IF VIA SERVER DOS CALL

 46533                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Unlink
 46534                                  ;	    INT     21h
 46535                                  ;
 46536                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds:dx) = path name
 46537                                  ;		(cx) = search_attribute, if via server_dos
 46538                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 46539                                  ;		'C' set if error
 46540                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 46541                                  ;			= error_file_not_found
 46542                                  ;			= error_access_denied
 46543                                  ;
 46544                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46545                                  
 46546                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46547                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C2E4h

 46551 00007D49 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; Point at input string
 46552 00007D4B BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; temp spot for path
 46553 00007D4E E846FB                  	call	TransPathSet		; go get normalized path

 46556 00007D54 36803E[7A05]FF          	CMP	byte [ss:CMETA],-1	; meta chars?	;smr;SS Override
 46557 00007D5A 750E                    	JNZ	short NotFound

 46562 00007D60 E82E01                  	call	SetAttrib

 46564                                  	;JC	short UnlinkE 		; error is there
 46565                                  	; 17/12/2022

 46567

 46711                                  ;Break <$CreateNewFile - Create a new directory entry>
 46712                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46713                                  ;   CreateNew - Create a new directory entry. Return a file handle if there
 46714                                  ;	was no previous directory entry, and fail if a directory entry with
 46715                                  ;	the same name existed previously.
 46716                                  ;

 46718                                  ;		CX contains default file attributes

 46720                                  ;		    AX has file handle opened for read/write
 46721                                  ;		Carry Set:

 46723                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 46724                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46725

 46731                                  ;**	BinToAscii - convert a number to a string.
 46732                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46733                                  ;	BinToAscii converts a 16 bit number into a 4 ascii characters.
 46734                                  ;	This routine is used to generate temp file names so we don't spend
 46735                                  ;	the time and code needed for a true hex number, we just use
 46736                                  ;	A thorugh O.
 46737                                  ;
 46738                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = value
 46739                                  ;		(es:di) = destination
 46740                                  ;	EXIT	(es:di) updated by 4
 46741                                  ;	USES	cx, di, flags
 46742                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46743                                  
 46744                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 46745                                  ;BinToAscii:
 46746                                  ;	mov     cx,4
 46747                                  ;bta5:
 46748                                  ;	push    cx
 46749                                  ;	mov     cl,4
 46750                                  ;	rol     ax,cl
 46751                                  ;	push    ax
 46752                                  ;	and     al,0Fh
 46753                                  ;	add     al,'0'
 46754                                  ;	cmp     al,'9'
 46755                                  ;	jbe     short bta6
 46756                                  ;	add     al,7
 46757                                  ;bta6: 
 46758                                  ;	stosb
 46759                                  ;	pop     ax
 46760                                  ;	pop     cx
 46761                                  ;	loop    bta5
 46762                                  ;	retn
 46763                                  
 46764                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46765                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 & Windows ME
 46766                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0B0D9h)
 46767                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0ABA4h)
 46768                                  %if 0
 46769                                  
 46770                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 46771                                  BinToAscii:
 46772                                  	mov	cx,404h			; (ch) = digit counter, (cl) = shift cnt
 46773                                  bta5:	
 46774                                  	ROL	AX,CL			; move leftmost nibble into rightmost
 46775                                  	push	ax			; preserve remainder of digits
 46776                                  	AND	AL,0Fh			; grab low nibble
 46777                                  	ADD	AL,'A'			; turn into ascii
 46778                                  	STOSB				; drop in the character
 46779                                  	pop	ax			; (ax) = shifted number
 46780                                  	dec	ch
 46781                                  	jnz	short bta5		; process 4 digits
 46782                                  	retn
 46783                                  %else
 46784                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46785                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C385h
 46786                                  
 46787                                  BinToAscii:
 46788 00007DE9 50                      	push	ax		; convert a number to a string ; ax = value
 46789 00007DEA 86C4                    	xchg	ah,al
 46790                                  	;db	0D4h,10h
 46791 00007DEC D410                    	aam	10h		; AH = AL / 16 and AL = remainder
 46792 00007DEE 054141                  	add	ax,4141h	; 'AA'
 46793 00007DF1 AB                      	stosw
 46794 00007DF2 58                      	pop	ax
 46795                                  	;db	0D4h,10h
 46796 00007DF3 D410                    	aam	10h
 46797 00007DF5 054141                  	add	ax,4141h	; add ax,'AA'
 46798 00007DF8 AB                      	stosw
 46799 00007DF9 C3                      	retn	
 46800                                  %endif
 46801                                  
 46802                                  ;Break	<$CreateTempFile - create a unique name>
 46803                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46804                                  ;   $CreateTemp - given a directory, create a unique name in that directory.
 46805                                  ;	Method used is to get the current time, convert to a name and attempt
 46806                                  ;	a create new. Repeat until create new succeeds.
 46807                                  ;
 46808                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a null terminated directory name.
 46809                                  ;		CX  contains default attributes
 46810                                  ;   Outputs:	Unique name is appended to DS:DX directory.
 46811                                  ;		AX has handle
 46812                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 46813                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46814                                  
 46815                                  	; 10/07/2024
 46816                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46817                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46818                                  
 46819                                  _$CreateTempFile:
 46820                                  	;Enter
 46821 00007DFA 55                      	push	bp
 46822 00007DFB 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 46823                                  
 46824                                  	;LocalVar  EndPtr,DWORD
 46825                                  	;LocalVar  FilPtr,DWORD
 46826                                  	;LocalVar  Attr,WORD
 46827                                  
 46828 00007DFD 83EC0A                  	sub	sp,10
 46829                                  
 46830                                  	;test	cx,0FFD8h
 46831 00007E00 F7C1D8FF                	test	CX,~attr_changeable
 46832 00007E04 7405                    	JZ	short OKatts		; Ok if no non-changeable bits set
 46833                                  
 46834                                  ; We need this "hook" here to detect these cases (like user sets one both of
 46835                                  ; vol_id and dir bits) because of the structure of the or $CreateNewFile loop
 46836                                  ; below. The code loops on error_access_denied, but if one of the non
 46837                                  ; changeable attributes is specified, the loop COULD be infinite or WILL be
 46838                                  ; infinite because CreateNewFile will fail with access_denied always. Thus we
 46839                                  ; need to detect these cases before getting to the loop.
 46840                                  
 46841                                  	;mov	ax, 5
 46842 00007E06 B80500                  	MOV	AX,error_access_denied
 46843 00007E09 EB7A                    	JMP	SHORT SETTMPERR
 46844                                  
 46845                                  OKatts:
 46846                                  	;MOV	attr,CX 		; save attribute
 46847 00007E0B 894EF6                  	mov     [bp-10],cx
 46848                                  	;MOV	FilPtrL,DX		; pointer to file
 46849 00007E0E 8956F8                  	mov	[bp-8],dx
 46850                                  	;MOV	FilPtrH,DS
 46851 00007E11 8C5EFA                  	mov	[bp-6],ds
 46852                                  	;MOV	EndPtrH,DS		; seg pointer to end of dir
 46853 00007E14 8C5EFE                  	mov	[bp-2],ds
 46854 00007E17 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 46855 00007E18 07                      	POP	ES			; destination for nul search
 46856 00007E19 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX
 46857 00007E1B 89F9                    	MOV	CX,DI
 46858 00007E1D F7D9                    	NEG	CX			; number of bytes remaining in segment
 46859                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46860 00007E1F 09C9                    	OR	CX,CX			;AN000;MS. cx=0 ? ds:dx on segment boundary
 46861 00007E21 7501                    	JNZ	short okok		;AN000;MS. no
 46862                                  	;MOV	CX,-1			;AN000;MS.
 46863                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46864                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46865 00007E23 49                      	dec	cx  ; mov cx,-1
 46866                                  	;mov	cx,-1 ; 0FFFh
 46867                                  okok:					;AN000;
 46868 00007E24 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			;AN000;
 46869 00007E26 F2AE                    	REPNZ	SCASB			;AN000;
 46870                                  					;AN000;

 46886                                  CreateLoop:

 46888 00007E39 1F                      	pop	ds
 46889 00007E3A 55                      	push	bp
 46890 00007E3B E83D8D                  	call	READTIME		; go get time
 46891 00007E3E 5D                      	pop	bp
 46892                                  ;
 46893                                  ; Time is in CX:DX. Go drop it into the string.
 46894                                  ;
 46895                                  	;les	di,EndPtr		; point to the string
 46896 00007E3F C47EFC                  	les	di,[BP-4]

 46909 00007E59 5D                      	pop	bp

 46911                                  
 46912                                  ; The operation failed and the error has been mapped in AX. Grab the extended
 46913                                  ; error and figure out what to do.
 46914                                  
 46915                                  	;; MSDOS 3.3			; M049 - start
 46916                                  ;;	mov	ax,[ss:EXTERR]				;smr;SS Override
 46917                                  ;;	cmp	al,error_file_exists
 46918                                  ;;	jz	short CreateLoop	; file existed => try with new name
 46919                                  ;;	cmp	al,error_access_denied
 46920                                  ;;	jz	short CreateLoop	; access denied (attr mismatch)
 46921                                  
 46922                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46923                                  	;cmp	al,50h
 46924 00007E5C 3C50                    	CMP	AL,error_file_exists	; Q: did file already exist

 46928 00007E62 7521                    	JNZ	short SETTMPERR		; N: Error out
 46929                                  					; Y: Check to see if we got this due
 46930                                  					;    to the network drive. Note that
 46931                                  					;    the redir will set the exterr
 46932                                  					;    to error_cannot_make if this is 
 46933                                  					;    so.
 46934                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46935                                  %if 0
 46936                                  	CMP	byte [SS:EXTERR],error_net_access_denied ; M069
 46937                                  					; See if it's REALLY an att mismatch
 46938                                  	je	short SETTMPERR		; no, network error, stop
 46939                                  ;M070
 46940                                  ; If the user failed on an I24, we do not want to try again
 46941                                  ;
 46942                                  	cmp	byte [SS:EXTERR],error_FAIL_I24 ;User failed on I24? ;M070
 46943                                  	;je	short SETTMPERR		;yes, do not try again ;M070
 46944                                  
 46945                                  	;jmp	short CreateLoop	;attr mismatch, try again ;M070
 46946                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46947                                  	jne	short CreateLoop ; 10/06/2019 
 46948                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46949                                  	;jz	short SETTMPERR
 46950                                  	;jmp	short CreateLoop
 46951                                  %else
 46952                                  	; 15/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46953                                  	;;;

 46955 00007E68 3C41                    	cmp	al,41h			; error_net_access_denied
 46956 00007E6A 7419                    	je	short SETTMPERR
 46957 00007E6C 3C53                    	cmp	al,53h			; error_FAIL_I24
 46958 00007E6E 7415                    	je	short SETTMPERR

 46969                                  %endif

 46984                                  ;   SetAttrib will set the search attribute (SAttrib) either to the normal
 46985                                  ;   (CH) or to the value in CL if the current system call is through
 46986                                  ;   serverdoscall.
 46987                                  ;
 46988                                  ;   Inputs:	fSharing == FALSE => set sattrib to CH
 46989                                  ;		fSharing == TRUE => set sattrib to CL
 46990                                  ;   Outputs:	none

 47019                                  ;Break	<Extended_Open- Extended open the file>
 47020                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47021                                  ; Input: AL= 0 reserved  AH=6CH
 47022                                  ;	 BX= mode
 47023                                  ;	 CL= create attribute  CH=search attribute (from server)
 47024                                  ;	 DX= flag
 47025                                  ;	 DS:SI = file name
 47026                                  ;	 ES:DI = parm list
 47027                                  ;			   DD  SET EA list (-1) null
 47028                                  ;			   DW  n  parameters
 47029                                  ;			   DB  type (TTTTTTLL)
 47030                                  ;			   DW  IOMODE
 47031                                  ; Function: Extended Open
 47032                                  ; Output: carry clear
 47033                                  ;		     AX= handle
 47034                                  ;		     CX=1 file opened
 47035                                  ;			2 file created/opened
 47036                                  ;			3 file replaced/opened
 47037                                  ;	  carry set: AX has error code
 47038                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47039                                  
 47040                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47041                                  	; 16/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 47261                                  
 47262                                  ;BREAK <$LockOper - Lock Calls>
 47263                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47264                                  ;
 47265                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47266                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle	       (DOS 3.3)
 47267                                  ;	    MOV     CX, OffsetHigh
 47268                                  ;	    MOV     DX, OffsetLow
 47269                                  ;	    MOV     SI, LengthHigh
 47270                                  ;	    MOV     DI, LengthLow
 47271                                  ;	    MOV     AH, LockOper
 47272                                  ;	    MOV     AL, Request
 47273                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47274                                  ;
 47275                                  ;   Error returns:
 47276                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 47277                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 47278                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
 47279                                  ;
 47280                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47281                                  ;	    MOV     AX, 5C??	       (DOS 4.00)
 47282                                  ;
 47283                                  ;				    0? lock all
 47284                                  ;				    8? lock write
 47285                                  ;				    ?2 lock multiple
 47286                                  ;				    ?3 unlock multiple
 47287                                  ;				    ?4 lock/read
 47288                                  ;				    ?5 write/unlock
 47289                                  ;				    ?6 add (lseek EOF/lock/write/unlock)
 47290                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle
 47291                                  ;	    MOV     CX, count or size
 47292                                  ;	    LDS     DX, buffer
 47293                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47294                                  ;
 47295                                  ;   Error returns:
 47296                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 47297                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 47298                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
 47299                                  ;
 47300                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47301                                  
 47302                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47303                                  
 47304                                  	; 17/03/2024

 47550                                  ;	Retries are attempted with sleeps in between

 47552                                  ;    Carry clear
 47553                                  ;	Operation is OK

 47555                                  ;	A lock violation detected
 47556                                  ; Outputs of SETUP preserved

 47563                                  LockRetry:

 47565 0000801E 50                      	push	ax ; MSDOS 6.0
 47566                                  
 47567                                  	;MSDOS 3.3
 47568                                  	;Call	far [ss:JShare+(8*4)]	; 8 = chk_block
 47569                                  	;MSDOS 6.0

 47577 0000802A 4B                      	DEC	BX		; remember a retry
