 47742                                  	;mov	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0
 47743 0000809E 8916[0706]              	mov	[HIGH_SECTOR],dx ; 0
 47744                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+11h]
 47745 000080A2 268B5611                	mov	dx,[es:bp+DPB.DIR_SECTOR]
 47746 000080A6 EB0C                    	jmp     short sharev_2
 47747                                  sharev_1:
 47748                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+2Bh]
 47749 000080A8 268B562B                	mov	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FCLUS_FSECTOR+2]
 47750 000080AC 8916[0706]              	mov	[HIGH_SECTOR],dx
 47751                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+29h]
 47752 000080B0 268B5629                	mov	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FCLUS_FSECTOR]
 47753                                  sharev_2: 
 47754                                  	;;;
 47755 000080B4 E8F3DB                  	call	HARDERR
 47756                                  ; 01/07/2024
 47757                                  %if 0
 47758                                  	POP	DI
 47759                                  	POP	ES
 47760                                  	POP	DS
 47761                                  	CMP	AL,1
 47762                                  	jz	short shchk_retn	; 1 = retry, carry clear
 47763                                  	STC
 47764                                  	retn
 47765                                  %else
 47766 000080B7 EBAD                    	jmp	short sharev_3
 47767                                  %endif
 47768                                  
 47769                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47770                                  ;   ShareEnd - terminate sharing info on a particular SFT/UID/PID. This does
 47771                                  ;       NOT perform a close, it merely asserts that the sharing information
 47772                                  ;       for the SFT/UID/PID may be safely released.
 47773                                  ;
 47774                                  ;   Inputs:     ES:DI points to an SFT
 47775                                  ;   Outputs:    None
 47776                                  ;   Registers modified: all except DS,ES,DI
 47777                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47778                                  
 47779                                  ShareEnd:
 47780                                  	; 26/07/2019
 47781 000080B9 FF1E[9800]              	call	far [JShare+(2*4)]	; 2 = MFTClose
 47782 000080BD C3                      	retn
 47783                                  
 47784                                  ;Break <ShareEnter - attempt to enter a node into the sharing set>
 47785                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47786                                  ;   ShareEnter - perform a retried entry of a nodde into the sharing set. If
 47787                                  ;   the max number of retries is exceeded, we notify the user via int 24.
 47788                                  ;
 47789                                  ;   Inputs:     ThisSFT points to the SFT
 47790                                  ;               WFP_Start points to the WFP
 47791                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry clear => successful entry
 47792                                  ;               Carry set => failed system call
 47793                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 47794                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47795                                  
 47796                                  ShareEnter:
 47797 000080BE 51                      	push	cx
 47798                                  retry:
 47799 000080BF 8B0E[1A00]              	mov     cx,[RetryCount]
 47800                                  attempt:
 47801 000080C3 C43E[9E05]              	les     di,[THISSFT]		; grab sft
 47802 000080C7 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 47803                                   	;mov	[es:di+51],ax
 47804 000080C9 26894533                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],AX ; indicate free SFT
 47805 000080CD 51                      	push	cx
 47806 000080CE E8ABFF                  	call    SHARE_CHECK             ; attempt to enter into the sharing set
 47807 000080D1 59                      	pop	cx
 47808 000080D2 730A                    	jnc	short done		; success, let the user see this
 47809 000080D4 E8FE96                  	call	Idle                    ; wait a while
 47810 000080D7 E2EA                    	loop    attempt                 ; go back for another attempt
 47811 000080D9 E8A5FF                  	call    SHARE_VIOLATION         ; signal the problem to the user
 47812 000080DC 73E1                    	jnc	short retry		; user said to retry, go do it
 47813                                  done:
 47814 000080DE 59                      	pop	cx
 47815 000080DF C3                      	retn
 47816                                  
 47817                                  ;============================================================================
 47818                                  ; EXEPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 47819                                  ;============================================================================
 47820                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 47821                                  ; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 47822                                  
 47823                                  ;** EXEPATCH.ASM 
 47824                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47825                                  ;	Contains the foll:
 47826                                  ;
 47827                                  ;		- code to find and overlay buggy unpack code
 47828                                  ;		- new code to be overlayed on buggy unpack code 
 47829                                  ;		- old code sequence to identify buggy unpack code
 47830                                  ;
 47831                                  ;	Revision history:
 47832                                  ;
 47833                                  ;		Created: 5/14/90
 47834                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47835                                  
 47836                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47837                                  ;
 47838                                  ; M020 : Fix for rational bug - for details see routine header
 47839                                  ; M028 : 4b04 implementation
 47840                                  ; M030 : Fixing bug in EXEPACKPATCH (EXEC_CS is an un-relocated value)
 47841                                  ; M032 : set turnoff bit only if DOS in HMA.
 47842                                  ; M033 : if IP < 2 then not exepacked.
 47843                                  ; M046 : support for a 4th version of exepacked files.
 47844                                  ; M068 : support for copy protected apps.
 47845                                  ; M071 : use A20OFF_COUNT of 10.
 47846                                  ;
 47847                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47848                                  
 47849                                  PATCH1_COM_OFFSET	EQU	06CH
 47850                                  PATCH1_OFFSET		EQU	028H
 47851                                  PATCH1_CHKSUM		EQU	0EF4EH
 47852                                  CHKSUM1_LEN		EQU	11CH/2 ; 142
 47853                                  
 47854                                  PATCH2_COM_OFFSET	EQU	076H
 47855                                  PATCH2_OFFSET		EQU	032H
 47856                                  
 47857                                  	; The strings that start at offset 076h have two possible 
 47858                                  	; check sums that are defined as PATCH2_CHKSUM PATCH2A_CHKSUM
 47859                                  
 47860                                  PATCH2_CHKSUM		EQU	78B2H
 47861                                  CHKSUM2_LEN		EQU	119H/2
 47862                                  PATCH2A_CHKSUM		EQU	1C47H		; M046
 47863                                  CHKSUM2A_LEN		EQU	103H/2		; M046
 47864                                  
 47865                                  PATCH3_COM_OFFSET	EQU	074H
 47866                                  PATCH3_OFFSET		EQU	032H
 47867                                  PATCH3_CHKSUM		EQU	4EDEH
 47868                                  CHKSUM3_LEN		EQU	117H/2
 47869                                  
 47870                                  ;**	Data structure passed for ExecReady call
 47871                                  ;
 47872                                  ;struc ERStruc
 47873                                  ; .ER_Reserved:	resw	1	; reserved, should be zero
 47874                                  ; .ER_Flags:	resw	1
 47875                                  ; .ER_ProgName:	resd	1	; ptr to ASCIIZ str of prog name
 47876                                  ; .ER_PSP:	resw	1	; PSP of the program
 47877                                  ; .ER_StartAddr: resd	1	; Start CS:IP of the program
 47878                                  ; .ER_ProgSize:	resd	1	; Program size including PSP
 47879                                  ; .size:
 47880                                  ;endstruc
 47881                                  
 47882                                  ;DOSCODE SEGMENT
 47883                                  
 47884                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 47885                                  	; DOSCODE:B3DDh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 47886                                  
 47887                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47888                                  	; DOSCODE:B37Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 47889                                  
 47890                                  	; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47891                                  	; DOSCODE:C697h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 47892                                  
 47893                                  ; M028 - BEGIN
 47894                                  
 47895                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47896                                  ;
 47897                                  ;	Procedure Name		: ExecReady
 47898                                  ;
 47899                                  ;	Input			: DS:DX -> ERStruc (see exe.inc)
 47900                                  ;
 47901                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47902                                  
 47903                                  ExecReady:
 47904 000080E0 89D6                    	mov	si,dx			; move the pointer into a friendly one
 47905                                  	;;test	word [si+2],1
 47906                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47907 000080E2 F6440201                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; 1
 47908                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; COM or EXE ?
 47909 000080E6 7418                    	jz	short er_setver		; only setver for .COM files
 47910                                  
 47911                                  	;mov	ax,[si+8]
 47912 000080E8 8B4408                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]
 47913 000080EB 83C010                  	add	ax,10h
 47914 000080EE 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 47915                                  
 47916                                  	;mov	cx,[si+10]
 47917 000080F0 8B4C0A                  	mov	cx,[si+ERStruc.ER_StartAddr]   ; M030
 47918                                  	;mov	ax,[si+12]	; 11/04/2024
 47919 000080F3 8B440C                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_StartAddr+2] ; M030
 47920                                  
 47921                                  	;call	[ss:FixExePatch]
 47922 000080F6 36FF16[670D]            	call	word [ss:FixExePatch] ; 28/12/2022
 47923                                  	
 47924                                  	; 20/03/2024
 47925                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 47926 000080FB 36FF16[4612]            	call	word [ss:Rational386PatchPtr]
 47927                                  
 47928                                  er_setver:
 47929                                  	;;test	word [si+2],2		; Q: is this an overlay
 47930                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47931 00008100 F6440202                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_OVERLAY ; 2
 47932                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_OVERLAY
 47933 00008104 7518                    	jnz	short er_chkdoshi	; Y: set A20OFF_COUNT if DOS high
 47934                                  					; N: set up lie version first
 47935 00008106 1E                      	push	ds
 47936 00008107 56                      	push	si
 47937                                  	;lds	si,[si+4]
 47938 00008108 C57404                  	lds	si,[si+ERStruc.ER_ProgName]
 47939 0000810B E8DCEC                  	call	Scan_Execname1
 47940 0000810E E8EDEC                  	call	Scan_Special_Entries
 47941 00008111 5E                      	pop	si
 47942 00008112 1F                      	pop	ds
 47943                                  	;mov	es,[si+8]
 47944 00008113 8E4408                  	mov	es,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]
 47945 00008116 36A1[BB0E]              	mov	ax,[ss:SPECIAL_VERSION]
 47946                                  	;mov	[es:40h],ax ; 11/04/2024
 47947 0000811A 26A34000                	mov	[es:PDB.Version],ax
 47948                                  
 47949                                  er_chkdoshi:
 47950 0000811E 36803E[660D]00          	cmp	byte [ss:DosHasHMA],0	; M032: Q: is dos in HMA (M021)
 47951 00008124 741E                    	je	short er_done		; M032: N: done
 47952                                  
 47953                                  					; M068 - Start
 47954                                  	;mov	ax,[si+8]
 47955 00008126 8B4408                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]	; ax = PSP
 47956                                  
 47957                                  	;or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],4
 47958 00008129 36800E[8600]04          	or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],EXECA20OFF ; Set bit to signal int 21
 47959                                  					; ah = 25 & ah= 49. See dossym.inc 
 47960                                  					; under TAG M003 & M009 for 
 47961                                  					; explanation
 47962                                  	;;test	word [si+2],1
 47963                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47964 0000812F F6440201                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; 1
 47965                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; Q: COM file
 47966 00008133 7506                    	jnz	short er_setA20		; N: inc a20off_count, set 
 47967                                  					;    a20off_psp and ret
 47968                                     	; 07/03/2025
 47969                                  	;push	ds
 47970                                  	;mov	ds,ax			; DS = load segment of com file.
 47971                                  	;call	IsCopyProt ; !*!	; check if copy protected
 47972                                  	;pop	ds
 47973                                  
 47974                                  	; 07/03/2025 (MiniDOS 1.0)
 47975 00008135 36C606[8500]0A          	mov	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT],0Ah ; *!*
 47976                                  
 47977                                  er_setA20:
 47978                                  	; We need to inc the A20OFF_COUNT here. Note that if the count
 47979                                  	; is non-zero at this point it indicates that the A20 is to be 
 47980                                  	; turned off for that many int 21 calls made by the app. In 
 47981                                  	; addition the A20 has to be turned off when we exit from this 
 47982                                  	; call. Hence the inc.
 47983                                  
 47984 0000813B 36FE06[8500]            	inc	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT]		
 47985 00008140 36A3[6300]              	mov	[ss:A20OFF_PSP],ax	; set the PSP for which A20 is to be
 47986                                  					; turned OFF.
 47987                                  er_done:				; M068 - End
 47988 00008144 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 47989 00008146 C3                      	retn
 47990

 48000                                  ; MAIN ENTRY FOR DOS INITIALIZATION
 48001                                  ;

 48005                                  ; temp iret instruction

 48013 00008147 CF                      	iret
 48014                                  
 48015                                  ; 22/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48016                                  
 48017                                  ; pointer to the BIOS data segment that will be available just to the
 48018                                  ; initialization code
 48019                                  
 48020 00008148 7000                    InitBioDataSeg:	dw 70h ; KERNEL_SEGMENT = 0070h
 48021                                  
 48022                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48023                                  ; DOSCODE:B76Dh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 48024                                  
 48025                                  ; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48026                                  ; DOSCODE:CCE1h (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48027                                  
 48028                                  ; Convert AX from a number of bytes to a number of paragraphs (round up).
 48029                                  
 48030                                  ParaRound:
 48031 0000814A 83C00F                  	add	ax, 15
 48032 0000814D D1D8                    	rcr	ax, 1
 48033 0000814F D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1
 48034 00008151 D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1
 48035 00008153 D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1

 48045                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48046                                  ;
 48047                                  ; Procedure Name : WhatCPUType
 48048                                  ;
 48049                                  ; Inputs	 : none
 48050                                  ;
 48051                                  ; Outputs	 : AL = 0 if CPU <  286
 48052                                  ;		      = 1 if CPU == 286
 48053                                  ;		      = 2 if CPU >= 386
 48054                                  ;
 48055                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : AX
 48056                                  ;
 48057                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48058                                  
 48059                                  WhatCPUType:
 48060                                  	; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48061                                  	;get_cpu_type	; done with a MACRO which can't be generated > once
 48062                                  
 48063                                  	;CPUTYPE.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 48064                                  
 48065                                  ; Note: this must be a macro, and not a subroutine in the BIOS since
 48066                                  ; 	it is called from both CODE and SYSINITSEG.
 48067                                  ;
 48068                                  ;------GET_CPU_TYPE-----------------------------------May, 88 by M.Williamson
 48069                                  ;  Returns: AX = 0 if 8086 or 8088
 48070                                  ;              = 1 if 80286
 48071                                  ;              = 2 if 80386
 48072                                  
 48073                                  	; 04/11/2022
 48074                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB03h
 48075                                  
 48076                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48077                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0CCEDh
 48078                                  
 48079                                  Get_CPU_Type:	;macro
 48080 00008156 9C                      	pushf
 48081 00008157 53                      	push	bx			; preserve bx
 48082 00008158 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; init bx to zero
 48083                                  
 48084 0000815A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; 0000 into AX
 48085 0000815C 50                      	push	ax			; put it on the stack...
 48086 0000815D 9D                      	popf				; ...then shove it into the flags
 48087 0000815E 9C                      	pushf				; get it back out of the flags...
 48088 0000815F 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and into ax
 48089 00008160 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; mask off high four bits
 48090 00008163 3D00F0                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; was it all 1's?
 48091 00008166 740E                    	je	short cpu_8086		; aye; it's an 8086 or 8088
 48092                                  
 48093 00008168 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; now try to set the high four bits..
 48094 0000816B 50                      	push	ax
 48095 0000816C 9D                      	popf
 48096 0000816D 9C                      	pushf
 48097 0000816E 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and see what happens
 48098 0000816F 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; any high bits set ?
 48099 00008172 7401                    	jz	short cpu_286		; nay; it's an 80286
 48100                                  cpu_386:				; bx starts as zero
 48101 00008174 43                      	inc	bx			; inc twice if 386
 48102                                  cpu_286:				; just inc once if 286
 48103 00008175 43                      	inc	bx
 48104                                  cpu_8086:				; don't inc at all if 086
 48105 00008176 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx			; put CPU type value in ax
 48106 00008178 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore original bx
 48107 00008179 9D                      	popf
 48108                                  	
 48109                                  	;endm
 48110                                  
 48111                                  	; 04/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48112 0000817A C3                      	retn	; 19/09/2023
 48113                                  
 48114                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48115                                  %endif	; 28/12/2022

 48119                                  ; MAIN ENTRY FOR DOS INITIALIZATION
 48120                                  
 48121                                  	; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48122                                  	; DOSCODE:B779h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48123

 48127                                  
 48128                                  	; DOSCODE:BA57h (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS)
 48129                                  	; BIOSCODE:CF81h (Windows ME IO.SYS)
 48130

 48132                                  	; 22/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48133                                  	; 07/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 48134                                  	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 03/03/2018
 48135                                  	; 03/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48136                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 79A9h
 48137                                  DOSINIT:
 48138                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 7C77h
 48139                                  	;
 48140                                  	; Far call from SYSINIT
 48141                                  	; DX = Memory size in paragraphs
 48142                                  	; DS:SI = [DEVICE_LIST] (SYSINIT.S) 
 48143                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v2.0, 16/03/2018)
 48144                                  	;
 48145                                  	; ES:DI = ptr to BIOS communication block (sysinit3.s)
 48146                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v4.0, 20/04/2019)
 48147                                  
 48148 0000817B FA                              CLI
 48149 0000817C FC                              CLD
 48150                                  
 48151                                  	; 03/11/2022
 48152                                  	;push	dx ; 30/05/2019		; save parameters from BIOS
 48153                                  	
 48154                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48155                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48156                                  	;push	dx ; =*=		; save parameters from BIOS
 48157                                  	
 48158 0000817D 56                      	push	si
 48159 0000817E 1E                      	push	ds
 48160 0000817F 57                      	push	di			;save di (ptr to BiosComBlock)
 48161                                  
 48162 00008180 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			;bx:di = ptr to BiosComBlock
 48163                                  
 48164                                  ; First, move the DOS data segment to its final location in low memory
 48165                                  
 48166                                  	;;;mov	ax,0BF69h ; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS, file offset 7C7Fh
 48167                                  	;;mov	ax,0BC77h ; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS, file offset 79B1h
 48168                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48169                                  	;mov	ax,0D20Fh ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM, file offset 92FFh
 48170 00008182 B8[F285]                	mov	ax,MEMSTRT		; get offset of end of init code
 48171                                  
 48172                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48173 00008185 83C00F                  	add	ax,15			; round to nearest paragraph
 48174                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; boundary
 48175                                  	; 12/04/2024
 48176 00008188 24F0                    	and	al,0F0h
 48177                                  
 48178 0000818A 89C6                    	mov	si,ax			; si = offset of DOSDATA in current
 48179                                  					; code segment
 48180                                  	; 05/12/2022
 48181                                  	; 30/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48182                                  	;xor	si,si
 48183                                  	
 48184                                  	;mov	ax,cs
 48185                                  	;mov	ds,ax			; ds = current code segment
 48186                                  					; DS:SI now points to dosdata
 48187                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48188 0000818C 0E                      	push	cs
 48189 0000818D 1F                      	pop	ds
 48190                                  
 48191                                  	;mov	es,[cs:0BA49h] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, offset 7C8Eh 
 48192                                  	;mov	es,[cs:InitBioDataSeg]	; First access to DosDataSg in
 48193                                  					;  BData segment. Cannot use
 48194                                  					;  getdseg macro here!!!
 48195                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48196 0000818E 8E06[4881]              	mov	es,[InitBioDataSeg]
 48197                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48198                                  	;mov	es,[cs:InitBioDataSeg]  ; ds = cs !
 48199                                  
 48200                                  	;mov	es,[es:3]
 48201 00008192 268E060300              	mov	es,[es:DosDataSg]	; Get free location in low memory
 48202                                  
 48203 00008197 31FF                    	xor	di,di			; ES:DI now points to RAM data
 48204                                  
 48205                                  	;mov	cx,4970  ; Offset 0BA78h in MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
 48206                                  	;mov	cx,4976  ; 25/05/2019
 48207                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48208                                  	;mov	cx,4934	 ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 48209                                  	; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48210                                  	;mov	cx,4962

 49059                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49060                                  ;
 49061                                  ;	check_XMM: routine to check presence of XMM driver
 49062                                  ;
 49063                                  ;	Exit:   Sets up the XMM entry point in XMMcontrol in DOSDATA
 49064                                  ;
 49065                                  ;	USED:	none
 49066                                  ;
 49067                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49068                                  
 49069                                  check_XMM: ; proc near
 49070                                  ;
 49071                                  ; determine whether or not an XMM driver is installed
 49072                                  ;
 49073 00008479 50                      	push	ax
 49074                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_INSTALL_CHECK
 49075 0000847A B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 49076 0000847D CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 49077                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 49078                                  		; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 49079                                  		; AL <> 80h no driver
 49080 0000847F 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h			; Q: installed
 49081 00008481 751D                    	jne	short cXMM_no_driver	; N: set error, quit
 49082                                  ;
 49083                                  ; get the XMM control functions entry point, save it, we
 49084                                  ; need to call it later.
 49085                                  ;
 49086 00008483 53                      	push	bx
 49087 00008484 52                      	push	dx
 49088 00008485 1E                      	push	ds
 49089 00008486 06                      	push	es
 49090                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_FUNCTION_ADDR
 49091 00008487 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 49092 0000848A CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 49093                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 49094                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 49095                                  
 49096 0000848C 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 49097                                  
 49098 00008491 891E[4D10]              	mov	[XMMcontrol],bx
 49099 00008495 8C06[4F10]              	mov	[XMMcontrol+2],es
 49100                                  cXMMexit:
 49101 00008499 F8                      	clc
 49102 0000849A 07                      	pop	es
 49103 0000849B 1F                      	pop	ds
 49104 0000849C 5A                      	pop	dx
 49105 0000849D 5B                      	pop	bx
 49106 0000849E 58                      	pop	ax
 49107 0000849F C3                      	retn				; done
 49108                                  ;
 49109                                  ; set carry if XMM driver not present
 49110                                  ;
 49111                                  cXMM_no_driver:
 49112 000084A0 F9                      	stc
 49113 000084A1 58                      	pop	ax
 49114 000084A2 C3                      	retn

 49116                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49117                                  ;
 49118                                  ; Procedure Name : seg_reinit
 49119                                  ;
 49120                                  ; Inputs	 : ES has final dos code location
 49121                                  ;		   AX = 0 / 1
 49122                                  ;
 49123                                  ; Outputs	 : Patch in the sharer and other tables with seg in ES
 49124                                  ;		   if AX =0
 49125                                  ;		      if first entry
 49126                                  ;			 patch segment & offset of vectors with stub
 49127                                  ;			 and stub with segment in ES
 49128                                  ;		      else
 49129                                  ;			 patch stub with segment in ES
 49130                                  ;
 49131                                  ;		   else if AX = 1
 49132                                  ;			patch segment of vectors with segment in ES
 49133                                  ;
 49134                                  ; NOTE		 : This routine can be called at most twice!
 49135                                  ;
 49136                                  ; Regs Mod.	 : es, ax, di, cx, bx

 49138                                  
 49139 000084A3 00                      num_entry: db	0		; keeps track of the # of times this routine
 49140                                  				; has been called. (0 or 1)
 49141                                  
 49142                                  	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 5.0)
 49143                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BAB7h
 49144                                  	; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 6.21)
 49145                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BDA5h
 49146                                  
 49147                                  	; 23/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (ref: PCDOS 7.1)
 49148                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0D07Eh
 49149                                  
 49150                                  seg_reinit:	; proc	far

 49152

 49156                                  					; other tables with seg in ES.
 49157

 49159                                  	; cx = 0
 49160 000084AD 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx ; 0
 49161                                  	;cmp	ax,0

 49173                                  					;    segment in ES
 49174                                  					; Y: patch the vectors with stub

 49200                                  
 49201                                  dosinttabloop:

 49205 000084CA 47                      	inc	di

 49207 000084CC E2FB                    	loop	dosinttabloop

 49210                                  ; use the HMA, so we don't want to check CS

 49616                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49617                                  ;
 49618                                  ; 	Procedure Name	:	patch_in_nops
 49619                                  ;
 49620                                  ; 	Entry		: 	ES -> DOSDATA
 49621                                  ;
 49622                                  ;	Regs Mod	: 	cx, di
 49623                                  ;
 49624                                  ;	Description:
 49625                                  ;		This routine patches in 2 nops at the offsets specified in 
 49626                                  ;	patch_table. This basically enables the low mem stub to start 
 49627                                  ;	making XMS calls.

 49629                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------

 49780                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49781                                  
 49782                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 49783                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole. Under 3.0, the system
 49784                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code. The process data under 2.x will
 49785                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 49786                                  ;
 49787                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 49788                                  ; describing that data item.

 49883                                  ;; 16/07/2018
 49884                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 49885                                  ;; NOTE: INT 21H AH=52H !  (http://stanislavs.org/helppc/int_21-52.html)
 49886                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 49887                                  ;; INT 21,52 - Get Pointer to DOS "INVARS" (Undocumented)
 49888                                  ;;
 49889                                  ;;	AH = 52h
 49890                                  ;;
 49891                                  ;;	on return:
 49892                                  ;;	ES:BX = pointer to DOS "invars", a table of pointers used by DOS.
 49893                                  ;;		Known "invars" fields follow (varies with DOS version):
 49894                                  ;;
 49895                                  ;;	Offset Size		 Description
 49896                                  ;;
 49897                                  ;;	 -12   word   sharing retry count (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 49898                                  ;;	 -10   word   sharing retry delay  (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 49899                                  ;;	  -8   dword  pointer to current disk buffer (DOS 3.x)
 49900                                  ;;	  -4   word   pointer in DOS code segment of unread CON input;
 49901                                  ;;		      0 indicates no unread input (DOS 3.x)
 49902                                  ;;	  -2   word   segment of first Memory Control Block (MCB)
 49903                                  ;;	  00   dword  pointer to first DRIVE PARAMETER TABLE (A:) in chain
 49904                                  ;;	  04   dword  pointer to DOS System File Table (SFT)
 49905                                  ;;	  08   dword  pointer to $CLOCK device driver
 49906                                  ;;	  0C   dword  pointer to CON device driver
 49907                                  ;;	  10   byte   number of logical drives in system
 49908                                  ;;	  11   word   maximum bytes/block of any block device
 49909                                  ;;	  13   dword  pointer to DOS cache buffer header
 49910                                  ;;	  17 18bytes  NUL device header, first 4 bytes of device header
 49911                                  ;;		      point to the next device in device chain
 49912                                  ;;
 49913                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 49914

 50118 000000C8 [4507]0000              ShSU:		DW	BadCall,0  ; 14  ShSU

 50121                                  ;============================================================================
 50122                                  ; CONST2.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 50123                                  ;============================================================================
 50124                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 
 50125                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 50126                                  
 50127                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 50128                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50129                                  
 50130                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 50131                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 50132                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 50133                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 50134                                  ;
 50135                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 50136                                  ; describing that data item.
 50137                                  
 50138                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 50139                                  
 50140                                  ;
 50141                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 50142                                  ;
 50143                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 50144                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 50145                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 50146                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 50147                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 50148                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 50149                                  ;
 50150                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 50151                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 50152                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 50153                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 50154                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 50155                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 50156                                  ;   as EOF).
 50157                                  
 50158                                  ; Default SFTs for boot up
 50159                                  
 50160                                  		;PUBLIC	SFTABL
 50161                                  
 50162                                  SFTABL:	   ; LABEL   DWORD		; [SYSTEM] file table
 50163 000000CC FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link to next table
 50164 000000CE FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link seg to next table
 50165                                  		;dw 5 ; 24/03/2024
 50166 000000D0 0500                    		DW sf_default_number	; [SYSTEM] Number of entries in table
 50167                                  		;times 295 db 0 ; MSDOS 6.0 ; PCDOS 7.1  ; 24/03/2024
 50168 000000D2 00<rep 127h>            		times (sf_default_number*sf_entry_size) db 0
 50169                                  
 50170                                  ; the next two variables relate to the position of the logical stdout/stdin
 50171                                  ; cursor. They are only meaningful when stdin/stdout are assigned to the
 50172                                  ; console.
 50173                                  		; DOSDATA:01F9h (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 24/03/2024
 50174 000001F9 00                      CARPOS:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] cursor position in stdin
 50175 000001FA 00                      STARTPOS:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] position of cursor at beginning
 50176                                  					;	   of buffered input call
 50177 000001FB 00<rep 80h>             INBUF:		times 128 db 0		; [SYSTEM] general device input buffer
 50178 0000027B 00<rep 83h>             CONBUF:		times 131 db 0		; [SYSTEM] The rest of INBUF and console buffer
 50179                                  		; DOSDATA:02FEh (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1
 50180 000002FE 00                      PFLAG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] printer echoing flag
 50181 000002FF 00                      VERFLG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] Initialize with verify off
 50182 00000300 03                      CHARCO:		db 00000011b ; 3	; [SYSTEM] Allows statchks every 4 chars...
 50183                                  switch_character:
 50184 00000301 2F                      chSwitch:	db '/'			; UNUSED - obsolete datum, can be reused
 50185 00000302 00                      AllocMethod:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] how to alloc first(best)last
 50186 00000303 00                      fShare:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] TRUE => sharing installed
 50187 00000304 01                      DIFFNAM:	db 1			; [SYSTEM] Indicates when MYNAME has changed
 50188 00000305 20<rep 10h>             MYNAME:		times 16 db 20h		; [SYSTEM] My network name
 50189                                  
 50190                                  ; The following table is a list of addresses that the sharer patches to be
 50191                                  ; PUSH AX to enable the critical sections
 50192                                  
 50193                                  		; DOSDATA:0315h (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 24/03/2024
 50194

 50196                                  
 50197                                  CritPatch:	; LABEL WORD
 50198                                  
 50199                                  ;IRP sect,<critDisk,critDevice>

 50206                                  ;       dw OFFSET DOSDATA: redir_patch

 50210                                  ;

 50271 0000033C 0000                    PROC_ID:	dw 0		; PID for sharing (0 = local)
 50272 0000033E 0000                    USER_ID:	dw 0		; Machine for sharing (0 = local)
 50273 00000340 0000                    FirstArena:	dw 0		; first free block found
 50274 00000342 0000                    BestArena:	dw 0		; best free block found
 50275 00000344 0000                    LastArena:	dw 0		; last free block found

 50277 00000348 0000                    LASTENT:	dw 0		; Last entry for directory search
 50278 0000034A 00                      FAILERR:	db 0		; NZ if user did FAIL on I 24
 50279 0000034B 00                      ALLOWED:	db 0		; Allowed I 24 answers (see allowed_)
 50280 0000034C 00                      NoSetDir:	db 0		; true -> do not set directory
 50281 0000034D 00                      DidCTRLC:	db 0		; true -> we did a ^C exit
 50282 0000034E 00                      SpaceFlag:	db 0		; true -> embedded spaces are allowed in FC

 50398                                  ;============================================================================
 50399                                  ; MS_DATA.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 50400                                  ;============================================================================
 50401                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 50402                                  
 50403                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 50404                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 50405                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 50406                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 50407                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 50408                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 50409                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 50410                                  ; **********************************************************
 50411                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 50412                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 50413                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 50414                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 50415                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 50416                                  ; **********************************************************	
 50417                                  
 50418                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 50419                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50420                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 50421                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 50422                                  
 50423                                  ; 	ORG     0
 50424                                  
 50425                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 50426                                  
 50427                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 50428                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 50429 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 50430 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 50431                                  
 50432                                  ; The following areas are used as temp buffer in EXEC system call
 50433                                  
 50434                                  ; DOSDATA:03BEh
 50435                                  OPENBUF: ;times 64  dw	0
 50436 000003BE 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for name operations
 50437                                  RENBUF:	
 50438 0000043E 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for rename destination
 50439                                  
 50440                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 50441                                  SEARCHBUF:	
 50442 000004BE 00<rep 35h>             	times	53  db	0		; internal search buffer
 50443                                  DUMMYCDS:  ;times 88 db 0
 50444 000004F3 00<rep 58h>             	times	curdirLen db 0
 50445

 50447                                   
 50448                                  ; Temporary directory entry for use by many routines. Device directory
 50449                                  ; entries (bogus) are built here.

 50454                                  
 50455                                  ; WARNING..  do not alter position of NAME1 relative to DEVFCB
 50456                                  ; without first examining BUILD_DEVICE_ENT. Look carefully at DOS_RENAME
 50457                                  ; as well as it is the only guy who uses NAME2 and DESTSTART.
 50458                                  
 50459                                  NAME1:	
 50460 0000054B 00<rep Ch>                      times 	12 db	0		; File name buffer
 50461                                  NAME2:
 50462 00000557 00<rep Dh>              	times	13 db	0 		;
 50463                                  DESTSTART:

 50466                                  	;times	5  db	0
 50467 00000566 00<rep 5h>              	times	((dir_entry.size)-($-DEVFCB)) db 0
 50468                                  
 50469                                  ; End Temporary directory entry.
 50470                                  
 50471 0000056B 00                      ATTRIB:	db	0		; storage for file attributes
 50472                                  EXTFCB:	
 50473 0000056C 00                      	db	0		; TRUE => extended FCB in use
 50474                                  SATTRIB:

 51013                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:0CF5h
 51014                                  ; 24/03/2024
 51015                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0D6Bh
 51016                                  
 51017                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51018                                  ;
 51019                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 51020                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 51021                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 51022                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 51023                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 51024                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51025                                  ; Example:
 51026                                  
 51027                                  MAP_CASE:
 51028                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 51029                                  
 51030 00000D6B 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 51031                                  	;JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 51032                                  	;RETF
 51033                                  	; 24/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 51034                                  	;;;
 51035 00000D6D 720C                    	jb	short L_RET     ;Map no chars below 80H ever
 51036                                  	;;;
 51037                                  Map1:
 51038 00000D6F 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 51039 00000D71 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 51040 00000D72 53                      	PUSH	BX
 51041 00000D73 BB[FC0A]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 51042                                  FINISH:
 51043 00000D76 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 51044 00000D77 1F                      	POP	DS
 51045 00000D78 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 51046 00000D79 5B                      	POP	BX
 51047 00000D7A 1F                      	POP	DS
 51048                                  L_RET:	
 51049 00000D7B CB                      	RETF
 51050                                  
 51051                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE
 51052                                  
 51053                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51054

 51400                                  ; 24/03/2024
 51401                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0DDBh
 51402                                  
 51403                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51404                                  ;
 51405                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 51406                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 51407                                  ;
 51408                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 51409                                  ;
 51410                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 51411                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 51412                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 51413                                  ;
 51414                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51415                                  
 51416                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 51417                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 51418                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 51419                                  ;ELSE
 51420                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 51421                                  ;ENDIF
 51422                                  ;ENDM
 51423

 51841                                  
 51842                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51843                                  ;
 51844                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 51845                                  ;
 51846                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts
 51847                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the
 51848                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 51849                                  ;
 51850                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 51851                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 51852                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 51853                                  ;	   4. else 
 51854                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 51855                                  ;	   6. endif
 51856                                  ;	7. else
 51857                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 51858                                  ;	9. endif
 51859                                  ;
 51860                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51861                                  
 51862                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 51863                                  
 51864                                  ; DOSDATA:108Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 51865                                  
 51866                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 51867                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0F9Eh
 51868                                  
 51869                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51870                                  ;
 51871                                  ; DIVIDE BY 0 handler
 51872                                  ;
 51873                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51874                                  
 51875                                  ldivov:
 51876                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51877                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51878                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51879                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51880                                  i0patch:
 51881 00000F70 EB03                    	jmp	short divov_cont
 51882                                  
 51883 00000F72 E8E200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51884                                  divov_cont:
 51885 00000F75 2EFF2E[4C0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE]	; jmp to DOS
 51886                                  
 51887                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51888                                  ;
 51889                                  ; INT 20h Handler
 51890                                  ;
 51891                                  ; Here we do not have to set up the stack to return here as the abort call
 51892                                  ; will return to the address after the int 21 ah=4b call. This would be the
 51893                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 51894                                  ; will be restored then.
 51895                                  ;
 51896                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51897                                  
 51898                                  lquit:
 51899                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51900                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51901                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51902                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51903                                  i20patch:
 51904 00000F7A EB03                    	jmp	short quit_cont
 51905                                  
 51906 00000F7C E8D800                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51907                                  quit_cont:
 51908 00000F7F 2EFF2E[500F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+4]	; jump to DOS
 51909                                  
 51910                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51911                                  ;
 51912                                  ; INT 21h Handler
 51913                                  ;
 51914                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51915                                  
 51916                                  lcommand:
 51917                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51918                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51919                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51920                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51921                                  i21patch:
 51922 00000F84 EB03                    	jmp	short command_cont
 51923                                  
 51924 00000F86 E8CE00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51925                                  command_cont:
 51926 00000F89 2EFF2E[540F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+8]	; jmp to DOS
 51927                                  
 51928                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51929                                  ;
 51930                                  ; INT 25h
 51931                                  ;
 51932                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51933                                  
 51934                                  labsdrd:
 51935                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51936                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51937                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51938                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51939                                  i25patch:
 51940 00000F8E EB03                    	jmp	short absdrd_cont
 51941                                  
 51942 00000F90 E8C400                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51943                                  absdrd_cont:
 51944 00000F93 2EFF2E[580F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+12]	; jmp to DOS
 51945                                  
 51946                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51947                                  ;
 51948                                  ; INT 26h
 51949                                  ;
 51950                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51951                                  
 51952                                  labsdwrt:
 51953                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51954                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51955                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51956                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51957                                  i26patch:
 51958 00000F98 EB03                    	jmp	short absdwrt_cont
 51959                                  
 51960 00000F9A E8BA00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51961                                  absdwrt_cont:
 51962 00000F9D 2EFF2E[5C0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+16]	; jmp to DOS
 51963

 51972                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51973                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51974                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51975                                  i27patch:
 51976 00000FA2 EB03                    	jmp	short sr_cont

 51979                                  sr_cont:
