 52024                                  lirett:
 52025                                  	iret
 52026                                  
 52027                                  %endif
 52028                                  
 52029                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52030                                  ;
 52031                                  ; LowIntXX:
 52032                                  ;
 52033                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 52034                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 52035                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 52036                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 52037                                  ;
 52038                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 52039                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 52040                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 52041                                  ;
 52042                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 52043                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 52044                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 52045                                  ;
 52046                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52047                                  
 52048                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52049                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0FEEh
 52050                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:10DBh)
 52051                                  
 52052 00000FC0 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 52053 00000FC4 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 52054                                  
 52055                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52056                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 52057                                  %if 0
 52058                                  DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 52059                                  %endif
 52060                                  
 52061                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 52062                                  LowInt23:
 52063                                  					; save the return address that is on
 52064                                  					; the stack
 52065 00000FC8 2E8F06[C00F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 52066 00000FCD 2E8F06[C20F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 52067                                  
 52068 00000FD2 CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 52069                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52070                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52071                                  
 52072 00000FD4 E88000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52073                                  
 52074 00000FD7 2EFF2E[C00F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 52075                                  
 52076                                  
 52077                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 52078                                  LowInt24:
 52079                                  					; save the return address that is on
 52080                                  					; the stack
 52081 00000FDC 2E8F06[C40F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 52082 00000FE1 2E8F06[C60F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 52083                                  
 52084 00000FE6 CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 52085                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52086                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52087                                  
 52088 00000FE8 E86C00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52089                                  
 52090 00000FEB 2EFF2E[C40F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 52091                                  
 52092                                  
 52093                                   
 52094                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 52095                                  LowInt28:
 52096 00000FF0 CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 52097                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52098                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52099                                  
 52100 00000FF2 E86200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52101                                  
 52102 00000FF5 CB                      	retf
 52103                                  
 52104                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 52105                                  
 52106                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52107                                  ;
 52108                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 52109                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 52110                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 52111                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 52112                                  ;
 52113                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 52114                                  
 52115                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52116                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1024h
 52117                                  
 52118                                  disa20_xfer:
 52119 00000FF6 E84800                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 52120                                  
 52121                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 52122                                  
 52123                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 52124                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 52125                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 52126                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 52127                                  
 52128 00000FF9 FA                      	cli
 52129 00000FFA 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 52130                                  
 52131                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52132                                  	;;;
 52133 00001000 36C606[C011]00          	mov     byte [ss:INDOS_FLAG],0
 52134                                  	;;;
 52135                                  
 52136 00001006 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 52137 00001008 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 52138 0000100A FB                      	sti
 52139                                  
 52140 0000100B 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 52141 0000100C 56                      	push	SI
 52142 0000100D 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 52143 0000100F 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 52144 00001011 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 52145 00001013 CB                      	retf
 52146                                  
 52147                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52148                                  ;
 52149                                  ; M003:
 52150                                  ;
 52151                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 52152                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning
 52153                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 52154                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for
 52155                                  ; more info.
 52156                                  ;
 52157                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that
 52158                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's
 52159                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 52160                                  ;
 52161                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52162                                  
 52163                                  disa20_iret:
 52164 00001014 E82A00                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 52165 00001017 FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 52166                                  
 52167                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52168                                  	;;;
 52169 0000101B FE0E[C011]              	dec	byte [INDOS_FLAG]
 52170                                  	;;;
 52171                                  
 52172 0000101F 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 52173 00001023 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 52174 00001027 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 52175                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 52176 00001029 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 52177                                  	
 52178                                  ; 25/03/2024
 52179                                  %if 0
 52180                                  	mov	AX,[NSP]
 52181                                  	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 52182                                  	mov	AX,[NSS]
 52183                                  	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 52184                                  %else
 52185                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52186                                  	;;;
 52187                                  	;les	ax, dword ptr ds:NSS
 52188 0000102C C406[F005]              	les	ax,[NSS]
 52189 00001030 8C06[8405]              	mov	[USER_SP],es
 52190 00001034 A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],ax
 52191                                  	;;;
 52192                                  %endif
 52193 00001037 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 52194 00001038 5B                      	pop	BX
 52195 00001039 59                      	pop	CX
 52196 0000103A 5A                      	pop	DX
 52197 0000103B 5E                      	pop	SI
 52198 0000103C 5F                      	pop	DI
 52199 0000103D 5D                      	pop	BP
 52200 0000103E 1F                      	pop	DS
 52201 0000103F 07                      	pop	ES
 52202                                  lirett:		; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52203 00001040 CF                      	iret
 52204                                  
 52205                                  ;**************************************************************************
 52206                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line
 52207                                  ;
 52208                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in
 52209                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 52210                                  ;
 52211                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA
 52212                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled
 52213                                  ;	USES	NOTHING
 52214                                  ;
 52215                                  ;**************************************************************************
 52216                                  
 52217                                  XMMDisableA20:
 52218 00001041 53                      	push	bx
 52219 00001042 50                      	push	ax
 52220                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 52221 00001043 B406                    	mov	ah,6
 52222 00001045 2EFF1E[4D10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 52223 0000104A 58                      	pop	ax
 52224 0000104B 5B                      	pop	bx
 52225 0000104C C3                      	retn
 52226                                  
 52227                                  ; The entry point in the BIOS XMS driver is defined here.
 52228                                  
 52229                                  XMMcontrol:
 52230 0000104D 00000000                	dd	0
 52231                                  
 52232                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52233                                  ; 24/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52234                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:107Fh
 52235                                  ;;;
 52236 00001051 00000000                	dd	0
 52237                                  SC_STATUS:
 52238 00001055 0000                    	dw	0
 52239                                  ;;;
 52240                                  
 52241                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52242                                  ;
 52243                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 52244                                  ;
 52245                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in
 52246                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 52247                                  ;
 52248                                  ;	ENTRY: none
 52249                                  ;
 52250                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 52251                                  ;		
 52252                                  ; 	USES : NONE
 52253                                  ;
 52254                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52255                                  
 52256                                  ; 19/09/2023
 52257                                  ;LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 52258                                  ;	dw	00080h
 52259                                  ;	dw	00000h
 52260                                  ;
 52261                                  ;HighMemory:	; label dword
 52262                                  ;	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 52263                                  ;	dw	0FFFFh
 52264                                  
 52265                                  	; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52266                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1085h
 52267                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:116Fh)
 52268                                  
 52269                                  EnsureA20ON:
 52270 00001057 9C                      	pushf
 52271 00001058 1E                      	push    ds
 52272 00001059 06                      	push	es
 52273 0000105A 51                      	push	cx
 52274 0000105B 56                      	push	si
 52275 0000105C 57                      	push	di
 52276                                  
 52277                                  	; 19/09/2023
 52278                                  	;lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 52279                                  	;les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 52280                                  
 52281                                  	; 25/03/2024 
 52282                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 52283                                  	;;;
 52284 0000105D 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 52285 0000105F 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 52286 00001061 4E                      	dec	si
 52287 00001062 BF9000                  	mov	di,90h	; 0FFFFh:0090h	; HighMemory
 52288 00001065 8EC6                    	mov	es,si
 52289 00001067 BE8000                  	mov	si,80h	; 0000h:0080h	; LowMemory
 52290                                  	;;;	
 52291                                  
 52292 0000106A B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 52293 0000106D FC                      	cld
 52294 0000106E F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 52295                                  
 52296 00001070 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 52297                                  EA20_RET:
 52298 00001072 5F                      	pop	di
 52299 00001073 5E                      	pop	si
 52300 00001074 59                      	pop	cx
 52301 00001075 07                      	pop	es
 52302 00001076 1F                      	pop	ds
 52303 00001077 9D                      	popf
 52304 00001078 C3                      	retn
 52305                                  
 52306                                  EA20_OFF:
 52307                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 52308                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 52309                                  
 52310 00001079 53                      	push	bx
 52311 0000107A 50                      	push	ax
 52312                                  
 52313                                  ; 25/03/2024
 52314                                  %if 0
 52315                                  	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 52316                                  	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 52317                                  	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 52318                                  	mov	ax,cs
 52319                                  	mov	ss,ax
 52320                                  %else
 52321                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52322                                  	;;;
 52323 0000107B 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 52324 0000107D 2E8C16[6C0F]            	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ss
 52325 00001082 2E8926[6E0F]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 52326 00001087 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 52327                                  	;;;
 52328                                  %endif
 52329 00001089 BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 52330                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 52331                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 52332 0000108C B405                    	mov	ah,5
 52333 0000108E 2EFF1E[4D10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 52334 00001093 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 52335 00001095 740E                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 52336                                  
 52337                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 52338                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 52339                                  	;  25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52340                                  	;;;
 52341 00001097 2E8E16[6C0F]            	mov	ss,[cs:SS_Save]
 52342                                  	;;;
 52343 0000109C 2E8B26[6E0F]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 52344                                  
 52345 000010A1 58                      	pop	ax
 52346 000010A2 5B                      	pop	bx
 52347                                  
 52348 000010A3 EBCD                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 52349                                  
 52350                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 52351 000010A5 B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 52352 000010A7 CD10                    	int	10h
 52353 000010A9 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 52354 000010AB 7405                    	je	short XMMcont		; Y: do not change mode
 52355                                  	;xor	ah,ah ; 0		; set video mode
 52356                                  	;mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text
 52357                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52358                                  	;;;
 52359 000010AD B80200                  	mov     ax,2
 52360                                  	;;;
 52361 000010B0 CD10                    	int	10h
 52362                                  XMMcont:
 52363                                  	;mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 52364                                  	;xor	al,al			; page 0
 52365                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52366                                  	;;;
 52367 000010B2 B80005                  	mov     ax,500h
 52368                                  	;;;
 52369 000010B5 CD10                    	int	10h
 52370                                  	
 52371 000010B7 BE[1911]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 52372 000010BA 0E                      	push	cs
 52373 000010BB 1F                      	pop	ds
 52374 000010BC FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 52375                                  XMMprnt:
 52376 000010BD AC                      	lodsb
 52377 000010BE 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'			; indicates end of XMMERRMSG
 52378 000010C0 7409                    	jz	short XMMStall		; function 0Eh
 52379 000010C2 B40E                    	mov	ah,0Eh
 52380 000010C4 BB0700                  	mov	bx,7
 52381 000010C7 CD10                    	int	10h
 52382 000010C9 EBF2                    	jmp	short XMMprnt
 52383                                  
 52384                                  XMMStall:
 52385 000010CB FB                      	sti				; allow the user to warm boot
 52386 000010CC EBFD                    	jmp	short XMMStall		; M006 - End

 52565                                  ; DOSDATA:12CFh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 52566                                  
 52567                                  ; first and second DOS patches
 52568                                  ;	Non-console device read/write (system calls 3Fh and 40h)
 52569                                  ;
 52570                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 2 locations, one for read, one for write
 52571                                  ;	DVRDLP:
 52572                                  ;	DVWRTLP:
 52573                                  ;
 52574                                  ;
 52575                                  ; 036h	lds	si,SS:[????]				  ; ThisSFT
 52576                                  ;	lds	si,si+7 				  ; sf_devptr
 52577                                  ; 0E8h	call	????		<- "simulate" int28 event ; DSKSTATCHK
 52578                                  
 52579                                  DOSP1_ID:	db	036h,0C5h,036h
 52580                                  DOSP1_THISSFT:	db	036h,005h,0C5h,074h,007h,0E8h
 52581                                  DOSP1_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP1_ID
 52582                                  
 52583                                  		db	90h, 90h
 52584                                  
 52585                                  DOSP12_ID:	db	036h,0C5h,036h
 52586                                  DOSP12_THISSFT:	db	036h,005h,0C5h,074h,007h,0E8h
 52587                                  DOSP12_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP1_ID
 52588                                  
 52589                                  ; DOSDATA:12E3h
 52590                                  
 52591                                  ; Third/Fourth DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) from console
 52592                                  ;
 52593                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 1 location
 52594                                  ;	GETBUF:
 52595                                  ;
 52596                                  ; 051h	push	cx	<- begin special int28 mode
 52597                                  ;	push	es
 52598                                  ;	push	di
 52599                                  ;	mov	dx,???? ; offset dosgroup:CONBUF
 52600                                  ;	call	????	; $STD_CON_STRING_INPUT
 52601                                  ;	pop	di
 52602                                  ;	pop	es
 52603                                  ; 059h	pop	cx	<- end special int28 mode
 52604                                  
 52605                                  DOSP3_ID:	db	051h,006h,057h,0BAh
 52606                                  DOSP3_CONBUF:	db	029h,002h,0E8h
 52607                                  DOSP3_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP3_ID
 52608                                  		db	09Ah,0E3h,05Fh,007h	; ???? , pop di, pop es
 52609                                  DOSP4_ID:	db	059h			; pop cx
 52610                                  DOSP4_ID_OFF	equ	(DOSP4_ID - DOSP3_ID)
 52611                                  	
 52612                                  ; DOSDATA:12EFh
 52613                                  
 52614                                  ; Fifth DOS patch - System call 40h (Write) to console
 52615                                  ;
 52616                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 1 location
 52617                                  ;
 52618                                  ;		push	cx
 52619                                  ;      WRCONLP: lodsb
 52620                                  ;		cmp	al,1Ah
 52621                                  ;		jz	????
 52622                                  ;		call	????	<- "simulate" int28 event
 52623                                  ;		loop	WRCONLP
 52624                                  ;      CONEOF:	pop	ax
 52625                                  
 52626                                  DOSP5_ID:	db	051h			; push cx
 52627                                  		db	0ACh,03Ch,01Ah,074h,005h
 52628                                  		db	0E8h			; call
 52629                                  DOSP5_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP5_ID
 52630                                  
 52631                                  ; DOSDATA:12F6h
 52632                                  
 52633                                  ; Seventh DOS patch - System call entry, patch USER_ID with VMid for share
 52634                                  ;
 52635                                  ; Code in disp.asm, 1 location
 52636                                  ;
 52637                                  ;
 52638                                  ;	mov [SaveDS],ds
 52639                                  ;	mov [SaveBX],bx
 52640                                  ;	mov bx,cs
 52641                                  ;	mov ds,bx
 52642                                  ;	inc [indos]
 52643                                  ;	xor ax,ax
 52644                                  ;	mov [USER_ID],AX	<- Patch to set USER_ID to VMID
 52645                                  
 52646                                  DOSP7_ID:	db	02Eh,08Ch,01Eh
 52647                                  DOSP7_SAVEDS:	db	07Eh,05h		; mov [SaveDS],ds
 52648                                  		db	02Eh,089h,01Eh
 52649                                  DOSP7_SAVEBX:	db	07Ch,05h		; mov [SaveBX],bx
 52650                                  		db	08Ch,0CBh		; mov bx,cs
 52651                                  		db	08Eh,0DBh		; mov ds,bx
 52652                                  		db	0FEh,006h
 52653                                  DOSP7_INDOS:	db	0CFh,002h		; inc [indos]
 52654                                  		db	033h,0C0h		; xor ax,ax
 52655                                  DOSP7_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP7_ID
 52656                                  
 52657                                  ; DOSDATA:130Ah
 52658                                  
 52659                                  ; Eighth DOS patch - OWNER check in handle calls. For share, need to NOP test
 52660                                  ;
 52661                                  ; Code in handle.asm, 1 location in routine CheckOwner
 52662                                  ;
 52663                                  ;
 52664                                  ;
 52665                                  ;	push	ax
 52666                                  ;	mov	ax,ss:[USER_ID]     <- patch to XOR AX,AX to set zero
 52667                                  ;	cmp	ax,es:[di.sf_UID]   <- NOP
 52668                                  ;	pop	ax
 52669                                  ;	jz	????
 52670                                  
 52671                                  DOSP8_ID:	db	050h			; push ax
 52672                                  		db	036h,0A1h
 52673                                  DOSP8_USER_ID:	db	0EAh,002h		; mov  ax,ss:[USER_ID]
 52674                                  		db	026h,03Bh,045h		; cmp  ax,es:[di+2F]
 52675                                  DOSP8_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP8_ID
 52676                                  		db	02Fh,058h		; pop  ax
 52677                                  
 52678                                  ; DOSDATA:1314h
 52679                                  
 52680                                  ; 10th, 11th, 12th DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) in raw mode
 52681                                  ;
 52682                                  ;   Take RAW read to STDIN SFT and turn it into a polling loop doing
 52683                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.
 52684                                  ;
 52685                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 3 locations
 52686                                  ;
 52687                                  ;   DVRDRAW:
 52688                                  ;	    PUSH    ES
 52689                                  ;	    POP     DS
 52690                                  ;   ReadRawRetry:				<- Patch 10
 52691                                  ;	    MOV     BX,DI
 52692                                  ;	    XOR     AX,AX			<- Reenter #2
 52693                                  ;	    MOV     DX,AX
 52694                                  ;	    call    SETREAD
 52695                                  ;	    PUSH    DS				<- Reenter #1
 52696                                  ;	    LDS     SI,[THISSFT]
 52697                                  ;	    call    DEVIOCALL
 52698                                  ;	    MOV     DX,DI
 52699                                  ;	    MOV     AH,86H
 52700                                  ;	    MOV     DI,[DEVCALL.REQSTAT]
 52701                                  ;	    TEST    DI,STERR
 52702                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 52703                                  ;	    call    CHARHARD
 52704                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 52705                                  ;	    OR	    AL,AL
 52706                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 52707                                  ;	    CMP     AL,3
 52708                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDFERR
 52709                                  ;	    POP     DS
 52710                                  ;	    JMP     ReadRawRetry
 52711                                  ;
 52712                                  ;   CRDFERR:
 52713                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 11
 52714                                  ;   DEVIOFERR:
 52715                                  ;	    LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 52716                                  ;	    jmp     SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 52717                                  ;
 52718                                  ;   CRDROK:
 52719                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 12
 52720                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 52721                                  ;	    ADD     DI,[CALLSCNT]
 52722                                  ;	    JMP     SHORT ENDRDDEVJ3
 52723                                  
 52724                                  DOSP10_ID:		db	006H,01FH
 52725                                  DOSP10_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52726                                  DOSP10_LOC:		db	08BH,0DFH
 52727                                  DOSP10_REENT2_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52728                                  			db	033H,0C0H,08BH,0D0H,0E8H
 52729                                  DOSP10_ID_LEN		equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52730                                  			db	0DFH,00EH
 52731                                  DOSP10_REENT1_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52732                                  			db	01EH,036H,0C5H,036H,036H,005H,0E8H,0AFH,00EH
 52733                                  			db	08BH,0D7H,0B4H,086H,036H,08BH,03EH
 52734                                  DOSP10_PACKVAL_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52735                                  			db	009H,003H
 52736                                  			db	0F7H,0C7H,000H,080H,074H,019H,0E8H,047H,017H
 52737                                  			db	08BH,0FAH,00AH,0C0H,074H,010H,03CH,003H,074H,003H
 52738                                  			db	01FH,0EBH,0CFH
 52739                                  DOSP11_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52740                                  			db	05FH
 52741                                  DOSP11_REENT_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52742                                  			db	036H,0C4H,03EH,036H,005H,0E9H,0A1H,004H
 52743                                  
 52744                                  DOSP12_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52745                                  			db	05FH,08BH,0FAH
 52746                                  ; DOSDATA:1353h
 52747                                  
 52748                                  ; 13th DOS patch - Actually a SYSINIT patch. Patches the stack fault code
 52749                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.
 52750                                  ;
 52751                                  ;	    Sets focus to current VM so user can see fatal message.
 52752                                  ;
 52753                                  ;
 52754                                  ;	l0: lodsb		<- Setfocus here
 52755                                  ;	    cmp al, '$'
 52756                                  ;	    je l1
 52757                                  ;	    mov bl, 7
 52758                                  ;	    mov ah, 0Eh
 52759                                  ;	    int 10h
 52760                                  ;	    jmp l0
 52761                                  ;	l1: jmp $
 52762                                  
 52763                                  DOSP13_ID:	db	0ACh			; l0: lodsb
 52764                                  		db	03Ch,024h		;     cmp al, '$'
 52765                                  		db	074h,008h		;     je l1
 52766                                  		db	0B3h,007h		;     mov bl, 7
 52767                                  		db	0B4h,00Eh		;     mov ah, 0Eh
 52768                                  		db	0CDh,010h		;     int 10h
 52769                                  		db	0EBh,0F3h		;     jmp l0
 52770                                  		db	0EBh,0FEh		; l1: jmp $
 52771                                  DOSP13_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP13_ID
 52772

 52827                                  ;
 52828                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 52829                                  ;
 52830                                  ; The dos 4.X redir requires that country_cdpg is at offset 0122ah. Any new
 52831                                  ; data variable that is to be added to DOSDATA must go in between Mark3
 52832                                  ; COUNTRY_CDPG if it can. 
 52833                                  ;
 52834                                  ; MARK3 SHOULD NOT BE > 122AH

 52836                                  ; As of 9/6/90, this area is FULL!

 52842                                  ; DOSDATA:122Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 52843                                  
 52844                                  ; 09/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52845                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52846                                  
 52847                                  ; 17/01/2024
 52848                                  ; MSDOS 5.0  MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52849                                  ; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52850                                  ; 09/03/2024
 52851                                  ; Windows ME    IO.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52852                                  
 52853                                  ; The following table is used for DOS 3.3
 52854                                  ;DOS country and code page information is defined here for DOS 3.3.
 52855                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCountry is 1 (USA).
 52856                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCodepage is 850.
 52857                                  
 52858                                  ; country and code page information
 52859                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52860                                  COUNTRY_CDPG:	; label  byte
 52861 00001132 0000000000000000        	db   0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0		; reserved words
 52862 0000113A 5C434F554E5452592E-     	db   '\COUNTRY.SYS',0		; path name of country.sys
 52862 00001143 53595300           
 52863                                  	;db   51 dup (?)
 52864 00001147 00<rep 33h>             	times 51 db 0
 52865                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 52866                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 52867                                  ;  ifdef JAPAN
 52868                                  ;	dw   932			; system code page id (JAPAN)
 52869                                  ;  endif
 52870                                  ;  ifdef TAIWAN
 52871                                  ;	dw   938			; system code page id (TAIWAN)
 52872                                  ;  endif
 52873                                  ;  ifdef KOREA
 52874                                  ;	dw   934			; system code page id (KOREA IBM)
 52875                                  ;  endif
 52876                                  ;else
 52877 0000117A B501                    	dw   437			; system code page id
 52878                                  ;endif
 52879                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 52880 0000117C 0600                    	dw   6				; number of entries
 52881                                  COUNTRY_CDPG_76: ; COUNTRY_CDPG + 76 
 52882 0000117E 02                      	db   SetUcase  ; 2		; Ucase type
 52883 0000117F [FA0A]                  	dw   UCASE_TAB			;pointer to upper case table
 52884 00001181 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52885 00001183 04                      	db   SetUcaseFile  ; 4		; Ucase file char type
 52886 00001184 [7C0B]                  	dw   FILE_UCASE_TAB 		;pointer to file upper case table
 52887 00001186 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52888 00001188 05                      	db   SetFileList ; 5		; valid file chars type
 52889 00001189 [280D]                  	dw   FILE_CHAR_TAB 		;pointer to valid file char tab
 52890 0000118B 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52891 0000118D 06                      	db   SetCollate	; 6		; collate type
 52892 0000118E [FE0B]                  	dw   COLLATE_TAB		;pointer to collate table
 52893 00001190 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52894 00001192 07                      	db   SetDBCS	; 7		;AN000; DBCS Ev			2/12/KK
 52895 00001193 [000D]                  	dw   DBCS_TAB			;AN000;pointer to DBCS Ev table	2/12/KK
 52896 00001195 0000                    	dw   0				;AN000; segment of pointer	2/12/KK
 52897 00001197 01                      	db   SetCountryInfo  ; 1	; country info type
 52898 00001198 2600                    	dw   NEW_COUNTRY_SIZE		; extended country info size

 52901                                  ;	......
 52902                                  ;else

 52911 000011A5 2C00                    	db   ',',0			; thousand separator

 53010                                  
 53011                                  ;============================================================================
 53012                                  ; MPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1993)
 53013                                  ;============================================================================
 53014                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 53015                                  
 53016                                  ;mpatch.asm -- holds data patch location for callouts 
 53017                                  ; -- allocate cluster in rom.asm
 53018                                  ;
 53019                                  ; This area is pointed to by OffsetMagicPatch[609h] in fixed DOS data.
 53020                                  ; Currently, this location is used only by magicdrv.sys's patch to
 53021                                  ; cluster allocation, however it can be expanded to be used by other
 53022                                  ; patches. This is important since we have an easy-access pointer to
 53023                                  ; this location in OffsetMagicPatch. Magicdrv.sys is guaranteed to
 53024                                  ; only patch out a far call/retf, so any space after that could be
 53025                                  ; used as a patch by using OffsetMagicPatch+6. See rom.asm on how
 53026                                  ; to call out here.
 53027                                  ;
 53028                                  ; Currently, we allocate only the minimum space required for the 6
 53029                                  ; byte magicdrv patch, so if you change the dos data, you may want
 53030                                  ; to reserve space here if your new data will be position dependent
 53031                                  ; and would prohibit growing of this table.
 53032                                  ;
 53033                                  ;history	-	created 8-7-92 by scottq
 53034                                  ;		-	added Rational386PatchPtr 2-1-93 by jimmat
 53035                                  ;
 53036                                  ;Exported Functions
 53037                                  ;==================
 53038                                  ;MagicPatch     -       callout patched by magidrv.sys for cluster allocations
 53039                                  
 53040                                  ; DosData Segment
 53041                                  
 53042                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 53043                                  
 53044                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53045                                  
 53046                                  ; Rational386PatchPtr points to either a RET instruction (80286 or less) or
 53047                                  ; a routine to fix buggy versions of the Rational DOS Extender (80386 or
 53048                                  ; greater). Added to this file because it needed to be somewhere and is
 53049                                  ; 'patch' related.
 53050                                  
 53051                                  Rational386PatchPtr:
 53052 00001246 0000                    	dw	0	; points to patch routine or RET instr.
 53053                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53054                                  
 53055                                  ; 25/03/2024
 53056                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1340h
 53057                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - DOSDATA:133Eh)
 53058                                  
 53059                                  ; 07/03/2025
 53060                                  %if 0
 53061                                  MagicPatch:
 53062                                  ;MagicPatch proc far
 53063                                          retf            ;default is to just return to allocate
 53064                                          nop             ;however, this code will be patched
 53065                                          nop             ;by magicdrv.sys to
 53066                                          nop             ; call far ?:?     
 53067                                          nop             ; retf or perhaps just jmp far
 53068                                          nop             ;retf/nop take one byte, so we need six instructions
 53069                                                          ;for 6 byte patch
 53070                                  ;MagicPatch endp
 53071                                  %endif
 53072                                  
 53073                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53074                                  
 53075                                  ;DosData Ends
 53076                                  
 53077                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:136Ah
 53078                                  ;
 53079                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 53080                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1346h
 53081                                  
 53082                                  ;; Windows ME IO.SYS
 53083                                  ;; db 12 dup(0)
 53084                                  
 53085                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - DOSDATA:1344h)

 53110                                  ; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 53111                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 53112                                  DOSDATAEND equ $
 53113                                  DOSDATASIZE equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4962 for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 53114                                  					; = 4970 for MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS
 53115                                  MSDAT001E equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4934 for PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
